La señora Manuela es ama de casa, pero a la vez en su casa tiene una tienda de víveres, vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas hidratantes y más productos, tiene 3 hijos, desde hace 23 años empezó el negocio el papá fue quien les ayudó cuando recién se casaron el les dio el capital para que tengan como ayudarse, en su casa ha acondicionado un espacio tipo kiosco, en los actúales momentos han atravesado por dificultades y los créditos de la Fundación han sido de gran ayuda para no dejar caer su  negocio, el esposo se dedica a trabajos eventuales, en fincas y en fabricas de ladrillos es poco lo que gana, con este nuevo crédito la señora Manuela podrá abastecer el negocio no tiene necesidad de salir a la ciudad le visitan los proveedores de productos, les va bien en las ventas y con eso está ayudando a sus hijos en el estudio y tiene que sacar las ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar, desde muy temprano está en pie para abrir su tienda y no hay hora fija en cerrar, lo único que desea nuestra socia es cumplir los sueños de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela P. is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) communal bank which meets in Los Bajos de Montecristi, Manabí province. Manuela is a housewife but in addition to that she has a grocery store where she stocks rice, sugar, hydrating beverages and other products. She has three children. She started her business 23 years ago and it was her father who helped her out with the initial capital when she got married so that they would have a means of support. A space in her house was set up like a sales kiosk. Currently, they have gone through some difficult times and loans from the Foundation have permitted them to keep the business going. Her husband is a temporary worker on large farming estates and in brick factories but he earns very little. Manuela will use this new funding to stock the store. She doesn’t need to go to the city for goods, distributors come to her. Sales are good and profits have been helpful to pay for the children’s education plus she has to earn enough to cover household expenses. She is up very early in the morning to open for business and she doesn’t have a fixed closing time; all she wants is that her family’s dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries like: rice, sugar, beverages.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 49 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijas en sus haber. Juntas vive en la majestuosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su casa propia. Marcelina, descubrió desde su adolescencia que en un futuro próximo quería dirigir las cosas, y que lo haría diferente a la de sus padres, que en ese entonces eran agricultores, es por ello que los ayudaba en la siembra y cosecha de su cultivo de cacao. Hoy vende comida y se siente satisfecha por lo que ha logrado. Se siente jefa de su negocio y  toma decisiones idóneas, es por ello que sus ventas van mejorando paulatinamente, además sus clientes se van satisfechos por la buena sazón de sus platos típicos. Por lo general recibe la ayuda de sus hijas, pero de todas maneras necesita de ayuda para que le puedan facilitar en la atención a sus clientes. Su clave de éxito es hacer los preparativos desde las 4:00 de la mañana y su punto de venta se encuentra localizado en la esquina de su propia localidad. Marcelina aspira en el futuro tener una fuente de soda, para que así pueda aumentar su clientela y sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente satisfecho por el respaldo que le brindan.
Con e crédito que solicita le servirá para que compre muebles para su negocio, y el resto lo invertirá en los insumos principales, como: carne, aceite, condimentos, verduras para satisfacer el paladar de sus comensales.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a 49 year old woman with two daughters under her care. They live together in the majestic Cuzqueñ jungle, which is located in the Quimbiri area. They have their own house there. As an adolescent Marcelina discovered that in the near future she wanted to run things. And, she would do it differently than her parents. At that time they were farmers, and she helped them plant and harvest their cacao crop. Now she sells food, and she is pleased with what she has achieved. She is the boss of her business, and she makes suitable decisions. That is why her sales are gradually improving. Also, her customers are very happy with the good seasoning of her typical dishes. Her daughters generally help her. At any rate, she needs help to be able to wait on her customers. Her key to success is making preparations starting at four in the morning. She sells on the corner of her own location. Marcelina aspires to have a soda fountain in the future. That way she could increase her customers and her sales. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to keep making each of her payments. She is pleased with the support that is being offered to her. She will use the requested loan to buy furniture for her business. She will use the rest of it for basic supplies like meat, oil, condiments, and vegetables to satisfy her diners’ palates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture, products, and supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen M. A. lives in Vehari, a small city in the  Punjab, Pakistan. She has four children and they are getting their education.
Yasmeen has applied for a loan for her business of sewing clothes, With the loan she will buy a new electric sewing machine. This will help her to improve her sewing because her current sewing machine needs replacement. Yasmeen started this business to financially support her husband whose income is not enough to meet the basic needs of the family. Yasmeen works very hard because she wants to provide her children with the best education possible.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio A. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 59 years old. Florencio is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Florencio owns & operates a business buying scrap metal & other used-products such as bottles, plastics and empty plastic containers and selling it to the junk shops. Florencio has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florencio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Florencio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Florencio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more scrap items to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Florencio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of his child. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba S. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 6 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle a toujours remboursé ses prêts sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de produits divers tels des légumes, des épices, et des condiments pour cuisine. Elle a installé un table en fortune dans le marche du village où elle mène son petit commerce. Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises et pouvoir ainsi accroître son activité. Elle participe à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba S. is a 54-year-old woman who is married and the mother of eight children.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kandia since June 1, 2007 and has received six successive loans.  She has always repaid her loans without a problem.  Coumba is developing a small business for various goods, such as vegetables, spices, and condiments.  She has set up a makeshift table at the village market where she runs her small business.  This loan will enable her to do better in stocking up on merchandise and thus to grow her business.  She is helping to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her capital in order to develop her business further

loans.name: Eilen

texts.en:
Eilen L. is from the town of Banga. She is 37 years old. Eilen is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eilen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Eilen has been engaged in her business for over 15 years. She also started raising hogs for fattening. She hopes for her new venture to succeed.

Eilen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eilen has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eilen is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and feed for the pigs. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eilen from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial R. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. He is 30 years old. Marcial is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Marcial owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marcial has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marcial joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Marcial is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marcial from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Elvator B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Our God Is Able. Elvator is 34 years old, single, and has three children who range from 11 to 17 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty. 

For four years, she has been selling drugs (medications) in Redlight Market, Paynesville (outside of Monrovia, Liberia).

She plans to use her 5,000 LRD portion of this 25,000 LRD group loan to buy more drugs (medications). She describes herself as a patient woman.

Her dream is to improve her business and build a clinic.

loans.use: To buy drugs (medications)

loans.name: Yasira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yasira es casada, tiene 2 niños: Yader de 9 años en 3er grado de primaria y Yasnari de 4 añitos en 3er nivel de preescolar; trabaja para el EMPA como Auxiliar de contabilidad desde hace 8 años.

Esta solicitando  su 8vo credito con el objetivo de realizar mejoras a su casa repellandola y poniendo las ventanas, ya que le hace falta instalarlas y de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia. 

Cabe señalar que Yasira ha ido levantando su casa poco a poco con los creditos obtenidos en AFODENIC, por lo cual se siente muy agradecida con la institucion y espera que en el futuro le siga apoyando para terminar su sueño de tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Yasira is married and has 2 children: Yader, who is 9 years old and in 3rd grade, and Yasnari, who is 4 years old and is in the 3rd level of pre-school. She has worked for EMPA as a junior accountant for 8 years. She is requesting her 8th loan, which she plans to use to make improvements to her house including plastering and putting in windows. She needs to have the windows installed so that she can provide better comfort and security for her family. It is worth noting that Yasira has been improving her home gradually with loans obtained from AFODENIC, and for this she feels very grateful to the institution. She hopes that in the future they will continue to support her so that she can realize her dream of having a decent home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plaster and put in windows

loans.name: Bukora Twimukye, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hard working and cooperative M. Mary has been operating a small restaurant from Kihihi, where she prepares milk tea served with other local meals. This has seen her earn 320,000 Ugandan shillings per month, which is better than her former business of selling second hand clothes.
This married mother of six children is working hard to see that all her children acquire education. Therefore, she is taking up a loan to help her expand her business and thus be able to earn more revenue. She also earns extra profits totalling to 100,000 shillings from the sale of bananas.

She belongs to Bukora Twimukye group of members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant supplies.

loans.name: Mwikuyu Muthami

texts.en:
Mwikuyu Muthami is a 47-year-old businesswoman. She and her husband Ikuu have six children, all under 18. Mwikuyu has been operating a tea kiosk business for the past six years in Mwingi Town in the eastern part of Kenya. Ikuu also operates a business, and that generates extra income which helps them support their family.

Mwikuyu is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD. Her monthly income is Kshs. 4,000. She plans to open a greengrocer's shop and buy eggs in bulk to resell. With the extra profit generated from her business, she intends to pay school fees for her children and also construct a good house. Her hopes and dreams are to construct a bigger premises for the business, educate her children and improve her family living standard.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Review Mwikuyu Muthami from  Kenya

loans.use: To start a greengrocer's shop and buy eggs in bulk to resell

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Cevallos de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Éxito, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Rosa, ella tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y que aun vive con ella junto con su esposa y su pequeña hija de 4 años que para nuestra socia es lo más lindo por ser su única nieta.

Se dedica a la venta de zapatos  para todo tipo, tiene un puesto entre las calles Chile y 9 De Octubre en la ciudad de Portoviejo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 17h00. Su mercadería se la traen desde Guayaquil cada vez que ella realiza los pedidos. Lo que más vende ella son zapatos deportivos de hombre ya que son bonitos y baratos.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos la mitad para zapatos deportivos y el resto en las otras variedades tanto para damas como para caballeros y niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta porque los créditos  le han ayudado mucho en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un almacén.
texts.en:
The 'Damas de Éxito' (Successful Ladies) community bank meets every two weeks in the Cevallos neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely-populated, marginal, urban area of the city.

Here we find Rosa who is a 55 year old single mother.  She has one grown-up son who still lives with her together with his wife and 4 year-old daughter.  For Rosa she is the most beautiful thing because she is her only granddaughter.

Rosa sells all types of shoes.  She has a stall between 'Chile' and '9 de Octubre' streets in the city of Portoviejo.  She works every day from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  She receives her goods from Guayaquil whenever she makes orders.  What she sells most of are men's sports shoes because they are nice and also cheap.

This loan will be used to buy shoes.  Half will be sports shoes and the rest with be other styles for ladies, gents and children.  Rosa has been a member of her community bank since it started and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot in her business.

Her dream is to own a warehouse.

loans.use: To buy sports shoes and other styles for ladies, gents and children

loans.name: Glendy Siomara

texts.es: La señora Glendy Elías Mejía  se dedica a la venta de productos de comestibles y venta de refacciones como licuados panes con pollo jamón frijol, choco frutas, también vende papas fritas, choco frutas,  ella necesita este crédito para poder  invertirlo en su negocio productos de comestible  y así poder crecer ya que es una señora emprendedora que le gusta negociar y junto a su esposo,  luchan para  poder darle un mejor futuro a sus 4 hijos ; tienen deseos de superarse por lo que en su tiempo libre ayudan  en el negocio tanto a atender a las personas que los visitan como a ordenar el producto  doña Glendy adicional de eso vende productos de catalogo que le sirve como una entrada extra y así lograr sus metas, ella empezó con un pequeño negocio  en el año 1998 que poco a poco fue creciendo y con la ayuda de su familia  ha logrado sostener su negocio que se ubica a las cercanías de la escuela local de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Glendy Elías Mejía sells groceries and snacks like blended fruit drinks, bread with ham, chicken and beans, chocolate covered fruit; she also sells fried potatoes.

She needs funding to buy food items for the store so that the business can grow.  She is an enterprising woman who likes business and, together with her husband, fights to provide a better future for their four children who want to do better so they help out in their free time both tending to customers who come by the store and by placing orders for products.In addition to this, Glendy sells catalogue based products that is an extra source of income to help her reach her goals.  She started out with a small store in 1998 which gradually grew and with her family’s help she has managed to keep the business, which is located near a local school, afloat.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ober

texts.es: Ober tiene 32 años, vive con su esposa y su hija en su casa que es propia. Desde hace más de 5 años, se ha dedicado a ofrecer el servicio de construcción de inmuebles. Desde entonces, trabaja entre el ladrillo y el cemento, levantado pared y techando. A lo largo de estos años ha logrado ganar experiencia en este trabajo, por lo que ahora tiene prestigio entre los clientes y eso le favorece para trabajos futuros. Hoy puede contrata la mano de obra de albañiles, quienes le ayudarán en esta actividad, por lo que él se encargará de la supervisión y asegurar que todo el proyecto de construcción termine bien. Este trabajo le ha permitido capitalizar rápidamente sus ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida por lo que seguirá  trabajando en este rubro con miras a crecer en la calidad de su servicio y en la adquisición de nuevos clientes. Es el crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas de construcción y madera que le sirve en estos trabajos.
texts.en:
Ober is thirty-two and lives with his wife and daughter in a house he owns.  For more than five years he has been in the real estate construction business.  He works with brick and cement, building walls and doing roofing.  Over the years he has managed to gain experience in his industry so now he's got prestige among his clients, which bodes well for him for future jobs.

Nowadays Ober can hire bricklayers, who help him on the job; he supervises and makes sure the projects get done well.  This work has allowed him to build up his income quickly and improve his quality of life; he'll keep on working in the field with an eye toward growing the quality of his service and gaining new clients.  

This is loan number ten with MFP, and Ober is very glad to know that he has financial support.  He also appreciates being part of his village bank because all the members are responsible and tight-knit.  In addition, he appreciates everyone who will loan to him it will be such a big help to the progress of his business.  He plans to invest his loan in constructions tools and wood to use on the job.

loans.use: To buy tools and wood for his real estate construction business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 37 años, convive con Janet, de 27 años. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Ángelo, de 12 y Denis, de 7 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). La siembra de café, caigua y plátanos, es su principal actividad económica. Ya tiene 3 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Su objetivo, es lograr obtener un café de buena calidad, ya está trabajando en ello, sus cultivos de café que cada día son mejores, los comercializa en la asociación de agricultores de su localidad, pero en época de campaña agrícola, acopia el café de los demás agricultores, y los comercializa en la ciudad de Villa Rica. Pero Juan, también se dedica a la producción de CD, y DVD industriales, cada año en el mes de diciembre, viaja a la capital del país, para trabajar en la producción de los mismos. Ahora, él quiere incursionar en la crianza de cuyes, los que en la actualidad tienen mayor demanda. Esté es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como secretario de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho por el trabajo conjunto que realizan constantemente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 50 cuyes, que cuestan 20 soles cada uno, asimismo invertirá en la construcción de la granja donde los criará.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old.  He lives with 27 year-old Janet.  They have two children: 12 year-old Ángel and 7 year-old Denis.  They live in their own home in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (central Peruvian jungle).  Juan's main business activity is growing coffee, 'caigua' (a type of native cucumber) and bananas.  He has been farming for 3 years. His goal is to obtain a good-quality coffee.  He is already working on this.  His coffee crops are better every day.  He sells them in the Farmers Association in his district but during the farming season he also harvests the coffee of other farmers and sells it in the city of Villa Rica.

Juan also makes industrial CDs and DVDs.  Every year in the month of December he travels to the country's capital to work on their production.  Now he would also like to break into the business of raising guinea pigs which are in high demand right now.

This is Juan's fourth loan from MFP and, as secretary of his community bank, he feels satisfied with the joint work that his group is constantly doing.  He will use his loan to buy 50 guinea pigs which cost 20 Peruvian soles each.  He will also invest in building a farm where he can raise them.

loans.use: To buy 50 guinea pigs and material to build a farm for these animals

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en:
Ofelia J. is from the village of Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Ofelia is the leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ofelia is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the third loan taken by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Zubadahan's Group

texts.en:
Zubadahan T., 54, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised five children, the youngest daughter is at school and the others are employed. Fifteen years ago, with an initial investment of 1000 soms, Zubadahan started to sell convenience goods. Now her monthly profit is 5000 soms. She has applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase more goods to increase her inventory. In the future, Zubadahan wants to expand her business and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo D. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old. Amparo is married and has 3 adult children. Amparo owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & biscuits in the local community. Amparo has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amparo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amparo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. Amparo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Amparo from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk foods

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is married with eight adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables to local community members. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for house repair. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for house repair

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio B. is from the village of Turod in Quezon, Isabela. He is 39 years old. Rogelio is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living Rogelio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rogelio has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011 Rogelio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rogelio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Her husband is also a businessman.  Jeanne has had her boutique for 3 years and employs 1 person to help her.

Jeanne will use this loan to purchase more bags to sell.  If she is successful and able to make a profit from the use of her loan, she would like to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags to sell

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en: Rochell, a 41-year-old mother of two children, aged six and four, lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Married to a farmer, Rochelle earns a living through hog-raising and farming. She helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops and also raises pigs for later sale in their backyard. Rochelle does her best to help sustain her family and will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to have a profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Giovanni Horacio

texts.es: En la ciudad de Managua. El  Sr. Giovanni Horacio V. Avalos, se dedica  arduamente a laborar de conductor, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace diez años, es casado y con dos hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. Una de las necesidades que el  Sr. Giovanni  atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que a tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. Es por ese motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, verjas y pintura, Para realizar la mejora de  la vivienda realizando  el levantamiento de una pared en su casa de habitación y pintarla. Por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra, le proporcionara a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en: In Managua, Giovanni Horacio V. A.is a hardworking driver, a job which he has held for the past ten years.  He is married and provides for his two children to allow them to prosper. Giovanni needs to improve the conditions of his home, and has decided to begin a construction project for the house. He is seeking a loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy construction materials, including stone, sand, paint and metal barring, To begin the project, he will erect a new wall in the house and paint it. He feels that this project will offer better living conditions for his children and a more dignified living space for his family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (stone, sand, paint and metal barring)

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Mi nombre es Elena G., soy de la comunidad de San Francisco, tengo 31 años de edad, vivo en union libre desde hace 10 años, hace poco terminamos de hacer nuestra casa porque anteriormente vivia en casa de mis padres, los cuatro hijos que tengo van a la escuela primaria y son muchos los gastos que hay porque los maestros a cada rato nos piden cosas para que los niños las lleven, el negocio que tengo es la cria de borregos, yo pedi el prestamo para comprar borregos y poderlos criar, no se me hace muy dificil cuidar los animales es muy sencillo para mi porque como tengo un corral ahi los echo y solo les llevo su comida y agua para que tomen, el corral esta techado entonces se protegen los cambios de clima que pueda haber, yo espero que cuando sea tiempo de venderlos me los paquen bien, muchas veces la gente como ve que uno tiene apuros para vender los animales se encajan y los quieren pagar barato y de esa forma ya no tengo las ganancias que deberia de tener. Mis deseos son comprar las cosas que hacen falta en la casa para poder vivir mejor.
texts.en: My name is Elena Garcia, I am from the San Francisco community, and am 31 years old.  I have been in a common law relationship for the last 10 years.  Recently we finished building our own house since we had previously been living in my parent's home.  The four children that I have go to elementary school and there are many expenses because the teachers constantly ask for things that the children need to bring to school.  I make a living by raising sheep.  I am asking for the loan to be able to buy sheep and be able to raise them.  Taking care of the animals is simple for me because I have a corral and I leave them there and only take food and water for them to eat and drink.  The corral has a roof and this way they are protected from the weather.  I hope that when it comes time to sell them they will fetch a good price.  Many times when people see that one is in a hurry to sell the animals, they take advantage and want to buy them cheaper and I don't make the profit that I should make. My wishes are to purchase the things that I still need for my house in order to live better.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for raising and ground corn.

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es:
La alcancía Cristo Rey D. Nicolás D. Piérola participan nueve personas muy emprendedoras que se esfuerzan mucho por darles lo mejor a los suyos y alcanzar sus metas trazadas, RoxA. es una D. ellas, es madre D. un pequeño niño, ella trabaja desD. hace dos años en un hotel cerca a su casa con la finalidad D. apoyar a su esposo quien es taxista D. su propio carrito. 
RoxA. venD. además productos D. belleza y joyitas ofreciendo sus productos a sus amistades y conocidos; algunas veces sus clientes le pagan con destiempo lo que requiere del capital a fin D. cumplir en sus pagos como consultora. Con los ingresos D. estas ventas y/o trabajo ha logrado adquirir algunos electrodomésticos y la adquisición D. su propio terreno que aún falta por construir; también para la educación a su hijo. El crédito que requiere será para invertir en perfumes, joyitas y productos D. belleza ya que está cerca la celebración por el día D. la madre y tiene regulares pedidos además con una pequeña parte del dinero apoyará a su esposo para hacer algunos arreglos al auto usado que adquirieron con la finalidad D. venderlo y comprar uno nuevo. Empezar a construir su vivienda es una D. sus metas que espera alcanzar a fin D. tener mejor comodidad para los suyos.
texts.en:
The Cristo Rey D. Nicolás D. Piérola (Christ the King of Nicolás D. Piérola) communal bank has nine very enterprising members who make a great effort to give their families all the best and to reach the goals they have set. RoxA. is one of these members. She is the mother of a small boy, and for two years she has worked at a hotel near her house in order to support her husband, who is a taxi driver with his own vehicle.

RoxA. also sells beauty products and jewelry to friends and acquaintances. Sometimes her customers make late payments, so she needs capital to make her own payments as a consultant. With the income from these sales and/or her work, she has managed to buy some household appliances and her own piece of land, where she has not yet built a house. She has also paid for her son's education.

The loan RoxA. needs will be for buying perfumes, jewelry and beauty products since it is near Mother's Day, and she has regular orders as well. She will use a small part of the money to help her husband make some repairs to the used car they bought in order to sell so they can buy a new one. Starting to build her house is one of the goals she hopes to reach so her family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes, jewelry and beauty products

borrowers.first_name: Zegarra Calle De Garcia Mery Cristina

loans.name: Sabtoria

texts.en:
Sabtoria is married and works hard to support 4 children. She lives in the Philippines. Sabtoria buys and sells bananas and vegetables. She has been in this business for fifteen years.

Sabtoria has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bananas and vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and buy a delivery truck.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bananas and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Benadeta

texts.en:
Benadeta is 40 years old and a single mother of five children aged 18 to 3 years. 

She is a hard-working woman and the sole bread winner for her family. 

Benadeta lives in a two-room rented house with her children in Hioma, Uganda. Her goal is to educate her children. 

For eight years she has been selling produce. She started by selling bananas then later diverted into the sale of maize and beans. 

Benadeta needs a loan to purchase cereals like maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La señora Nancy y su esposo tienen una renta de jubilación. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de matriculas universitarias de su hijo menor. Vive en anticretico ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos pero sus  dos hijos mayores  ya son casados. Es clienta antigua de IMPRO desde el año 2008 y con buen historial de pagos.
texts.en: Nancy and her husband live off a retirement pension.  She seeks credit to cover the tuition payment for her youngest son to attend college.  She lives in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz, and her other two sons are married and live independently.  She has been a member of IMPRO since 2008 and has always met her payment obligations.

loans.use: to pay college tuition for her son

loans.name: Lucy Graciela

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Tiene educación secundaria. 
Desde hace un  año trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  su préstamo  anterior, que fue por S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en la crianza de animales domésticos como vacuno y ovino, también cuenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas, productos de abarrotes y a la artesanía como chullos, medias, guantes, gorros, escarpines etc., realmente toda una empresaria.
Por otro lado, también se dedica a capacitar a mujeres que viven cerca de la zona.
Con su  nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará veinte corderos para su respectivo engorde por dos / tres meses.  En el negocio la ayuda su hija.  Su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Arequipa.
Su sueño es mejorar los ganados y tener un local propio de artesanía para producir en cantidad y con mejor  calidad las prendas.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the “Virgen de Concepción” communal bank located in Ayrumas Carumas in Acora District, Province and Department of Puno.  She is 36 years old, married and has two school age children.  She completed secondary school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last year.  Her previous loan was for 300 new soles and she used it to raise domestic animals like cattle and sheep.  She also relates that she sells fruit, groceries and crafts like knit caps, socks, mittens, caps, booties, etc.  In reality, she’s quite the businesswoman.  On the other hand, she also trains women who live near the area.

She will use the new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy 20 lambs to raise for two to three months.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  Her husband works in the city of Arequipa.

Her dream is to improve the livestock and have her own crafts shop to produce the items of clothing in quantity and of better quality.

What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality and the earnings she makes on savings.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep to raise.

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en:
Andresita is 52 years old and married with three children.

Andresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling marine products in the Philippines. She requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sea cucumbers and shark fins to sell.

Andresita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 12 years and also earns income from food vending.

Andresita aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more marine products to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar y picantería que es como un restaurant pero mas tradicional, ella prepara comidas como cuy al horno, chancho al horno, rocoto relleno entre otros platos, al socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de bar y picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo,verduras y fideos y también gaseosa y cerveza al por mayor.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yolanda belongs to the communal bank "Illary III."  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

Yolanda is 41 year old, single, and has 2 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her bar/restaurant business.  In her eatery,  she serves traditional dishes.  She prepares meals such as roasted guinea pig, roasted pork, stuffed peppers, and other dishes.  She works from 9am until 6pm, and through this business she provides for her children.  Yolanda wants to expand her restaurant business.  She requests a loan to buy products to cook such as: meat, chicken, vegetables, and noodles.  She also wants to buy soft drinks and beer at wholesale.

Yolanda is pleased to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy products to cook such as: meat, chicken, vegetables, and noodles, and also to buy soft drinks and beer at wholesale.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of increasing her sales volume in the future.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera, es Licenciada en Enfermería y su esposo es Doctor, tiene 4 hijos y un sobrino que mantener, esta hace 18 años en Finca, tiene una botica y una tienda, ella expresa toda su gratitud hacia Finca ya que en los momentos mas difíciles le apoyo, cuando su hermana falleció hace varios años con la ayuda de Morenita (Lucinda - fundadora de FINCA Perú) hicieron un banco con el nombre de su hermana “María Antonieta”, al fallecer su hermana ella se hizo cargo de su sobrino a quien en la actualidad le mantiene, ella invertirá en productos variados para su bodega. Su sueño es tener otra bodega y por eso trabajara mas y ahorrara.
texts.en: María is a member of the Primavera Community Bank, has a degree in Nursing, and her husband is a doctor. She has four children and a nephew to take care of, she has been with FINCA for eighteen years, and has a pharmacy and a store. She is extremely grateful for FINCA since the organization has helped her through some of the most difficult times. When her sister passed away several years ago, Morenita (Lucinda, the founder of FINCA Peru) helped her to make a bench with her sister’s name, María Antonieta. When her sister passed away, María took charge of her nephew, and she still cares for him. She will invest in various products for her store. Her dream is to have another store, and so will work more and save.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her working capital to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia nació en la provincia del Calca. Actualmente, Delia tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Delia vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a elaboración de pasteles, tortas, bocaditos y otras cosas más, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio y donde el taller está equipada con las necesidades básicas. Ya son 22 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Delia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, leche, huevos, mantequilla, frutas, cocoa y otras cosas más.   

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Delia was born in Calca province.  She is 49, married, and they have three children.

Delia lives in the same city where she was born and where she has her business.  She makes cakes, tortes, pastries,  and other things.  In the house she has a small workshop  that is equipped with all basic necessities for the business.  She has had this business for 22 years and it’s going very well.

Now Delia needs the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, eggs, butter, fruit, cocoa, and other items.


The Milenium III communal bank meets once a month in Cusco.  Cusco is known as a tourist and commercial area and for its traditional fiesta of Inti Raymi.  It is also where you can find one of the seven wonders of the world, “Machupicchu".

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, eggs, butter, fruit, cocoa and more

loans.name: Sinoko A Group

texts.en:
Justus is the facilitator of the Sinoko A group. Justus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Justus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
Justus takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate his children and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Justus had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Justus was only able to harvest four bags of maize on half an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Justus will invest in livestock rearing and educate his children.
In 2012, the members of Sinoko A group will each plant plots between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph above, Justus is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
La señora Clara Luz tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y tres hijos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica desde hace doce años a sembrar maíz, esta actividad la aprendió de su padrastro. Clara Luz debe adquirir los insumos necesarios para que su cultivo pueda desarrollarse, por lo que debe trasladarse a la ciudad en busca de ellos el recorrido tarda unas dos horas de ida y vuelta a la casa en autobús.

Ella solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para la compra de insumos agrícolas, para el cultivo de maíz y darle seguimiento al desarrollo del cultivo de ajonjolí que ya tiene sembrado. Con el préstamo ella pretende comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez para conseguir precios más bajos y estará segura de dar sus cultivos un manejo a tiempo, de esta forma tendrá una mejor producción.

Al incrementar la producción, ella tendrá más ingresos, por lo que estaría asegurando la alimentación de su familia y el pago a tiempo de su préstamo. Clara Luz ahorrara de las ganancias que reciba de la venta de su cultivos y comprar tres vacas lecheras, para tener otra fuente de  ingresos y enviar a sus hijos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Clara Luz, 49, lives with her life companion and three children.  She’s a very hardworking woman.  She’s been farming corn for the last 12 years.  She learned this activity from her step-father.  Clara Luz must acquire the necessary supplies so that her crops can develop and must travel to the city in search of them, a round trip from home that takes about two hours by bus.

She’s asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy farming supplies for her corn crops and to follow up on the development of her sesame crops that she’s already planted.  With the loan she intends to buy all the supplies at one time so that she can get lower prices and be sure to provide proper care to her plants on time so that production will be better.

Increasing production will lead to more income which will allow her to insure her family’s food needs and the timely repayment of her loan.  Clara Luz will save some of the profits she earns from the sale of her crops to buy three dairy cows to have an additional source of income and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam, D. cuarenta y cinco años D. edad, tiene su negocio al Occidente del país cerca a una D. las principales terminales D. buses D. la ciudad, su grupo familiar lo conforma su esposo quien es empleado, y tres hijos: Jenifer, José y Mauricio, al menos Jenifer con sólo 16 años ya trabaja y aporta a la economía D. éste hogar, los demás por ahora sólo estudian. Miriam mujer trabajadora y responsable desD. hace muchos años se vío en la necesidad D. vender mariscos para colaborarle a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar, todas las mañanas desD. las 5 am, compra a los pescadores su producto fresco y lo revenD. en mercado D. la localidad o incluso ambulantemente en colonias cercanas al mercado, es muy preferida por sus clientes por tener siempre producto D. primera y por ello últimamente su demanda ha incrementado en cuanto al camarón D. río y D. mar, langosta y pescado conocido como “boca colorada”, por ello y con experiencia crediticia ha tomado la mano D. INTEGRAL para poder contar con un crédito que le permita desarrollarse aún mas con su negocio y así también espera mejore la calidad D. vida D. su familia.-
texts.en:
Ana Miriam, 45, has her business in the west of the country near one of the city’s main bus terminals.  Her family unit consists of her husband who is employed and three children: Jenifer, José and Mauricio.  Jenifer, 16, works and contributes to the home’s economy; the others are students for now.

Miriam is a hardworking, responsible woman who many years ago found herself needing to sell seafood to help her husband support the household.  She goes out every morning at 5am to buy fresh product directly from the fishermen and then resells it in her local market or door to door in neighborhoods near the market.  She is preferred by her customers because she always has first quality product so demand has increased with respect to river and sea shrimp, lobster and a fish known as “boca colorada” [red snapper].  Because of this and with credit experience she has taken INTEGRAL’s hand to get a loan that will permit her to develop still more with her business as well as improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy river and sea shrimp, lobster and fish known as "boca colorada."

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж вместе с сыном находится на заработках в России. Сама Саломат занимается торговлей овощей на рынке. Она в этой области пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки болгарского перца, чаки, томата, салатов, помидоров и зелени.
texts.en: Salomat lives in the J.Rumy district.  She is 32 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband and son are both working in Russia.  Salomat is involved in selling vegetables at the market and has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of Bulgarian peppers, chaka, salads, tomatoes and greens.

loans.use: to purchase Bulgarian peppers, chaka, salads, tomatoes and greens

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has four adult children. 
To make a living, Pacencia operates a fishing business, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been in this business for over 35 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Pacencia joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas has operated his metal and welding business in Naivasha town for the last 12 years. He is 47 years old, married to Roselyne and they have two children, who go to school.  
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his second loan. He paid off all his previous loan amount well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of metals for sale, so as to sustain his business.
In the future, Thomas hopes to invest largely in the metal and welding business and open up other garages in Naivasha town and other places.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of metals for sale

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is from the village of Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 37 years old. Aurea is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Aurea owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aurea has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Aurea joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Aurea is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 22-years-old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells various kinds of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and support her family. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Scovia's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and take good care of her family's hygiene and health.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 55 years old and married to Ann. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 6,500, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Bernard will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya and has been in active farming for 30 years with her current farm produce of maize, beans and tobacco going to the local market. She is age 53 and married with nine children. All her children are adults save for the last born who is age 12 and still schooling. Besides farming, Rose takes care of elderly people in one of their local homes.

Rose has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats for a venture into dairy farming. She adds that the income from the dairy business will take care of the education of the last-born child in addition to providing for other basic needs.

She sees animal diseases as the main challenge coupled with high input costs.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a forty-four-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of eight children. Mary runs a green grocery in Oloitoktok. She has been in the business for one year now and gets a monthly income of about eleven thousand five hundred shillings.

This will be Mary’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more foodstuffs for her grocery shop. With the profit that she will get she wants to expand her greengrocer shop. In future she wants to continue to expand her shop and invest in farming practices.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Jane, a 36 year old farmer from Sisiya village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She started farming five years ago on a five acre plot she acquired. On the farm, she has eight dairy cows and a small garden equipped with an irrigation kit. 

Jane is seeking a KES 70,000 loan which she will use to pay for farm inputs and hired labour in order to grow more crops on the horticulture farm.

It takes a lot for a smallholder farmer to risk limited resources to expand a farm business. With your help, Jane will be able to settle the high cost of farm inputs necessary for expansion. 

A significant portion of the profit will be ploughed back into the business to fuel growth as she sets a good foundation for her children.

loans.use: to grow more crops on her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Phoebe Adnel

texts.en:
Phoebe Adnel is 27 years old and married with three children, one child whom is still in school, Phoebe Adnel works very hard to provide for them.

Phoebe Adnel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, noodles, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Phoebe Adnel has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Phoebe Adnel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, noodles, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa sells food from local market in Guayaquil. Her spot in the market is quite large, which allows her to sell rice, sugar and other products at large and small quantities. She started the business with only $150 in capital. As time passes she introduces new items to her inventory such as cleaning products, fruits and vegetables. Rosa is hoping that she can use the loan to buy her products in larger quantities and also invest in meats to sell from her stand. She is a single mother with four children, 3 of which are in school. She is 32 and moved to Guayaquil after living further inland in Azuay. She completely depends on the business to provide a living for herself and her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new items such as vegetables and cleaning products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Madam Mary sells fabrics, children's wear and ladies' underwear. She is a beneficiary of Kraban Support Foundation's TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $775.00 from Kiva. She is hardworking and capable of paying back.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina is a 42-year-old mother of four. Her husband works in the country harvesting corn. She works out of their home making specialty breads which she later sells to neighbors and door to door throughout her community. Reina is part of a collective along with Irma Gonzalez, who sells shredded chicken in the neighborhood. Together they are requesting the loan. Reina plans to use to it to purchase firewood, flour, sugar, lard and eggs so she increase her daily production of bread. Irma plans to use a portion of the loan to purchase cooking utensils and install a small shop where she can sell her product.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

REINA TIENE 42 AÑOS , CASADA 4 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ REINA TRABAJA EN SU CASA HACIENDO PAN ARTESANAL QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE EN SU CASA ENTRE SUS VECINAS Y TAMBIEN SALE A VENDER CASA A CASA EN LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARCOS 4 JUNTO A DOÑA IRMA GOMEZ GONZALEZ QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE POLLO DESTROZADO EN SU CASA ENTRE LAS VECINAS DEL SECTOR. CON EL PRESTAMO REINA ESPERA INVERTIR EN LEÑA, HARINA , AZUCAR, MANTECA DE CERDO Y HUEVOS PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DIARIA DE PAN . EN EL CASO DE DOÑA IRMA ESPERA CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS IMPLEMENTOS DE COCINA Y QUIERE INSTALAR UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDITA EN DONDE VENDERA POLLOS DESTROZADOS Y COCINADOS .

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Ekoué Claude

texts.fr:
Mr. Ekoué Claude K. was born on 15 June 1969 in Aného. Married and father of four (4) children, he is a carpenter and has his own workshop. His income being insufficient for all the needs of his family, he took the initiative and started a second business in conjunction with carpentry. Kind, courageous, and a hard worker, he decided to marsh farm to increase his income. With the help of his wife, who brings him considerable support, this undertaking is rapidly growing. He has been able to repay his previous loans. Currently, Mr. Ekoué Claude K. hopes to enlarge his marsh farm and make it a significant source of income for his family.

He is thus asking for a loan of $950, which will allow him to buy a motor pump, pipes, and other equipment necessary for marshland agriculture.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Ekoué Claude est né le 15 Juin 1969 à Aného. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il est menuisier et détient son propre atelier. Son revenu étant insuffisant pour tous les besoins de la famille, il prit l’initiative d’entreprendre une activité parallèle à la menuiserie. Brave, courageux et bon travailleur, il décide de faire du maraîchage pour améliorer son revenu. Avec l’aide de sa femme qui lui apporte un soutien considérable dans cette activité qui de plus en plus prend une allure considérable. Il a pu rembourser les crédits antérieurs. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur K. Ekoué Claude souhaite agrandir son maraîchage et en faire une source de revenu importante pour la famille Il sollicite à cet effet un crédit d’un montant de $950 qui va lui permettre d’acheter une motopompe, de tuyaux et d’autres matériels nécessaires aux cultures maraîchères.

loans.use: To buy equipment and pipes for marsh farming

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann V., age 36, sells vegetables in an open-air market near Siem Reap, earning $7 per day in revenue. Her husband, age 40, works as a farmer to grow the vegetables and rice that she sells. They do not have children.

Vann would like to borrow $500 to repair their house after the monsoon season. In the future, she plans to diversify and expand the variety of crops they grow to reduce the risk of crop failure and provide a more secure income stream.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Rosa is 54 years old, married, she lives in the District of Bagua GranD. in the Province of Utcubamba, Departament of Amazonas and belongs to the group “Grupo Mientras Tanto Virgen D. las Mercedes.” She is dedicated to selling groceries and started her business to increase the family income and because she enjoys this activity.

Her business is growing day by day and allows her to cover the family expenses and invest in her business..

Her goal is to make her business grow, expand, and become a business woman.

The loan requested is $250 which she plans to repay in 4 months and it will be used to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, candy and soft drinks. Her clients live in Bagua GranD., especially in her own neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 54 años, casada, vive en el distrito D. Bagua GranD., Provincia D. Utcubamba, en el Departamento D. Amazonas, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Virgen D. las Mercedes. Se dedica a la Venta D. Abarrotes. Inició su negocio para mejorar los ingresos D. la familia y porque le gustaba esta actividad.

El negocio esta creciendo día a día, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades D. ella y las D. su familia, además D. seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.

Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, ampliar y convertirse en una mujer D. negocios.

El reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 700.00 ($ 233.00 aprox.), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, servirá para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, golosinas y gaseosas. AtienD. al público en general que residen en Bagua GranD., especialmente a los vecinos D. su barrio.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, candy, and soft drinks to increase stock at a grocery store.

loans.name: Faamativa

texts.en:
Faamativa is married to a farmer from the village of Tafitoala, quite far from town. She has five children: four boys and one girl. Her husband has no job and that was the main reason she joined SPBD - to get a loan to support her two-acre taro plantation, just 30 meters from her house.

She sells 3-4 bags of taro twice a week and she earns $300.00- $400.00 WST ($120-160 USD) a week. She is also one of the best savers of the Tafitoala Centre; she usually makes a deposit of $50.00 WST ($20 USD) every week, to support her business, family, and for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Elnur

texts.ru:
Elnur G. was born in 1978. He currently lives in the Agsunisky region. He is a bachelor, but plans to get married soon. Last year he filed an application at Normicro. Elnur plans to use the loan to buy more cows. This will help him expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Эльнур Гасымов 1978 года рождения. Данный момент проживает в Ахсуниском районе.Холость. Скоро собирается жениться. В прошлом году обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Эльнур получив кредит хочеть купит еще несколько коров. Это поможет ему расширятся.

loans.use: To increase livestock

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is married with a child. He joined SMT a year ago and, with the previous loans, he has increased his stock and profit.

With the profit, he purchased a piece of land on the outskirts of Kabala in Sierra Leone.

Edward plans to build a house for his family and is requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1,000,000) to increase his stock and diversify the business.

loans.use: Edward wants to buy an extra supply of plastic sandals for selling in his shop.  He needs additional capital to be able to purchase the shoes.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
K. Rahima is 50 years old. She is married with three children. Rahima has been running her business for 20 years. Rahima cooks the national meals at her place at lunch time. She sells meals to traders and sellers, as well as clients and customers in the market. Rahima's daughter helps her with the cooking.

Rahima is living very close to the market, which allows her to provide her clients with fresh, hot lunches. She has many clients, and her business is successful, allowing her to help her husband in supporting the family. Rahima requests $450.00 for the term of 1 month. Rahima is planning to spend the loan to increase the working capital and to arrange a trading place in the market. Rahima is a repeat client of IMON, and now she promises to repay this loan on time, and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: T increase her working capital to arrange a good trading place in the market.

loans.name: Mahuna Goulo Group

texts.fr:
This micro-project focuses on the conversion of palm nuts to palm oil. It is the initiative of the all-female group MAHUNA de GOULO in the commune of AKPRO MISSERETE. This group was created in 1997 and is composed of 9 women. This micro-project will allow the group to increase its production capacity, to obtain profits, and to improve the living conditions of its members. This is a group that is experienced in the business of processing palm nuts. In addition, the geographic situation of the commune allows this group to obtain palm nuts to process.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le présent micro projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge. Il est l’initiative du groupement féminin MAHUNA de GOULO dans la commune D’AKPRO MISSERETE. Ce groupement a été crée en 1997 et est composé de 9 femmes. Ce micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager de bénéfice et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres. C’est un groupement bien expérimenté dans le domaine de la transformation des noix de palme. Ainsi la situation géographique de la commune lui permet d’avoir les noix de palme à transformer.

loans.use: To buy 4.8 tonnes of oil palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy costume jewelry for resale

loans.name: Sardaran

texts.en:
Sardaran baji is a wife of N. A. and the mother of four children. Her eldest son, Asim A., quit school when he was in 2nd standard. The next son, Tasawar Hussain is 7 years old and is in 2nd standard. The younger sons, Faisal A. and Eshan A. are enrolled in a local school.

Sardaran baji is a housewife and makes embroider clothing on order. Her husband runs a poultry farm and sells chicken meat. Sardaran baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying a loan for her husband’s chicken meat business. Her husband hopes that if he earns a good profit he can buy his own shop where he can sell chicken meat independently.

loans.use: To expand her husband's chicken business so he can open his own shop

loans.name: Albert

texts.fr:
Albert H. was born on January 16, 1977 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of BENIN. He is married and the father of two children: Joseph, age 3, and Merveille, age 8 months. A machinist of eleven years, he repairs sewing machines. He also sells used sewing machines. Given the increased demand of his customers, he is requesting as his second loan an amount of 100,000 francs in order to satisfy the burgeoning demand of his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

H. Albert est né le 16 Janvier 1977 à Porto-Novo la capitale politique du BENIN. Marié et père de 02 enfants: Joseph 03ans et Merveille 08 mois. Machiniste de profession depuis 11 ans, il répare les machines à coudre et fait également la vente des machines à coudre d'occasion. Vue la demande accrue de ses clients, il sollicite pour son deuxième crédit une somme de 100 000 francs afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy two used sewing machines

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji, the wife of A. M., lives in the small city of Chichawatni, Pakistan where she is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter, all enrolled in a local school. This housewife successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) whereby she purchased an auto-rickshaw for her husband; her brother-in-law is now operating the rickshaw while her husband works as a security guard. Bushra baji is requesting a loan to start a new fruit-selling business, which her husband will operate.

She is joined in this group loan by four other members: Sakina baji requests a loan to buy goats and sheep to resell; Hanifan baji and Kalsoom baji each request a loan to buy a donkey cart; Bashiran baji requests a loan to buy some groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach C., 43, married and living with four of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia has been selling fish at the market since 1990 to earn a living, making about $7.50 in profits each day. Her husband, You Heang, 47, is a motor-taxi driver who typically makes $3 per day. Two of their children work in construction building houses to help support the family and are able to make $5 per day.
