Meach is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport the fish she sells to market and increase the volume of fish sold. The motorbike will help reduce the expense she incurs everyday using a motor-taxi. 

Meach is pictured with her husband in her home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport the fish to market and increase the volume of fish sold

loans.name: Katiuska

texts.es: Katiuska, de 25 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas preciosas, que son su razón de seguir adelante, es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de jugos al paso, en su propio domicilio y le va muy bien, trabaja para sus hijas, a quienes en un futuro quiere ver profesionales y mujeres útiles a la sociedad.  Katiuska pertenece a un banco comunal, y se siente muy feliz, porque gracias al apoyo que le dan está saliendo a delante, por lo que se trazó una meta, la de construir una ramada (estructura con columnas de palos y techo de ramas) para la venta de sus jugos y desde luego comprar fruta e ingredientes para los jugos, para lograr este objetivo, esta joven madre necesariamente requiere de un capital. Ayudemos a Katiuska, madre que tiene deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Katiuska, 25 years of age, has two precious daughters who are her reason to carry on. She is a single mother and dedicated to selling juices on the streetside from her own home. It is going very well for her. She is working for her daughters, who she wants to see in the future become professionals and useful women to society. Katiuska is a member of a community bank and she feels very happy because thanks to the support that they give her she is able to advance her business. This is why she has a goal to construct a "ramada" (a structure made with wooden posts and a roof of branches) for selling her juices and also buy fruit and ingredients for the juices. She is a young mother who necessarily requires more capital. Let's support Katiuska, a mother with desires of moving ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business and improve the space where she sells her juices.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. This is Asha Y. K.. She  is a married woman with two children and one more dependent for whom she is responsible because he is schooling in the area. Asha has been running a cosmetics business since March 2008. Her business is doing well and her currently monthly profit is US$ 180.

 Asha is now requesting  a loan of US$ 425 in order to purchase additional cosmetics for her inventory. She is assisted by her brother in running this business. They work 7 days per week and 10 hours per day. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. 

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. 

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Safizetou

texts.fr:
Madame A. Safizetou est née le 19 novembre 1970 à Sokodé, localité située à 400 km au nord de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée avec un chauffeur et elle est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Depuis 2004, elle exerce le commerce de pagnes, en achetant son stock dans le grand marché de Lomé et vend aux clients à Agoè, un quartier situé au nord de la ville.
Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Actuellement son stock est épuisé et elle désire s’approvisionner. A cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 9 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Safizetou A. was born on November 19, 1970 in Sokodé, which is located 400 km north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is married to a chauffeur and is the mother of 5 children. Since 2004 she has been selling "pagnes" (brightly colored African cloth, sold in lengths) buying her inventory in the big open-air market of Lomé and selling to customers in Agoè, a neighborhood situated north of the city.

With the income from her business, she helps her husband cover family expenses. Presently, her inventory is sold out and she would like to replenish it. For this reason, she is asking for her first loan to buy 9 lengths of "pagne".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun Y., 60, is sells groceries from her house in Siem Reap Province. She sells a variety of products such as oil and other foods items. She is widowed with one daughter, who is married. Her business is doing well and she has many clients. She would to increase her business to provide her with more income. Therefore, Chhun Y. would like to request a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mykhaylo

texts.en:
Mykhaylo is married with two small sons. He runs a drug store business. Mykhaylo used to work for a government drugstore. Then he decided to start one of his own. Hard work and clear purpose - to provide for his family - made his business grow. Now Mykhaylo has three business locations, one in the city and two in small towns, that provide people with necessary medicine.

Mykhaylo is asking for a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the assortment of medicines. This business is the only source of income for his family, so Mykhalo wants to run it well.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of medicines

loans.name: Yormahmad

texts.ru: Эшонов Ермахмад житель Шахринау. Живет в селе . Работает таксистом , на своем автомобиле по маршруту Шахринау - Душанбе.  Занимается  этим уже 6 лет.  Возраст 25 лет, женат , детей не имеет. В данный момент он остался без работы , так произошла поломка двигателя. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит для его ремонта. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Yormahmad A. lives in Shahrinaw, in the village. He is a taxi driver, using his own vehicle to drive the Shahrinaw - Dushanbe route. This has been his work for the past 6 years. He is 25 years old, married, and has no children. Right now he has no work because the vehicle's engine failed. He would like a loan in order to do the needed repairs. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle engine repairs

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 28-year-old farmer who lives in Mrah Al Habbas, in southern Lebanon. Three years ago he opened a farm in his village with only two cows. Today he has 30 cows on his farm and he wants to borrow $1,000 in order to buy a computer to better control his business.

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Francisca Cristina

texts.es: Doña Francisca es una mujer luchadora que desde muy joven  se ha dedicado al trabajo para cubrir las necesidades del hogar, ya que es madre soltera de dos hijos uno de 25 que es independiente y uno de 16 años que cursa la secundaria, tiene 64 años de edad, reside en el barrio Walter Ferreti, y se desempeña de conserje desde hace vientres años. Cansado pero es una oportunidad para subsistir. Con esta solicitud quiere comprar materiales de construcción ya que desea embaldosar su casa ya que su piso es de suelo, y desea estar un poco más cómoda y higiénica. Su anhelo es ver a su hijo que sea un profesional
texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking woman who, since she was very young, has dedicated herself to her work to be able to provide for her family. She is a single mother of two children -- one who is 25 and living on his own, and the other, age 16, who is in high school. Francisca is 64 years old and lives in the Walter Ferretti neighborhood [of Managua]. For 20 years she has worked as a caretaker and has grown tired, but it provides means for getting by. With the requested loan she wants to buy construction materials for installing tiles in her house. Her current floor is earthen and Francisca would like to be a little more comfortable and keep her home clean. She hopes to see her son grow up to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for tiling the floor of her house

loans.name: James

texts.en: James I. sells cylinders. He also repairs cylinders. He is 43 years old and married with six children. He hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more cylinders to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cylinders to sell

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El microempresario Oscar Antonio M. tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos los cuales dos estudian y desde hace 10 años se dedica viajar a la capital a comprar productos varios por encargo. Este negocio consiste en que muchas personas en ocasiones quieren comprar algunos productos que en la capital son mas baratos y se lo encargan al señor M. quien solamente les cobra una pequeña comisión por la compra, sin embargo el señor M. es quien utiliza sus recursos para hacer dicha compra. Por este motivo es que este microempresario necesita obtener financiamiento ya que en la medida que compre más productos su comisión aumenta. 

Entre los clientes que tiene se encuentran los barberos, los ebanistas, las costureras,  los taxistas, los joyeros y personas que necesitan algún producto que no se encuentre en esta ciudad o que sea difícil de encontrar. Este tipo de actividad casi no existen personas que la realicen ya que el viaje a la capital es bastante cansado y aburrido. El señor M. ya fue beneficiado con un  crédito por parte de Kiva y ha manifestado que este préstamo le permitió aumentar sus ingresos. Cabe señalar que este cliente pago en tiempo y forma su crédito.

Necesita se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos: 300 yardas de Tela dacron la cual compra a US 1 dólar cada yarda, 2 pesas para pulpería a US 17 dólares cada pesa, 30 cables de DVD a US 1 dólar cada cable, 10 radios sharp a US 15 dólares cada radio, 4 baterías para carro a US 30 dólares cada batería, 12 calculadora grande a US 5.50 dólares cada  calculadora y 300 yardas de  mecates a US 1 dólar cada yarda.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Oscar Antonio M. is 55 years old, he is married, has 3 children, two of which are in school, and for 10 years he has been traveling to the capital to purchase various ordered products. This business consists of many people occasionally wanting to buy products that are cheaper in the capital and they ask this of Mr. M., who only charges a small commission for the purchase. Nonetheless, Mr. M. is the one who uses his resources to make said purchases. It is for this reason that the micro-entrepreneur needs to obtain financing, since in so far as he purchases more products his commission increases. Among his customers are barbers, cabinet makers, seamstresses, taxi drivers, jewelers, and people who need any product that is not found in the city, or that is difficult to find. There are very few people who do this job since the trip to the capital is rather tiring and boring. Mr. M. has already been the beneficiary of a loan on the part of Kiva and has shown that this loan allowed him to increase his income. It is important to note that this client pays on time and develops his loan. He needs to be financed to purchase the following products: 300 yards of Dacron fabric which he will purchase for 1 US dollar a yard, 2 weights for small local grocery stores at 17 US dollars a weight , 30 DVD cables at 1 US dollar a cable, 10 Sharp radios at 15 US dollars a radio, 4 car batteries at 30 US dollars a battery, 12 large calculators at 5.50 US dollars a calculator, and 300 yards of mecate at 1 US dollar a yard.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dacron fabric, grocery store weights, DVD cables, sharp radios, car batteries, large calculators and mecates.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is a 27-year-old married man with one child, living in Al Maghayreh, Mount Lebanon. He has owned his own supermarket since 2004. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 500 to purchase a new refrigerator for the supermarket to better serve his clients.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Jequicene

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente):jequicene C. 
Internal Client ID (Numero do Expediente do Empréstimo)18495
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): Habitação
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:22.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra e criaçao de pintos para revenda
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo):26/05/09 
Dêscription (Historial


Jequicene nasceu em Inhambane, solteiro de 49 anos de idade, estudou ate a 5ª classe devido à falta de transporte, pois a escola encontrava-se muito distante da casa. Pai de 12 filhos: com idades compreendidas entre os 5anos aos 25 anos de idade. A mais velha já casada e os restantes vão à escola.   
Jequicene sai de Inhambane a Namaacha, uma vila na fronteira de Swazilândia, a procura de emprego. Começa a trabalhar como guarda nas irmãs franciscanas durante 12 anos. Mas devido ao elevado custo de vida, pois este ganhava pouco, começa a praticar negócio de venda de potes abandonando assim o emprego e dedicar se mais aos negócios que lhe davam bons lucros. Com o rendimento dos negócios ele consegue construir duas casas, uma vês que tem duas Esposas, e ainda comprar uma viatura para lhe facilitar no seu trabalho. Agora para além da venda de potes, faz transporte semi-colectivo de passageiros (vulgo chapa) e tem um rendimento diário de 200.00mtn e também faz criação de frangos. Esta actividade aprendeu nas irmãs franciscanas. ( onde gastava 12,000.00mtn para criar 200 pintos).
Nesta actividade avícola tem ganhado um rendimento de 5,000. 00mt em cada ciclo e a sua criação aumentou com o empréstimo que  teve na Hluvuku- Kiva; hoje em dia cria 500.00 pintos gastando 30.000.00MT em cada fase tendo assim um lucro no valor de 12.000.00MT. E consegue custei ar as despesas familiares (cuida dos seus pais que vivem com ele em sua casa) e os estudos dos seus filhos. Por mês consegue poupar 3.000.00MT 

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Jequicene na Hluvuku e Kiva. Os primeiros 18.000.00MT foram usados para ampliar a criação de frangos, conseguiu pagar sem nenhum problema e pede este segundo empréstimo de 22.000.00MT para aumentar o volume seu stock.Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer crescer o negocio, cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Jequicene was born in Inhambane. He is single, 49 years old, and studied until fifth grade. He had to stop school because of a lack of transportation, since the school was very far from his house. He is the father of 12 children, whose ages range from five to 25 years old. The oldest is already married and the rest go to school. Jequicene left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, looking for work. He began by working as a guard for Franciscan sisters for 12 years. But because of the rising cost of living, and because he wasn't earning much, he began a business selling earthenware pots and gave up his job to concentrate on more lucrative businesses. With his business earnings, he managed to build two houses, since he had two wives, and also bought a vehicle to help him with his work. Now, in addition to selling earthenware pots, he provides informal public transportation services and has a daily income of 200 mtn. He also raises chickens. This occupation he learned with the Franciscan sisters (where he would spend 12,000 mtn to raise 200 chicks). This poultry business earns an income of 5,000 mt in every cycle, and it is growing with the loan he had from Hluvuku-Kiva. These days, raising 500 chicks costs 30,000 MT in each phase, and therefore has a profit of 12,000MT. And he manages to pay family expenses (caring for his parents who live with him in his house) and his children's studies. Each month he is able to save 3,000 MT. This is the second loan for Jequicene with Hluvuku and Kiva. The first 18,000 MT were used to grow his chicken raising business. He managed to repay it with no problem, and asks for this second loan of 22,000 MT to enlarge the size of his stock. He is confident that he will repay it ahead of time and and ask for a new loan to grow his business, each time a little more.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his stock of poultry.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia R. M. is 37 years old. She is originally from Maputo and is the mother of two children aged 12 and 18. She was left by her boyfriend, who went to find work in South Africa, so she now lives with and sustains her two children. 

Marcia works selling products from a stand in Boane. Her best selling products are peanuts and beans. She intends on using this loan to increase her stand's inventory and to offer new products. In the future she plans on requesting further loans to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To increase her stand's inventory and to offer new products

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en: Monica is 55 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children. She is a trader. Monica fires and sells popcorn. She sells on a school compound in her community. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘God’s time’. Monica is in the middle of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the hearts desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Miss. S. Morn, 25, is single (pictured above with her mother), and lives with her brothers and sister along the National Road Number 1, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

S. has been working as a tailor for two months. She operates the business at her house. Her mother is 63 years old but is still able to run her own farming business. S. is requesting her first loan of $600 to purchase a sewing machine and help her mother’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and help her mother’s farming business.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou N. habite a camberene et evolue dans le commerce depuis 1994 principalement dans la vente d'articles de mercerie,associee a celle de fripperie.elle sollicite un pret de cent mille(100 000) pour augmenter son fond afin de gagner d'autres marches et ainsi accroitre ses benefices.par consequent elle pourra mieux soutenir sa famille et ameliorer leur niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Fatou N. lives in Camberene and has developed a business since 1994 that primarily sells dressmaking supplies, combined with a used clothing business. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 CFA to increase her funds in order to gain additional markets and thus increase her profits. In this way, she will be able to better support her family and improve their standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora y amorosa. Vive en su casa propia, la cual comparte con sus hijos y nietos, a quienes tiene un gran cariño, y lo que más desea es vivir una vida en armonía y en unión con todos los miembros de su familia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, actividad que realiza junto a un grupo de amigas que incorporó para incrementar sus ventas y llegar a diversos lugares de su distrito, lo cual hace rentable su actividad económica y le da la oportunidad de ganar premios dentro de la empresa de belleza como una de las mejores vendedoras. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es vender y mientras pueda hacerlo seguirá visitando a sus clientes, aunque las deudas de algunos de ellos la perjudiquen en algunos momentos, pero logra superar esas dificultades. De esta forma viene trabajando para lograr sus más ansiados deseos de adquirir un local o un puesto en el mercado de su localidad para ofertar los productos de belleza que tiene en stock y sobre todo de tener un espacio propicio para realizar sus ventas y tener contacto frecuente con sus clientes. Ella es una de las líderes de su banco comunal, este sería su crédito 29 con Microfinanzas PRISMA y en todo este tiempo se ha ganado la amistad de sus compañeras, a quienes les contagia sus ganas de progresar. Con los tres mil soles que solicita comprará más productos de belleza para aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hard working and loving woman. She lives in her own house, which she shares with her children and grandchildren for whom she has great affection. What she wishes for the most is to live a life in harmony and union with all of the members of her family. She has been selling cosmetics for 20 years. She does this with a group of friends who joined together to increase their sales and go to different places in her district. This makes her business profitable and gives her the chance to win prizes like being one of the best sellers within the beauty company. What she likes about her work is selling. While she is still able to do so, she will continue visiting her customers. Although the debts of some of her customers are sometimes detrimental, she has been able to overcome these difficulties. She works in this manner to achieve her most yearned for wish, which is to get a location or stall in a market in her town. That is where she would sell the beauty products she has in stock. Above all, she wants to have a space of her own to make her sales and have frequent contact with her customers. She is one of the leaders in her community bank. This will be her 29th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. In all of this time she has gained the friendship of her colleagues; she infects them with her desire to progress. She will use the 3,000 PEN she is asking for to buy more beauty products to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: T. Martine est née vers 1972 à Tori Bossito. Martine est mariée à ABAKPE Lambert, un menuiser. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis sept ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Martine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Martine vend des chaussures de façon ambulante. C’est à Lomé, pays voisin du Bénin que Martine achète ses produits. Martine a déjà dix ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Martine a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Martine demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de chaussures.

loans.name: Chicas De Oro Group

texts.es: Las socias de este banco comunal tienen una familia compuesta de cinco integrantes en promedio los padres y tres hijos. Una buena parte de los miembros son solteros (as) con sus actividades propias son gente  de clase media, pero también hay gente de procedencia rural, son de escasos recursos con viviendas de adobe y otros en alquiler. Las actividades que desarrollan los miembros de este banco comunal son  básicamente la comercialización de productos de limpieza, papelería, ferreterías, prendas de vestir, abarrotes, frutas, dulces, refrescos y alimentos procesados y no procesados. En el mercado las socias, existe bastante competencia sin embargo ellas se valen de la rapidez que tienen para cambiar y surtir su mercadería siempre están de acuerdo al comportamiento de las épocas, pero alguna socia del banco fracasan y es la causa de la mora arrastra al grupo. El destino del crédito es principalmente el incremento de su capital de trabajo. La mayoría de los socios tienen experiencia crediticia puesto que no es su primer ciclo, por otra parte fueron parte de grupos en otras instituciones similares, actualmente trabajan solo con nuestra Institución.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of members who have families with the average of five people, the parents and three children. A good part of the members are single with their own activities. They are middle class people, but they are also people that come from rural areas. They have scarce resources and have adobe houses. Others rent houses. The activities that the members of this community bank do are basically selling cleaning products, having a stationery store, having a hardware store, selling clothing, groceries, fruits, sweets, soft drinks, and processed and unprocessed food. There is a lot of competition in the market, but they benefit from the quickness with which they change and stock their merchandise. They are always prepared to deal with the behavior of the market and are prepared for the season. But, if some member of the bank fails, that causes difficulty for the group. The loan is primarily to increase their working capital. Most of the members have loan experience given that this is not their first cycle. They have been part of groups in similar institutions, but they currently only work with our Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Women Of Today Group

texts.en:
Women Of Today is a group of 5 borrowers led by Korpo S.. Korpo is 38 years old and married. She has 6 children who are 12-18 years old and whose educational levels are 5th-12th grade. She is an illiterate due to poverty. Korpo and her family live in Ziggida Town, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Korpo’s business is selling palm oil. She buys palm oil wholesale and sells it at retail in bottles from a table to residents of Ziggida Town. She has been running this business for 3 years and is hoping to improve to a bigger table. Korpo sells quality palm oil and also takes good care of her customers during transactions in order encourage them to continue buying from her.

Korpo started this business with little funds, given to her by her husband because his small salary can’t take care of their home. She manages her little business and has turned it into something better, and she aims at growing to a bigger table.

She needs this loan in order to purchase more palm oil wholesale to earn more profits to improve her business. She dreams of giving her family the best of support and of changing their lives totally.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to resell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 45 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a pastor. She makes a living selling foodstuffs such as yams. Her goal is to be an even more important distributor of foodstuffs to her community in the future. She is a friendly woman and is very skilled at attracting more customers to her stall. This is the high season for her business, and has applied for this loan to buy more supplies and meet the demands of her customers. She extends her thanks to all Kiva supporters.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.en: This committee was formed by Agustina R. and Lilian Agustina A., who gathered 20 working women who wanted to grow their businesses and improve their livelihoods. They are independent in their work as street vendors selling clothes and food, as seamstresses, owners of pantries, and traders in the market. They get an average credit of Gs.300.000 each, which they invest in their pursuits, including the purchase of chemicals for making cleaning products; natural products (such as vitamins and slimming and natural remedies); sugar, flour, eggs, noodles, and baking soda; meat, fruit and vegetables; clothes such as jeans, shirts, skirts, shirts and lingerie; cutlery; and accessories for embroidery, such as thread and other crafts.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Luz Y Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo “Luz y Sol” esta representado por la señora Yara y conformada por 12 miembros  de los cuales una mayorías son padres y madres de familia y representan el sustento de sus hogares. Una gran mayoría de las socias se dedican al comercio de productos como la venta de comida, venta de pan, ropa, promotoras y a los servicio de empleos domésticos, servicios de peluquería, costura y los  varones a  la   actividad del trasporte y albañilería. La  competencia  en respeto  a sus negocios es fuerte, ya que las señoras y caballeros trabajan duro y requiere de mucho sacrificio para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios. El crédito será utilizado para capital de trabajo como la compra de insumos, materiales herramientas nuevas y repuestos para sus vehículos que agilicen su trabajo y que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para el bienestar de sus familias. La socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital a la cual le agradecen `por la confiadaza y el apoyo económico brindado ya que con ellos podrán sacar adelante a sus negocios y mejora la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Luz y Sol” is represented by Yara and consists of 12 members, of which most are mothers and fathers of the family and represent the means of support in their homes. A large majority of the members are involved in commerce such as food, bread, or clothing sales, and promotion and services such as domestic employees, hair salon services, and sewing. The men are involved in transport and bricklaying. The competition in respect to their businesses is strong since the men and women work hard and it requires a great deal of sacrifice to help their small businesses get ahead.

The loan will be used as working capital for the purchase of food supplies, new tools, and spare parts for their cars that speed up their work and help to generate better income for the well-being of their families. The members have experience with solidarity groups, thanks to funds from organizations similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are appreciative of Fundación Agrocapital for the confidence and economic support they provide, since with them the members will be able to get ahead with their businesses and improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ma. Lucy

texts.en: Ma. Lucy R. is from the village of Poblacion South. She is 34 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ma. Lucy owns and operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimps in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ma. Lucy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Ma. Lucy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her fish-selling business and to cover the cost of cultivating their rice farm. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for her children’s education expenditures. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fish-selling business and for farm cultivation

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, a 37-year-old woman from a town in Agusan Del Sur, farms for a living. She has three children, and the oldest is only eleven years old. She plants rice and works all day to ensure that her crops are growing healthy. She works hard to provide food, clothes and her family’s other needs. She also wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

Melanie is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming needs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati D. is a resident of Chapagaun, Lalitpur. Chapagaun is one of the developing village of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.
Mrs. Sarswati lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Laxmi D., is a house laborer. Both of her sons are now working.
Mrs. D. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Chapagaun. She opened a grocery store in her own house five years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, etc to her customers.
Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy different varieties of grocery goods for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Mrs. Kea Doeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen people who live in Trapeang Angk village in Takeo province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Kea D. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. All the members are shown in the photo, but some of them are blocked

Mrs. Kea D. and her husband, Mr. Chork Doul, are farmers who own 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family. In the rice field, they have a problem because it has infertile soil but they do not have enough money to support it.

Thus, in order to improve their family living conditions, Mrs. Kea D. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support their field to increase their rice yield this current year.

Mrs. Kea D. is the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lillian Dama

texts.en:
Lillian, 28, is married to Enoch, who is a casual laborer in Mbaraka Chembe in Malindi. Together they have four children, three of whom are in preschool. Lillian operates a grocery business in the same area. Her business, which is a year old, targets residents of Malindi and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 7,000.

Lillian was introduced to Kadet by one of the members of her group. She has applied for a loan, which she will use to buy fruits and vegetables and to use part of the money on transport. With the extra income from this loan, Lillian hopes get a bigger kiosk (retail shop) and dreams of building a residential home on the family plot.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables, and pay for transport

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells plastic chairs, plates and tables to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She manages the trade with the support of her children. She started this trade four years ago and has been doing fine. With the proceeds from the business, she assists her husband in taking care of the home and in feeding, clothing and buying school books for her children. 

Beatrice wants to expand her business by buying more plastic chairs, tables and more. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more plastic chairs and tables to sell. She appreciates all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic chairs and tables to sell

loans.name: Raja

texts.en:
Raja C. is 40 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling groundnut and maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock pulses to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock pulses to sell

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
L. socia Elizabeth; pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC”, situado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años D. edad elL. es casada, no tiene hijos, Nuestra socia es Arquitecta D. profesión, elL. está elaborando un proyecto particular en L. dirección D. una obra, L. socia es muy reconocida en el campo D. L. construcción y diseño D. los inmuebles, elL. disfruta D. su trabajo al máximo y pertenece a este banco comunal junto a su hermana por L. razón D. compartir las reuniones con amigos y D. mantener este vinculo que le permite ver a sus amigos una vez al mes mientras el resto del mes está trabajando y muy ocupada, L. socia Solicita el préstamo para algunos gastos personales.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. L. deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao Inc”, which is in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 45 years old, married, and does not have children. Elizabeth is an architect by profession and is engaged in a particular project as part of her work. She is well-known in the construction field for designing buildings. Elizabeth enjoys her work to the fullest. She and her sister joined this Communal Bank so that they could attend the meetings with their friends. This allows them to maintain their friendships since they meet once a month and are either working or busy the rest of the time. Elizabeth is requesting a loan for some personal expenses.

She values and appreciates the loan that has been provided to her and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Roxana Erika

texts.es:
La señorita Roxana A., cuenta con 22 años, estudia en la universidad pública, es soltera es hija mayor de la familia. Roxana vive en casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona sud de de la provincia cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.La señorita Roxana se dedica a la producción de leche cruda juntamente con toda la familia, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo de la zona, que a su vez recoge la empresa PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son muy modestas, tienen una casa con habitaciones normales hechas de barro, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señorita Emilia es una jovencita dedicada a su trabajo así como a sus estudios, pues ella juntamente con su familia se levantan muy temprano todos los días para ordeñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedica a sus estudios que piensa culminar muy pronto para poder trabajar y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida de ella y de sus padres.

La señorita Roxana solicita el crédito para la refacción de su vivienda ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada y para la época de invierno estará desprotegida ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana A. is 22 years old. She is a public university student, single, and the eldest daughter in her family. Roxana lives with her parents in the southern area of a province near the Department of Cochabamba. She and her family members produce raw cow’s milk, which is distributed in their area and collected by the company Pil Andina. Roxana and her family live modestly. They have a regular mud-wall house, and they raise cattle on their property. Roxana is committed to her work and her studies. Her whole family gets up early every morning to milk the cows. She spends the rest of the day studying so that one day, she’ll be able to improve living conditions for herself and her family. Roxana has asked for a loan so that she can renovate her home. It needs repairs, and, by winter, could leave her family unprotected.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Ricardo Antonio M. L. de 49 años de edad, reside en El Transito, ubicado en el departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual vive junto a su compañera de vida la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Ricardo se dedica a la reparación de todo tipo de calzado, ya sea formal o deportivo, así mismo trabaja lustrando zapatos. Él se encuentra ubicado con su puesto a las afueras del mercado de El Transito, donde ya posee muchos años de estar, por lo que casi todas las personas del lugar lo conocen, así mismo esto le permite contar con varios clientes los cuales llegan a reparar sus zapatos o a lustrarlos, Ricardo es un señor muy trabajador y responsable quien realiza un excelente trabajo, así mismo es muy cordial y amigable. Él solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar pega de zapatos, tachuelas, suelas, tapitas para los tacones y todos los recursos necesarios para la reparación de calzado. Esto lo hace con el deseo de poder brindar un mejor servicio, de manera que más personas puedan solicitar su servicio y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ricardo Antonio M. Lopez, 49, lives in El Transito, in the Salvadoran "departamento" of San Miguel, with his life partner who takes care of their home. Ricardo makes a living repairing all kinds of shoes, from dress shoes to sneakers. He also shines shoes. He sets up his stand just outside the El Transito market, a site that he has used for many years and where he is well known among local people. Because he is well known in the area, he can count on certain customers coming to him over and over for shoe repairs or shoe shines. Ricardo is a hard-working and responsible man who understands the importance of providing a good service to his customers, service that is friendly and welcoming. He is applying for a loan so that he can buy glue, tacks, soles and the other supplies that he needs for the business. With the supplies, he will be able to provide a better service to his customer and, in turn, increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for shoe repair business.

location.town: El Transito, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en: Oyun T., age 32, lives with her husband, daughter and father in the Narantuul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. They have lived there for the past 5 years. Her husband has been employed as a polishing worker in at a geology lab for five years and her daughter is in middle school. Since 2007, Oyun has run a clothes trading business at the nearby Narantuul market, the largest market in the city. She rents a stall which she considers to be in a good location because of its close proximity to the food market. Over the past two years Oyun has made a lot of progress with her business. Currently her daily revenues average around 50,000 MNT and sometimes reach 150,000 on a good day. Oyun is a very easy going, hardworking and responsible woman. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and import clothes from China to sell at her stall.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
36-year-old Gilbert is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. He is married with four children between the ages of 4 months and 15 years old. Three of the children are currently attending school.

Gilbert has been practising mixed farming for 18 years and has employed 3 casual labourers. His main products are milk, maize, beans, tomatoes and cabbages that he sells at the local market. He also buys and sells dairy cows and goats. His biggest challenge in this business has been weather conditions which affect his animal feed and diseases which attack his dairy cows.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 41,600 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to meet the family's basic needs.

In 5 years' time, he hopes to have increased his productivity and hence earn enough income. He hopes Juhudi will continue to fund him so that he is able to do different projects.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Chiperez Group

texts.es:
Doña Octaviana A. L., es casada, tiene 3 hijos y 2 hijas, ella se dedica a la venta   pañuelos, y tapetes, que   ella  lo compra por mayoreo con los comerciantes  que viajan a los Estados Unidos, se tomo la idea de comercializar  este  tipo de producto en el mercado  de la Aldea de Chivarreto, y también, vende con los comerciantes que viajan a los diferentes municipios de Huehuetenango,  igualmente  se dedica a la crianza de cerdos blancos, y los vende en el mercado del municipio de San Francisco el Alto del departamento de Totonicapán,   ella es una persona entusiasta que  ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia  y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de ropa típica y juntamente los dos han logrado  aportar el gasto familiar. Han tomado la iniciativa de formar un grupo con el objetivo de solicitar un prestamos, para ampñliar su capital y estender su venta para tener mejores ganacias, así pueden mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una

Residen en el Paraje Chiperez, de la  aldea Chivarreto, del Municipio de San Francisco el Alto del departamento de Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Doña Octaviana A. L. is married with 3 sons and 2 daughters. She works selling scarves and table clothes which she purchases from wholesalers who travel to the US. She took the idea of commercialising this type of product from the Aldea de Chivarreto market, and she also sells with the traders who travel to the different municipalities of Huehuetenango. Octaviana also breeds white pigs and sells them in the municipal market in San Francisco el Alto in the Totonicapán department. Octaviana is a very enthusiastic person who has managed to move her family forward and has the help of her husband who sells typical clothing. Together the 2 of them have managed to cover their family costs. They have taken the initiative to form a group with the objective of seeking a loan to amplify their working capital and extend their sales to obtain better earnings, and in this way improve the living conditions of each person. They live in Paraje Chiperez, in the area Chivarreto, in the municipality of San Fransisco el Alto, in the Totonicapán department.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha J. is a housewife and the mother of two sons, Ahmad and Fadi, who are 2.5 and 1.5 years old respectively. Suha and her family live in a village called Qarawet bani Zaid next to Ramallah. Suha's husband owns an auto repair workshop. The workshop is well enough that Suha's husband, Tareq, can pay for their household expenses.

Tareq needs to make a few improvements to the workshop, so Suha took a $300 dollar loan to help her husband improve his workshop and purchase more tools to help him perform his job better.

In the picture above, Tareq appears in his workshop.

loans.use: Improve her husband's auto repair workshop

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Jargalsaihan R. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province, in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His elder daughter attends a local middle school, and his younger twins go to a local kindergarten. His wife takes care of their children. Jargalsaihan owns and operates his own wooden products business, specializing in ger parts, ger furniture, and other larger furniture pieces. He started his business in 2003 and most of his profits come from the sales of his wooden furniture, which is sold at a local market. All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail, which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider. He would like to increase his sales so that he can afford to build a small shop. Jargalsaihan is a hardworking and modest person who is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood so that he can increase the number and variety of large furniture pieces.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Abass

texts.en: Abass is a 27-year-old engaged man from Bint Jbeil. He has been working as an electrician since 2002 and is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to buy a motor engine and an SDS (a machine that’s used to open holes in the wall) necessary for his business. Abass has worked as an electrician since 2002, and he’s an expert in his field. He hopes to expand his work in the future through big construction projects.

loans.use: To buy a motor engine and an SDS (wall-cutting machine)

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is a mother of five children aged between one and fourteen years old. Two of her children are in school while the others are not yet of school age according to the school policies near her home. 
Vestine sells beer and a non-alcoholic drink known as Ubushera, which is made out of a cereal crop known as sorghum. She is requesting a loan to buy more beer and more sorghum to make the local drink, Ubushera.

loans.use: To purchase more beer and sorghum

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson has been operating his mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya for fifteen years. His farm produces maize, beans, bananas, milk and vegetables which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to answer the basic needs of his family. He is 58 years old and married with six school-aged children.

Nelson has requested this loan of 55,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his cereals business. He says the extra income from this loan will enable him meet the basic demands of his family and build his business. He plans to acquire a van to transport his cereals and increase his stock by opening a cereals bank. His major challenges are diseases, market competition, poor transport network, and lack of enough capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his cereals business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma J., aged 49, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio J., a driver, and is the mother of two children, both of whom are studying. The elder child is in high school while the other is enrolled in elementary. By the grace of God, Norma has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send both of them all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Norma as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Norma maintains a variety store and a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, frozen cuts of meat and other products mostly through the popular direct selling brand, Avon, and a popular local meat brand.  A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s cost price is lower than the price in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers earn as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day from her variety store and direct selling business.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Norma dreams of being able to give both her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy orders for her customers

loans.name: Gred

texts.es:
Gred es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y no tiene  hijos, la señorita continua con sus estudios de educación superior.

Gred viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, el primer préstamo fue de S/. 350.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de salchimote.

La señorita solicitará un nuevo préstamo de  S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar maíz, pollo y otros insumos más para su negocio de venta de salchimote.
	
Su sueño es tener un capital propio, tener trabajo y no tener deudas.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y el apoyo mutuo.
texts.en:
Gred is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazón de Jesús” (Heart of Jesus) which is located in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old, single, and does not have children. Gred is continuing with her higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Gred says her first loan was in the amount of 350 PEN, which helped increase her capital for selling “salchimote” (a dish consisting of corn, chicken, and sausages).

She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 700 PEN so that she can buy corn, chicken, and other ingredients for her “salchimote” business. Her dream is to acquire her own capital, continue working, and not be in debt. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the punctuality of the members and the mutual support.

loans.use: Purchase corn, chicken, and other ingredients

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Santa Catarina Group

texts.es: Doña Eva Nohemí, tiene 18 años de edad, es una señora casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, doña Eva trata de apoyar económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que ella  ha podido  mantener, actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace más de 4 años, ella vende en varios municipios, y en los días de plaza del pueblo, para mejorar sus ventas y tener más clientes, doña Eva se decide reunir a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desde hace mas de cinco 5 para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata de apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas de su comunidad, el cual cada una de las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de frutas, crianza de animales, elaboración de mochilas,  venta de mercería, entre otros. Necesita surtir mas su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas, de esa manera ella puede obtener un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en: Doña Eva Nohemí is 18 years old.  She is married and has 2 young children.  Eva tries to support her family financially and provide a better future for her children.  She works selling clothes, an activity which she has been doing for more than 4 years.  She sells in several towns and on town market days to improve her sales and have more customers.  Eva decided to get together some friends and neighbors who she has known for more than five years to form a group since she tries to support not only her family but also people from her community.  Each one of the women works in a different business activity such as: fruit sales, raising animals, making backpacks, notions sales, etc.  Eva needs to better stock her business to improve her sales.  In this way she can earn a little more income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dos Estrellas De Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
LAS DOS ESTRELLAS DE SANTA LUCIA
Doña Beronica  Marivel T. R.,  se dedica a vender diversos productos de primera nesecedad tales como ropa, zapatos, y ropa de bebé,  ella es una socia que ha demostrado responsabilidad y deseo de superación, en su primer crédiT. KIVA que se le otorgo le fue muy bien,  Ahora nos informa que necesita un crédiT. mas  porque necesita invertir para las fiestas de fin de año, en compañía de doña Yesica Velit N. T., ha trabajado  ella se dedica al cultivo y  venta de plátano  y  venta de leña en su domicilio, las dos tienen como objetivo agrandar sus negocios, y piensan que con la ayuda en capital que se les dará, ellas podrán mejorar sus negocios, la líder de este dúo es doña Beronica  T.,las dos solicitan el crediT. para la compra de ropa para vender en el fin de año que es cuando mas se vende y asi poder tener mas oportunidades de superacion para sus familias
texts.en:
LAS DOS ESTRELLAS DE SANTA LUCIA

Doña Beronica  Marivel T. R. is in the business of selling clothes, shoes, etc. She has a business partner, Doña Yesica Velit N. T., who has proved T. be very responsible and eager T. grow. In addition T. selling clothes, Doña Beronica and Doña Yesica also sell plátanos and firewood from home. Their goal is T. grow their business. They have done well with their first Kiva loan and now need a new loan T. get ready for the high demand related T. the end of year festivities. They plan T. use this loan T. buy more clothing articles T. sell during this time of the year, which is when sales peak, and T. improve their lives.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Katherine Jessenia

texts.es:
Katherine de 19 años, tiene una panadería surtida con algunos víveres de primera necesidad. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio en una casa de cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

El negocio lo empezaron sus padres con un horno y una vitrina haciendo panes de harina juntos hace ya 18 años atrás. En el 2009 la mama de Katherine salió del país para buscar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y tuvieron que cerrar la panadería por falta de dinero. En este año Katherine y su hermana de 16 años decidieron abrir la panadería otra vez y hacer los panes que desde pequeña le enseñaron sus padres.  Le pusieron por nombre “Niño Isaac” compraron con sus ahorros harina, levaduras, lácteos y algunos víveres para surtir el lugar. Trabajan desde muy temprano haciendo los panes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, snack, lácteos para surtir su negocio. En el futuro quiere ampliar el negocio y vender tortas, bocaditos para tener variedad.
texts.en:
Katherine, 19, has a bakery where she also stocks groceries.  She lives in an urban zone called Suburbio in a cement house that has all basic utilities.

Her parents started the business with one oven and a display case baking bread from flour together over 18 years ago.  In 2009 Katherine’s mother went abroad seeking better employment opportunities and had to close the bakery due to lack of funds.

This year Katherine and her 16 year old sister decided to reopen the baker again making the bread that their parents taught them to make when they were little girls.  They called it “Niño Isaac” and used their savings to buy flour, yeast, dairy products and a few groceries to stock in the place.  They work from very early making bread.

She wants to use the loan to buy beverages, snacks and dairy products to stock in the bakery.  In the future she’d like to expand the business selling sandwiches and fast food to have more variety.

loans.use: For dairy products and snacks.

loans.name: Kiwanga Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Juliet M. makes common cause with Kiwanga Women's Group-Mukono. She has been selling timber for ten years under the supportive auspices of her husband, who she says was the one person who inspired to start her business. Formerly, she was a teacher. 

In the future, she is considering expanding her business even further. Juliet is happily married with 5 children and this business generates 200,000 shillings per week. With this loan, she plans to expand her business and buy more timber to resell,  not only in Mukono, but also in Kampala.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: John Kinyua

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He is 28 years old and married to Faith Nyambura. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and ferilizer for planting.

In the future, John hopes to practice farming in a more profitable way, such as by using technology to increase his yield.

loans.use: To buy seeds and ferilizer for planting

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan lives in Pakpattan, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for the past 20 years. Her husband’s name is M. Y. and he operates an animal sales business. He purchases animals like goats from the animal market, raises them, and then sells them to people who require them, at a good profit. 

In order to financially support her family, Hanifaan also does paid work. She packs different spices like black pepper, red-chilly powder, salt etc. on order and charges for her labor. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter who is young. Hanifaan couldn’t provide them education due to financial constraints. Her eldest son is involved in a potato-selling business. He buys potatoes from the vegetable market and sells to different vegetable shops to earn an income. He does this work to contribute to his family financially. 

Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy potatoes in bulk and increase his sales. Hanifaan is hopeful that through the loan investment her son will be able to take his business to more profitable position and make more income which will improve his family’s financial condition. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for potato-selling business

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people; they are located in Kokir Thum village in Kandal province. Mrs. Ton L. was born in 1950, and was selected by the group members to be the group leader. The members of this group hope to use their loans to increase their income and improve their families' living. 

Mrs. Ton L. is single, and she is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow sugar cane for her living. In order to support this farming, she would like to ask for a loan to support her farming crops.

loans.use: To support her farming crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy necessary materials for her son's wedding

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel es socia del banco comunal Las Innovadoras, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. ucayali, tiene 72 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 8 hijos.  Solo vive con su esposo.
lleva 2 años perteneciando a la familia D. Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. segunda mano, pero importada, mercadería que compra en la ciudad D. lima.
Con su nuevo prestamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará un fardo D. ropa.
Ella realiza ésta actividad en su propia casa y su esposo la ayuda.  Isabel está muy agradecida por los préstamos que otorga Manuela Ramos porque en otras entidades ya no pueD. acceder a ningun credito por lo avanzado D. su edad.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the village bank "Las Innovadoras" [The Innovators] in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali.  She is 72 years old, married and has 8 children.  She lives alone with her husband. 

For two years she has been part of the Manuela Ramos family and selling imported secondhand clothing.  She buys the merchandise in the city of Lima. 

With a loan of 1000 nuevo soles she will buy a large sack of secondhand clothing. 

She runs her business out of her own home with the help of her husband.  Isabel is very grateful for the loans that Manuela Ramos has given her because other banks would not give her loans because of her advanced age.

loans.use: Buy second-hand clothing in bulk

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng V. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. V. produces traditional baskets to sell, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed at a rubber farm, earning an income of USD 5 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 42 on food and USD 35 on the other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair her house. 

In the future, she would like to use the additional income to continue to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair the house.

loans.name: Onasis Ramón

texts.es: EL SEÑOR M. LABORA COMO FONTANERO ,ES SOLTERO ,TIENE  DOS  HIJOS A SU CARGO, ES  EL PRIMER  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE  LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LE HAN BRINDADO  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA    COMPRAR CEMENTO, BLOQUE, HIERRO,ARENA,ESTRIBO , MANO DE OBRA,PARA CONSTRUIRUN CUARTO  EN SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: Mr M. works as a plumber.  He is single and has two children in his care.  This is the first loan that he has been granted by Ceprodel.  He is grateful for the opportunity that the institution has offered him.  He will use the loan that they have approved to buy cement, blocks, iron, sand and a brace, and to pay laborers to carry out the work.  He will build a room in his home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es:
Maritza, reside en Jucuapa, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de tortas y hamburguesas, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo y dos hijos uno de 5 años y el otro de 1 año de edad. El negocio es un chalet que inicio por sus propios medios desde hace 3 años, la tiene ubicada en el parque de Jucuapa y su horario de venta es de 9:00am a 7:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar pan, embutidos, gaseosas, aceite, papel especial y papel aluminio, condimentos y todo lo necesario para preparar los productos. La compra ayudara a tener mayor disponibilidad de mercadería, teniendo más capacidad para atender a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones es ampliar el chalet, atender bien a los clientes y aumentar su número, tener mejores ganancias y una calidad de vida diferente.
texts.en:
Maritza livs in Jucuapa, a region of Usulután. She works selling sandwiches and hamburgers. She has her own home where she lives with her husband and their two children, who are 5 and 1 year old. She started her business independently three years ago, and it is located in the park in Jucuapa. She sells food from 9:00 am until 7:00 pm.

She is asking for a loan to buy bread, meat, sodas, oil, aluminum foil, condiments, and other items necessary to prepare her foods. Buying these items will allow her to serve more customers. She hopes to expand her business, have good customer service, attract more customers, increase her income, and have a different quality of life.

loans.use: buy bread, lunch meat, sodas, oil, aluminum foil, and condiments

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a 42-year-old married mother of four, operates a gravel and sand delivery service and sells hollow construction blocks, cement and iron bars, earning about PHP 30,000 per month. She has had this business for almost 20 years. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more iron bars and cement to sell and to pay her laborers' salaries each day. Her goal is to continue to work hard in order to provide her family with a steadily improving living standard.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy iron bars and cement to sell and to pay her laborers' salaries each day.

loans.name: Erdeneselenge

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdeneselenge, 39 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She currently takes care of her son, who is 3 years old. Mrs. Erdeneselenge married her husband only three years ago and they live in a rented ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Mendbayar, has been operating a taxi business for many years. Now he has been registered to a taxi call center which operates in the north suburban side of the city. This area is very busy, especially in the summer, because in warm seasons people tend to move to houses in that area whereas in winter they move back to the city center. This area always lacks bus services.

Erdeneselenge is planning to buy a plot of land upon which to build a family house later on. She has started negotiations and she needs to pay the money for the land. She and her husband are going to use their savings to pay for the land, but still need some additional money. Erdeneselenge is requesting a loan to be used as the remaining payment for the land plot. She has already paid the advance payment.

loans.use: to help pay for a plot of land.

loans.name: Azer

texts.ru:
Etomu molodomu cheloveku 23 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Azer yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoimi roditelyami.
Azer uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. On seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo novoqo biznessa i uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta kotorogo on prodayot.
texts.en:
This young man is 23 years old.  He is single and has no children.  Azer is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region in the village of Makhmudlu with his parents.  

Azer has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for two years.  He now needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to expand his business and increase the quantity of milk products he produces for sale.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 35 años reside en el caserío de Antabamba, donde se caracteriza por se un padre de familia extraordinario, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Gisela de 35 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes quiere y apoya incondicionalmente. Desde joven se dedicó a la agricultura, principal actividad económica del lugar. En todo este tiempo ha trabajado arduamente para sacar adelante sus sembríos, es así que todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos de papa, Choclos y zanahorias, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Pero se da un tiempo para dedicarse a trasportar carga desde las zonas altas donde se ubican los terrenos de cultivo, hasta la ciudad donde posteriormente se comercializarán. En adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de arveja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. Además de sacarle mucho provecho al apoyo que recibe de su banco comunal donde sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para el logro de sus objetivos. Sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Alejandro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en su próxima siembra de papa de la variedad “andina” y “blanca”, donde espera obtener una producción de 30 sacos promedio.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 35, resides in the village of Antabamba and is known for being an extraordinary father. He lives in his own home with his wife Gisela, age 35, and their five beloved children who he wants to support unconditionally. Alejandro has been farming from a young age since agriculture is the main business activity in the area. Throughout this entire time, he has worked hard to become successful with his crops. Every morning, he wakes up very early to water and look after his crops of potatoes, corn, and carrots. He sells these products in the city of Tarma because that is where he is able to get the best prices for his crops. What he enjoys most about his job is enjoying the freedom of working in his green fields. Alejandro has been farming for 16 years and considers the most difficult part to be working the land every day because he does not have much time to devote to other activities. However, he makes time to transport his crops from the upper districts, where his farmland is located, to the city so that he can sell them. Going forward, he wants to prepare his land for planting peas since this crop currently sells the best. In addition, Alejandro hopes to take advantage of the support he receives from his Communal Bank because he knows that this loan will help him advance and develop his business.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Pinos de Antabamba” (The Pines of Antabamba). This is his sixth loan with MFP and he hopes that this assistance will help him achieve his goals. Alejandro is willing to submit his payments on time because the funds will be a great help in progressing and developing his business. He is a responsible member of his Communal Bank, which is why he is well-respected. With the assistance he received, Alejandro will invest the money he requested in the purchase of several sacks of organic fertilizer for his next crop of potatoes of the “Andina” and “Blanca” varieties. He hopes that his production will average around 30 sacks of output.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.  Tiene estudios superiores (incompleto). 
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, venta de abarrotes  y venta de otros productos  como leche, pescado, carne, etc,  (emporio) también cuenta que tiene un locutorio y realiza recargas virtuales de telefonía móvil.  Desde hace un ciclo que trabaja con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su primer préstamo fue de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en sus negocios.
Con éste nuevo crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, implementar su tienda, comprará gaseosas y una parte la utilizará para las recargas de celulares.  En el negocio también la ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es convertir la tienda en una bodega mayorista, tener una congeladora y exhibidora para las carnes.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo sin garantía, la puntualidad y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Concepción", located in the Ayrumas Carumas village in the district of Acora, province and department of Puno.  She is 39, has a common-law husband and three children.  She did not finish her high school education.

She and her husband raise farm animals and sell groceries and other products such as milk, fish, meat, etc.  She also has a public use telephone service and sells cell phone prepaid recharges.  She has been involved with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and her first loan was for 1,000 PEN which she invested in her business.

She plans to use the new loan of 1,500 PEN to buy sodas for her store and also to pay for the cell phone recharges.  Her children also help out in the business.

Her dream is to turn her store into a wholesale outlet, with a freezer and meat display counter.

What she likes best about the communal bank is the access to loans without a guarantee, the punctuality and savings.

loans.use: To buy sodas and pay for cell phone recharges.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old. She is hard working and social. She is married and blessed with six children, three of whom are in school.

Elizabeth has been making her living by operating a retail shop for the last ten years. She also earns extra income from rental houses and from selling chips. Elizabeth wants to grow her business to wholesale in the next five years. Her dream is to expand her business and get a wider market. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a chip warmer.

loans.use: To buy a chip warmer

loans.name: Paoline

texts.fr: Paoline est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Paoline est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Denis. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Paoline et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Paoline a arrêté les classes au cours primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Paoline vend depuis une dizaine d'année des mèches et des boissons dans un marché du Bénin. Paoline s'approvisionne au Togo et au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité afin de mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle, Paoline sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
