texts.es: Martha Idalia tiene 35 años de edad, es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos a bajo su responsabilidad. Hace más 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general, Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de su familia en general. Por lo que con todo el esfuerzo logro obtener capital propio, y en parte de su familia que la apoyaron para realizar este medio de vida. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de trajes, pantalones, camisetas, faldas y shorts. Su deseo es de poseer un mini súper que pueda surtir de todos los granos básicos a las personas que viven cerca de ella y que le brinden mayores ingresos a ella.
texts.en:
Martha Idalia is 35, married, and has three children for whom she is responsible. For over six months she has been selling general merchandise. She started this business because she needed income to support her family. Through all of her effort she was able to get her own capital. Her family gave her support to be able to make this way of life work. The loan will be used to buy dresses, pants, t-shirts, skirts, and shorts. Her wish is to have a mini mart, which she would be able to stock with all of the basic grains for the people who live close to her. That would provide her with greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thary M. is a 33-year-old married woman and she is the leader of this group loan, selected by the five members located I. Spean Daek village I. Kandal province. Each member will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Thary M. is a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Thoeun Keat, is a car mechanic who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has five children: four are attending the local school while the youngest one is a year old.

For her pig breeding business, Mrs. Thary M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in Vehari, Pakistan, with her husband and two children. Her elder son is in a 4th class but her daughter is too young to attend school yet. 
Her husband is a daily-wage laborer and also does the business of animal selling. He thinks that there is potential in this business; that’s why he wants to expand it. 

Zarina is also a very caring lady. She takes care of her family and manages the household chores. She also takes care of the animals. Presently, they have a buffalo at their house.  

Zarina bibi has applied for a loan for her husband. He can buy more animals and improve the financial conditions of their family.

loans.use: Purchase animlas to sell

loans.name: Ma. Chita

texts.en:
Ma. Chita P. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Ma. Chita is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Ma. Chita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ma. Chita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Chita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to invest in expanding the business. Ma. Chita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Ma. Chita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina Aiolupetea is 49 years old, married and has 7 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale. Selina has 2 years of experience in this business. Selina needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Selina joined SPBD. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Selina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en: Leoncio P. is from the village of Bayabo East. He is 48 years old. Leoncio is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Leoncio raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Leoncio has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Leoncio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leoncio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Leoncio is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Leoncio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy K. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a home that she rents and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

Cissy has a retail shop business and has been in this business for five years, working every day. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt and jerrycans of cooking oil.

The main business challenges for Cissy include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business and family are to see her business grow big, to start selling wholesale and to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil for her shop

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline has a mixed farm in the town of Litein in the Rift Valley of Kenya. She has been farming for the last 4 years. Her farm produces milk and pineapples which she sells to the local market. She is a full-time farmer and depends on the income from her farming to provide for her family's needs. Evaline recently completed repaying her previous loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 65,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. She says that this loan will improve her family's standard of living since the milk will be used for domestic consumption and the surplus sold. The income will be used to expand the business. Evaline's major challenge has been insufficient dairy feed. She hopes to buy a piece of land in the future so that she can expand her dairy farming.

Evaline is 34 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 2 children, ages 9 and 13. Both children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillerma tiene 43 años, vive  en compañía de su esposo Julio de 48 años, y de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales el primero es mayor, y los otros estudian en el colegio. Cada día es una lucha constante, y eso bien lo sabe esta trabajadora mujer, que desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la preparación de postres y tortas que comercializa a clientes fijos que tiene en las tiendas y negocios aledaños al lugar donde vive. Trabaja en sociedad con una vecina, y dice que las ganancias que obtienen son considerables, pues solo preparan las tortas 3 veces a la semana, y solo ocupan parte del día, entre preparar y repartir, y esto permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a las labores de su hogar. Sueña además que algún día logre instalar una empresa formal dedicada a la preparación de postres y tortas, pero sabe que solo logrará cumplir este anhelo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo constante. Es el quinceavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete ser cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas como siempre, ya que quiere continuar progresando; y también esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Guillerma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que necesita para continuar preparando tortas, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Guillerma is 43 years old and lives with her husband Julio, who is 48 years old. They have 3 children together, two of them still attend school. Guillerma is a hardworking woman and knows that every day is a constant fight to stay ahead. 3 years ago she began preparing pastries and tortes and selling them to regular shops and businesses near where she lives. She runs her business together with her neighbor, and she says their income has been good. They make tortes 3 times a week, and preparing them and distributing them only takes a part of the day, so that they have time to take care of their homes as well. Guillerma dreams of one day being able to set up a formal bakery business, but she knows that she will only reach this goal through a lot of effort and constant work. This is her 15th loan with MFP, and she commits to comply with her payments as she always has, continuing to grow her business. She is very grateful to all of the people who provide the support for her to continue in her work. Guillerma will use the loan to purchase ingredients she needs to prepare her pastries and tortes.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients she uses to prepare her pastries.

loans.name: Estela Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Estela y su esposo el señor Epifanio, son una pareja muy unida y trabajadora, ella trabaja como maestra en una escuela primaria y su esposo, es propietario de un Cyber café. Entre los dos solventan los gastos del hogar. Ellos necesitan el dinero de este crédito para colocar un portón al frente de la vivienda, ya que temen por la seguridad de las computadoras que tienen en el Cyber café
texts.en:
Estela and her husband, Epifanio, are a close-knit and hard-working couple. She works as a teacher in an elementary school and her husband is the owner of a Cyber cafe. Between the two of them, they are able to pay their housing expenses. They need money from this loan to place a gate at the front of their house since they worry about the security of the computers that they have in the Cyber cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Place a gate at the front of her house.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita T. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Jovita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $235 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jovita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Jovita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña Maria Luisa de 40 años de edad tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad los cuales estudian su primaria y secundaria,  su esposo trabaja para intendencia de la propiedad, ella labora como tecnica de Promociòn y verificaciòn en el programa Usura Cero desde hace 2 años el cual ambos comparten con los gastos del hogar y con sus compromisos adquiridos.  

Solicita su cuarto crèdito para remodelar su cocina ya que donde ella labora no puede optar a un crèdito, esta clienta es bien conocida en Nueva Guinea por ser responsable y de buena familia segun referencias comerciales, laborales y personales es bien responsable con sus compromisos.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es ver su vivienda bien bonita, que sus hijos de buena salud y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
María Luisa, 40, has two children who are 17 and 10 years of age and in elementary and secondary school.  Her husband works as a caretaker on an estate and she has worked as a Promotion and Verification Technician for the Usura Cero Program for the last two years.  Both share household expenses and acquired financial obligations.

She is asking for her fourth loan to remodel her kitchen because she isn’t able to get a loan where she is employed.  This client is well known in Nueva Guinea for being responsible and of a good family according to commercial, employment and personal references she is quite responsible with her commitments.

Her greatest dream in life is to have a pretty home, that her children be healthy and that they become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: For home repairs.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia Rodríguez C. es una mujer divorciada desde hace varios años, actualmente vive con una de sus hijas y dos nietas de otra hija la cual vive y trabaja en los estados unidos para ganar más dinero y enviárselos a sus hijas. La señora Dora desea progresar es por ello que cuenta con un negocio de la venta de comida como lo es hamburguesas y hotdogs, chicharrones y fruta en vaso  desde hace 8 años al que desea invertir en el para obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en: Dora Alicia Rodríguez C. has been a divorced woman for several years.  She currently lives with one of her daughters and two granddaughters from her other daughter since their mother works in the United States to earn more money and sends remittances home to them.  Sra. Dora wants to make progress, which is why she started a business selling food such as hamburgers, hot dogs, roasted pork, and fruit cups.  She has been in business for eight years and wants to invest so that she can generate more revenue.

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Ena Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ena del Rosario L. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien aprendió hacer joyería la cual es su profesión inicial pero por la situación económica desde hace 8 años inicio a trabajar con su tía realizando refresco y gaseosa con la ayuda de su suegra se independizó ya que pudo adquirir su refrigeradora, baldes, y su carretón.
L. con el préstamo comprara frutas, azúcar, pajillas, bolsas etc. para su negocio y salir adelante.
texts.en: Ena del Rosario L. is a hard-working woman. Originally a jewelry maker, eight years ago, due to financial constraints, she started working with her aunt selling soft carbonated drinks. With the help of her mother-in-law she was able to buy her own refrigerator, containers and cart to start her own activity of selling homemade juices and carbonated drinks. She will use her loan to buy more fruit, sugar, straws and plastic bags to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits, sugar, straws, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 28 years old and married. The borrower graduated from primary school. The borrower will use this loan to develop his grocery shop by purchasing new tables to make more space to sell the fruit and the vegetables. The borrower has a high reputation in the markets. His fruit and vegetables are fresh every time and this is attracting the clients to purchase from him on a daily basis.

loans.use: To develop his grocery shop

loans.name: Abbasgulu

texts.ru:
Abbasgulu Y. 42 sqoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Abbasgulu uje 7 let kak rabotayet masnikom, etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi kotoriy i pomoq yemu zanatsya etim biznesom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit maso dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Abbasgulu Y., 42, is an internally displaced person who had to resettle from the Fuzuli region to the Absheron region with his family. He has been working as a butcher for seven years. He learned this trade from his uncle, who also helped Abbasgulu start this business. Abbasgulu is applying for a 2000 AZN loan that would allow him to buy meat for resale and increase turnover.

loans.use: to purchase meat for resale

loans.name: Emily Jeptum

texts.en:
Emily Jeptum K. is a 32-year-old woman, married to Philip Kiptoo. Together they have one child. She offers financial sevices (M-PESA) to people in the Moi's Bridge area of Kitale Town. She has been in this business for two years now and gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES from the business.

Emily has been with KADET for three years now, and this will be her third loan. She plans to use the entire loan to boost her business by adding more money to it. With the income she is going to get, she plans to pay school fees for her child. 

In the future, she wants to raise her family's living standards and expand her business to other marketplaces and towns.

loans.use: To establish an "M-PESA" outlet

loans.name: Sudaj

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.Sudaj; el tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica  a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes el vende diferentes productos entre ellos golosinas, productos de primera necesidad, fideos, aceite entre otros mas, el socio lleva un buen tiempo con este negocio a la vez el socio es guía de turismo pero por ahora no ejerce su carrera ya que le falta graduarse y mediante este trabajo está ahorrando para su graduación.

El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de tienda de abarrotes. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “SUMAC SONCCO". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr.Sudaj. He is 25 years old, lives with his partner and has one son. The member is dedicated to his grocery store business where he sells different products including sweets, convenience store items, noodles and oil among other things. The member brings experience to this business, at the same time the member is a tourist guide, but for now he isn't using his career because he still needs to graduate. In the mean time he is working and saving for his graduation.

The member is requesting the loan to begin his grocery store business. 

The member is happy because of the loan and he promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to begin his grocery store business.

loans.name: Los Ositos Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de Yondesé del cedero, San Jose del rincon, la comunidad es de escasos recursos economicos, ahora se ve ya pavimentada con un poco de obra publica realiza por las autoridades del municipio pero antes era puro polvo arena suelta, las casas son en su mayoria de adobe y muchas mas de madera, la gente no sabe leer a exepción de los niños que van a la escuelas, todavia la mayor parte de la comunidad es arena pues lo unico pavimentado es la carretera principal, la gente es muy sencilla humilde, atenta y educada no pierde las buenas costumbres que se tenian antes, el grupo de "Los Ositos" lo integran 8 personas 7 mujeres y 1 hombre, todos ellos vecinos de la comunidad y amigos, sobre la actividad economica realizada en esta comunidad es la cria de animales, (puercos, borregos, caballos reces y aves), el transporte sigue siendo el caballo, aunque si pasa el camion pero no muy seguido, los nombres de las personas que integran el grupo son los siguientes:
1.-Herminia C. U. de 39 años de edad
2.-Antonia C. C. de 58 años de edad
3.-Consuelo P. U. de 58 años de edad
4.- Catalina U. C. de 51 años de edad
5.-Sandra García H. de 28 años de edad
6.-Rocio S. R. de 32 años de edad
7.-Leonardo C. C. de 33 años de edad
8.-Ana Maria F. C. de 35 años de edad

Los integrantes del grupo desidieron llamarse así porque no sabian como ponerse y los nombres que elegian ya los tenian otros grupos, y una hija de un integrante traia un oso de peluche abrazando por eso se llamaron de esa manera el grupo.
La representante del grupo es la señora Rocio, doña Rocio nos cuenta que su grupo lleva años de conocerse y ya habian trabajado juntos antes, nos dice que todos son personas confiables y trabajadores por esa razon necesitaban la ayuda economica para salir adelante y echarle ganas, todo su grupo se dedica a la cria de animales de engorda para venderlos, su negocio es compra-venta de borregos, tambien tiene una pequeña tienda en su misma casa de refrescos y algo de dulces y galletas, cria pollos guajolotes y caballos tiene un poco de todo que le ayuda a ir saliendo con los gastos en su casa adelante. doña Rocio nos comenta que se le hace dificil darles de comer a los animales porque la pastura se acaba pronto y tinen que comprar, nos dice que el prestamo le ayuda mucho ya que puede comprar los animales que quiere alcontado y hay mayores ganancias porque los dejan mas baratos y ella misma los cria y los engorda, doña Rocio es casada ya tiene 15 años viviendo con su esposo en casa propia, tiene 4 niños, dos niños estudian y dos mas estan pequeños todavia no van a la escuela, el esposo de doña Rocio trabaja en la ciudad de México porque no encontro trabajo cerca de su casa, viene cada 8 o 15 dias a visitar a su familia.
texts.en:
The following group is located in the community of Yondesé del Cerdero, San José del Rincón.  It is a community of very limited economic resources.  The community has been paved through a little bit of work which was carried out by the town authorities but before it was just dust and loose sand.  The houses are mainly made of adobe and many are also made from wood.  The people do not know how to read, except the children who attend school. Most of the community is still just sand as the only bit that was paved was the main road.  The people are very simple, humble, kind and polite.  They haven't lost the good manners that they had in the past.

The 'Los Ositos' (Little Bears) group has 8 members: 7 women and 1 man.  All of the members are neighbors and friends.  The main business activity carried out in this community is raising livestock (pigs, sheep, cows and poultry).  The mode of transportation continues being horses.  Although the truck does pass through it isn't very frequent.

The names of the members of this group are as follows:
1.-Herminia C. U. - 39 years old
2.-Antonia C. C. - 58 years old
3.-Consuelo P. U. - 58 years old
4.- Catalina U. C. - 51 years old
5.-Sandra García H. - 28 years old
6.-Rocio S. R. - 32 years old
7.-Leonardo C. C. - 33 years old
8.-Ana Maria F. C. - 35 years old

The members of this group gave themselves the name 'Los Ositos' (Little Bears) because they didn't know what name to give their group and the names they chose were already taken by other groups.   One of the member's daughters would bring with her a teddy bear that she would cuddle and so they gave their group this name.

The group's representative is Rocio.  Rocio tells us that the members of her group have known each other for years and they have worked together before.  She tells us that they are all trustworthy and hard-working people.  They need financial help to get ahead in life.  All the members of her group raise livestock which they fatten and then sell.  Her business is buying and selling lambs.  She also has a small store in her home where she sells soft drinks and also some candy and cookies.  She raises turkeys and horses.  She has a little of everything which helps her to cover her household expenses.

Rocio tells us that it is becoming hard to feed her animals because the pasture will be finished soon and they have to buy.  She tells us that the loans help her a lot because she can buy the animals she wants for cash and this makes her more profit because she can acquire them more cheaply.  She raises the animals and fattens them herself.    Rocio is married and has been living with her husband in their own home for 15 years.  She has 4 children.  Two of her children are in school and the other two are still too young for school.  Rocio's husband works in Mexico City because he couldn't find work near home.  He comes home to visit his family every week or fortnight.

loans.use: To invest in lambs

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Morn S., 34, is married and lives with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia – an area known for palm products. S. sells groceries, earning $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 US on food and $20 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $700 US to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
La señora Melita es socia del banco comunal Juntas hasta el final del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos.
Lleva diez años perteneciendo a su banco comunal y se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, trabajo que realiza hace muchos años atrás, que le ha servido para poder educar a sus hijos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará una remalladora,  8 conos de hilos de remalle (negro y blanco).
Con la remalladora podrá dar mejores acabados a las prendas que confecciona y así podrá ganar un poquito más.

Melita agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos.  Gracias a su esfuerzo ha sabido formar bien a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien, se siente muy tranquila porque hizo un buen trabajo, siente que su dedicación no ha sido en vano.
texts.en:
Mrs. Melita is a member of the "Juntas" communal bank in the district of Yarinacocha in the department of Ucayali.  She is 49 years old and a single mother of three children.

She has belonged to the communal bank for ten years and she is a seamstress.  She has been in this activity for many years, allowing her to educate her children.

With the new 2,000 PEN loan she will buy an overlock sewing machine and 8 bobbins of thread (black and white).  She will use the machine to give her products a better finish so she can earn a more income.

Melita is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans.  Thanks to her efforts she has been able to educate her children well so they will be successful.  She feels satisfied about having done a good job and that her dedication has not been in vain.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine and 8 bobbins of thread (black and white)

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
42-year-old Elenita grows rice for a living. She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. Elenita has been growing rice for quite some time now. She says farming is the first and main source of income of her family. Elenita set aside some money from farming and used it to put up a sari-sari (variety) store. According to her, the store helps in their daily needs.

Elenita requested a loan that she will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén, de 34 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Luisa de 33 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Rubén ha logrado convertir sus cultivos en uno de los mejores de su poblado, gracias a esto, los productos que cultiva son de muy buena calidad y siempre tiene compradores que pagan muy bien por ellos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que puedan afectar sus plantas. Con el tiempo, desea comprar un carro para que pueda transportar él mismo sus productos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus chacras.
texts.en: Reuben is 34 years old and is a very responsible parent and worker. He lives in his own home with his wife Luisa of 33 years and his 3 beloved sons to whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. While working hard, Ruben has been able to convert his crops into one of the best in town. Thanks to that, the products that he grows are of very good quality and he always has buyers who pay very well for them. What he likes about his job is harvesting his products. He has been doing this work for 21 years and believes that the hardest thing is warding his crops from insect pests that may affect his plants. Over time, he wants to buy a car so he can transport his products. This is his fourth loan with field partner MFP and he knows that he has to make all of his payments on time if he wants to access another loan. He is a very accomplished and active partner in his community bank. With the two thousand nuevos soles (PEN)  requested he will buy more fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: El Limonal Group

texts.es:
En la Cuenca del Papaluapan existe una comunidad llamada Paso Rincon la cual se caracteriza por ser productora de limon, en este lugar existe la contumbre de que toda la familia trabaja en la cosecha desde los hijos hasta los padres y abuelos.

Don Vicente R. es uno de los habitantes de esta comunidad, Don Vicente(viste un pantalon negro y una playera azul) nos platica que desde hace años su padre le enseño a trabajar en el campo en la siembre de limones, el nos platica que la siembra de limon es una actividad que se realiza en familia ya que todos trabajan en la cosecha, tambien nos platica que al morrir su padre le heredó las parcelas y ahora es el quien esta acargo de la simbra y el cultivo, don Vicente no solo se dica al limon sino que tambien tiene una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes a la cual a llamado "Abarrotes Los tres R." en honor a su padre. El necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra  de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla, papel higienicas y chiles enlatados para resurtir su tienda y tambien en la compra de algunos fertilizantes para su cultivo.
Don Vicente espera que con esta inversion su negocio  prospere y deje buenas ganancias ya que desea continuar invirtiendo en el para que cada dia cresca mas.
El envia un saludo y mucho agradecimiento a todas las personas que hacen posible estos microcreditos.
Las otras 5 personas que integran este grupo son:
Guillermina L. V. - polleria
Hilda R. A. - antojotos mexicanos
Erick leonardo M. A. -Fletes y mudanza
Minerva A. M. - Pollo
Francisco P. Velazques - Productos agricolas
texts.en:
In La Cuenca del Papaluapan there is a community called Paso Rincon, known for its lemons. It is the custom here that the whole family work with the harvest, from the children to the parents and grandparents.

Mr. Vicente R. is one of the members of this community. Vicente (wearing black pants and a blue T-shirt) shared with us that many years ago, his father taught him to work in the field with the lemon harvest. He told us that planting the lemon trees is a family activity and that everyone also helps with the harvest. When his father died, he inherited the plots of land and is now in charge of the planting and harvesting. Mr. Vicente does not only work with the lemons but also has a small grocery store named "Three R. (Kings) Grocery Store" in honor of his father. He needs this loan to buy rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, candy, coffee, cookies, juice, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, peppers, onions, toilet paper, and canned chili peppers to restock his store and also to buy some fertilizer for his crops.

He hope that this investment will help his business prosper and return high earnings since he desires to keep investing in the store so that it grows more each day. He sends a greeting and many thanks to everyone who help make these loans possible.

The other five people in the group are:

Guillermina L. V. - chickens Hilda R. A. - Mexican snacks Erick Leonardo M. A. - transportation and moving Minerva A. M. - chickens Francisco P. Velazques - agricultural products

loans.use: plant lemon trees, and buy groceries and chickens

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 54 years old and married, with 4 children.  Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-sari store and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell in her store.

Edna has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari-sari store for 6 years and also earns an income from fish vending.  Edna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ecinderella

texts.en:
Ecinderella is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Ecinderella is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Ecinderella owns & operates a business buying and selling vegetable like cauliflower & broccoli in the local community. Ecinderella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ecinderella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ecinderella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables like cauliflower & broccoli. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ecinderella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables like cauliflower & broccoli

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 58 years old and married to Agnes. Together they have 6 children with ages ranging from 9 to 28. Nicholas sells various items from a small kiosk. He intends to use the requested loan of 10,000 KES to expand his business to become more profitable. He would like to move from a kiosk into a fully stocked retail shop in the future. 

Francis learned about KADET Ltd through a friend. This is his first loan with KADET. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to boost profits and expand his business. This includes increasing stock of goods like sugar, flour, biscuits and others items so that he does not have stock shortages.

loans.use: buy goods to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 35 years old and married. He has three children. He has been selling cosmetics for the past seven years. Simon was previously selling fruits. He joined a group registered under Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and have access to business loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other loans.  

Simon has requested for 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy body oil, perfumes and soap.

loans.use: to buy body oil, perfumes and soap.

loans.name: La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca, cerca de la presa de Cerro de oro existe un comunidad llamada la Candelaria la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona donde se crea ganado y se produce mucho queso en esta comunidad existe un grupo que lleva en nombre de su comunidad ya que sus integrantes pensaron que de esta manera seria mas conocido su grupo este grupo esta integrado por 10 personas.

Don Norberto es uno de los miembros de este grupo el tiene la edad de 38 años, estudio solo la secundaria y se encuentra casa do, el tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria de la comunidad. El nos platica que desde que el era muy pequeño sus padres tenia una tienda la cual se llama abarrotes Ramos y hace un poco mas de 10 años sus padres se la heredaron y ahora es el quien la atiende junto con su esposa, su tienda se encuentra ubicada en su casa en uno de los laterales.

El nos platica que siempre le a gustado tener bien surtida su tienda para que sus clientes siempre encuentre lo que buscan. El necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de frijol, arroz, arina, aceite, azucar, sal, sopa, jabon, cloro, detergentes, galletas, refrescos, dulces, papel higenico, productos enlatados(chiles, frijoles, atun), tomates, chiles, cebolla y pan para resurtir su tienda.

El espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea que su tienda cresca y sus ganancias las utilizara en pintar su tienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Ramona- Venta de Antojitos Mexicanos
Esther_ Venta de tacos
Francisca- Venta de refresco
Carmela- Venta de refresco
Manuela- Venta de abarrotes
Raquel- Venta de calzado
Gerardo- Renta de tractor
Magdalena- Venta de trastes
Gabriela- Venta de antojitos Mexicanos
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca, near the Cerro de Oro (Hill of Gold) dam there is a community named La Candelaria. This is known as a cattle-raising and cheese-making region. Here there is a group named after the community, since its members believe the name will help their group become better known. They have 10 members.

Norberto is a member of the group. He is 38 years old, studied through secondary school, and is now married with 2 children, both attending a community primary school. Norberto tells us that when he was very small, his parents had a store called Abarrotes Ramos, and a little over 10 years ago, his parents left the store to him. Now he and his wife run it. The store is located in his house and one parallel to his.

Norberto prefers keeping the store well-stocked so that his customers can always find what they are looking for. He needs this loan to buy beans, rice, flour, oil, sugar, salt, soup, soap, clorox, detergents, cookies, soft drinks, sweets, toilet paper, canned goods (chili, beans, tuna), tomatoes, chilis, onions, and bread, to restock his store.

Norberto hopes that with this investment, his business will prosper, since he wants his store to grow. His earnings will be used to paint the store and to offer a better quality of life to his children.

The remaining members of the group are:
Esther - Sells tacos
Francisca - Sells soft drinks
Carmela - Sells soft drinks
Manuela - Sells groceries
Raquel - Sells shoes
Gerardo - Rents out a tractor
Magdalena - Sells dishes and utensils
Gabriela - Sells Mexican snacks

loans.use: sell groceries, shoes, soft drinks, snacks and dishes and utensils.

loans.name: Sokong

texts.en: Sokong is a factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker and their combined income is $6 per day. Sokong has a 2-year-old child. Every month, Sokong spends $20 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on rent and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy fertilizer and seeds for farming in the rainy season in order to earn more income from doing this work. She wants to send her child to study at the university in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old and married with four children. Her occupation is teaching crafts such as embroidery and how to make sweaters and blankets. She also sells crafts she makes herself. She is asking for a loan in order to buy more materials for making her own crafts. Specifically, she plans to purchase string, yarn, beads, and lace.

Maria is passionate about craft-making and very hardworking. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more string, yarn, beads, and lace to make crafts

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a rice farmer who is married with two children. His children are not yet in school. He has been a farmer for the past eight years and he learned rice farming from his parents.

He will use his Kiva loan to support the labor costs of his rice production such as nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for his rice production

loans.name: Julia Gladys

texts.es: La señora Julia Gladys cuenta con un negocio de Elaboración y Venta de tortillas, tiene mas de diez años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, sus ventas las realiza de Lunes a sábado, las cuales son por encargos que le realizan sus vecinos, asi mismo la señora se dedica al alquiler de seis cuartos, mismos que ha ido construyendo gracias a las ganancias y prestamos que ha recibido, el credito lo utilizara para comprar laminas, clavos, pintura, ventanas, celosías, ladrillos, cemento, grava, arena entre otros. ya que necesita realizar mejoras en su casa, como ser Pintar, instalación de cielo falso y ventanas,   Gracias a los ingresos que recibe de su negocio y mas la ayuda de su esposo, han lograron graduar dos de sus hijos de la universidad, ahora solo les falta uno, y el esta estudiando ciclo común actualmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia Gladys has a business making and selling tortillas. She has more than 10 years of experience in this type of business. Her sales are conducted Monday through Saturday, which is when she receives orders from her neighbors. Sra. Julia Gladys also rents out six rooms, which were built thanks to her profits and the loans that she has received.

This loan will be used to buy boards, nails, paint, windows, lattices, bricks, cement, gravel, sand, and other materials that she needs to make improvements to her house. She will also apply paint and install a ceiling and windows. Thanks to the income generated from her business and the help of her husband, two of her children were able to graduate from university. She now has one child remaining who is currently studying basic high school courses.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene 8 hijos, 5 de ellos independientes.  Estudió hasta 4to de primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 25 ciclos, su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanía en bayetas y lanas, también se dedica a la venta de ovejas, chanchos y gallinas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos kilos de lana de todo color y bayeta para  realizar bordados, cojines, tapices y venderlos en el mercado de Juli.  La señora trabaja sola, nos cuenta que su esposo vive en la ciudad de Tacna y es profesor jubilado.
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito province, in Puno department.  She is 56 years old, married, and has eight children - five of whom live independently.  She studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Julia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 25 loan cycles.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling handicrafts made from baize and wool.  She also sells sheep, pigs and hens.

Julia will use this new loan for 1,000 soles to buy two kilos of wool in different colors and baize for making embroidered items, cushions and tapestries to sell in Juli market.  She works alone and tells us that her husband lives in the city of Tacna.  He is a retired teacher.

Julia's dream is to continue in her business and improve her income.

What Julia likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining a loan and the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy two kilos of wool in different colors and baize

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Дмитрий не женат. Он владеет небольшим магазином, который называется "Подарки". В магазине он продает игрушки, посуду, постельное белье, сувениры. Дмитрий унаследовал этот бизнес от родителей и занимается им около 1 года.
Несмотря на то, что бизнес хорошо поставлени и приносит стабильную прибыль, Дмитрий намерен развивать его дальше. Дмитрий просит кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку постельного белья. Этот товар имеет большой спрос, особенно в качестве подарка на свадьбу или день рождения. Полученную прибыль Дмитрий намерен инвестирвать обратно в бизнес.
texts.en: Dmitriy is not married.  He owns a small store, called "Gifts."  He sells toys, dishware, bedding and souvenirs in his store.  Dmitriy inherited this business from his parents and has been involved in it for about one year.  Despite the fact that the business is well-established and yields a stable profit, Dmitriy intends to develop it further.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia for the purchase of bedding.  This type of merchandise is in high demand, especially as a wedding or birthday gift.  Dmitriy plans to invest the resulting profit back into his business.

loans.use: to purchase bedding

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият трудолюбивая и умная девушка. Она занимается продажей потребительских  товаров для населения, это и  продукты питания и игрушки для детей. Хосият занимается этим бизнесом с отцом и братом. Она хочет расширить бизнес, увеличить товарооборот и максимизировать свой прибыль. Она запрашивает займ в размере 1048$ США. Хосият заранее благодарит вас за понимание
texts.en: Khosiyat is a hardworking and smart girl. She sells groceries and toys at the family's store, which she manages together with her father and brothers. She would like to expand her business, increase goods turnover and maximize profits. Khosiyat is requesting a loan of 1048 US dollars and would like to thank you all for support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 23 años de edad tiene 2 hijos, uno de 4 y otro de 1 año. Son casi 2 años los que convive con su pareja en una casa humilde pero propia. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura en terrenos de su propiedad donde siembran café, plátano, y algo de yuca para consumo de su familia. Esencialmente, ellos viven de la venta del café, por otra parte su esposo aporta otros ingresos trabajando como peón en sembríos ajenos, pero no lo hace con frecuencia. Irma está iniciando sus labores agrícolas, su familia aún es joven, por eso siempre han tenido inconvenientes, tales como la falta de presupuesto, de personal y de terrenos. Más adelante, si sus planes en el campo prosperan ella espera arreglar su casa, sustituir su techo rústico por uno de calaminas y otros detalles para darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Es su primer crédito en MFP, y espera que sea continuo por que tiene muchas ansias de crecimiento. El trabajo con “Los Yorinis” (su banco comunal) es agradable y le sirve de inspiración para seguir emprendiendo. Comprará con el dinero sacos de abonos y fertilizantes que calcula costará unos 150 soles por costal, y semillas de café para iniciar una nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Irma, 23, has two children; one is four and the other is one year old.  She’s been living with her spouse for almost two years in a humble house that’s hers, though.  She and her husband farm fields they own where they grow coffee, bananas and some manioc for family consumption.  Essentially, they live off coffee sales.  On the other hand, her husband earns extra income working as a day worker on other fields but he doesn’t do this too frequently.

Irma is starting the farming chores.  Her family is still young so she’s always had inconveniences because of that like the lack of budget, for example, and lack of personnel and land.  Later on if her plans for the fields prosper she hopes to do some home improvements, to replace the rustic roof with plywood as well as some other details to provide her children with a better quality of life.

This is her first MFP loan and she hopes it will be continuous because she very much wants to grow.  Work with “Los Yorinis” (her communal bank) is pleasant and serves as inspiration for her to continue enterprising.  She will use the money to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer that she figures will cost about 150 soles per sack and coffee seeds to start the new planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Punlork

texts.en:
Punlork, 30 years old, is a driver for a tourist company. He earns $10 per day. His wife is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. They have a four year old child. 

Every month Punlork has to spend $100 on food, $10 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy clothes for his wife to sell in the market.  When he has enough money, he wants to buy a small shop in the market for his wife to sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for his wife to sell in the market.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary, a 26-year old married father of three children, lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to educate his children and have a source of income in addition to what he earns as a special-hire transport driver in order to support his family.

Hilary began in the produce business, where he was able to raise enough income to venture into the transport sector. His challenges include the traffic officers who demand bribes and mechanical breakdowns, but in spite of these obstacles he longs to buy a mini-bus. Hillary needs this loan to complete the payment for his motor vehicle.

loans.use: to complete payment of his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 55 years old. She lives in Pho Cho town, Yen Phong, bac Ninh. She has a general store. She sells cobbler. She has had this job for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 6.048.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9.632.000 VND to buy items such as foodstuffs, drinks and dairy products for her store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, drinks and dairy products for her store.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, 47, is married and lives in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She has four children who work in a rice field and a rubber factory. She has been farming on her rice field for 25 years to make a living. She also grows vegetables. She has been growing vegetables for 4 years to generate additional income. 

Yon currently earns around 15 US dollar per day to feed her family. Now she is applying for a first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy construction materials for her new house. This loan will enable her to have a new house to accommodate her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for house construction.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family, a husband and three children. All of her children are studying. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and has operated his rickshaw for over 3 years. He facilitates the passengers with his driving services. He has fixed the charges route-wise and area-wise.

Sajida’s days are focused on managing the progress of her sewing business. She operates her sewing works to supplement the income for her family. She is a very caring lady in nature and tries to fulfill the needs of her family with her efforts.  
  
With this loan, Sajida will purchase unstitched clothes and fiber, in bulk, to be able to sew them and offer to her clients for purchasing. She is hopeful that her income will be increased by offering the stitched dresses to the clients.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fiber for her sewing business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 37 year old married woman with four children, two of whom go to school.  She has had a  food stall in Yei, south Sudan, for five years.
Esther is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan, to purchase onions and beans for sale at her food stall.  She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans for her food stall.

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children.
 
Miguelita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Miguelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Miguelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 13 years. He describes himself as determined. He operates a motorbike transportation service. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the harsh business environment imposed by the local authority. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy an additional motorbike. Joseph's  goal is to improve his business within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Selling goats is Godfrey's main business preoccupation, albeit he ekes out more income from farming. Godfrey is 29 years old and single with no kids yet. He has been transacting business for the last two years. He plies his business in Kyenjojo. He says his weekly business sales returns total 30,000 Ugandan shillings. Godfrey says he will use his loan to purchase more goats to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 26-year-old from Gaza.  She owns a small beauty salon which is the only one in the area she lives in.  She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an electricity generator and cosmetics.  She hopes that this loan will help her increase her customers and improve her income.

loans.use: buy a generator and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui  sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Akouavi Elisabeth (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 51 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Akouavi Elisabeth est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de André. Le couple à trois enfants et deux à leur charge. Akouavi Elisabeth  vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que  Akouavi Elisabeth vend de la pâte de maïs fermentée et des boules d’akassa depuis vingt ans dans sa région. Akouavi Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Akouavi Elisabeth  ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUGNON sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, des condiments et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, supports the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Wilma with her daughter Ana Mae who is 21 years old and is the fifth of eight children in the family.

Wilma is borrowing 11,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Ana Mae who is studying Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education. Ana Mae is currently on her second year of this four year course. 

When she graduates, Ana Mae plans to be a teacher and help her mother send her younger siblings to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda has a shop where she sells all kinds of presents for parties, costume jewelry and school supplies. She started her business a year ago, making a space for it in her house. She used some of her savings and some money her sister lent her as her initial capital. Linda’s 15 year old daughter and her take turns attending the shop. They open everyday from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM.

Her shop is in a great location. She set up the business because she needed to generate more income for her family. Linda wishes to take a loan to supply her shop with more novelty items and thus attract more clients.

Linda is 30 years old and has one daughter. She had to assume the responsibility of her household, so she worked whenever she could. Despite being alone, she was able to buy a house with the support of her family. Her dream is that her daughter can finish her studies and get a job. And when it comes to her shop, she hopes to be able to expand it and to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Linda tiene un bazar donde vende todo tipo de regalos para fiestas, bisutería y útiles escolares. Comenzó hace 1 año en su casa adecuando un espacio. El capital con que se inició fue con unos ahorros y un dinero que le prestó una hermana. El negocio lo atiende con su hija de 15 años y se turnan. El horario de atención es de 7:00 AM hasta 10:00 PM todos los días.

El lugar donde se encuentra el negocio tiene mucho movimiento. Ella puso el negocio porque necesitaba generar ingresos para su familia. Linda desea el préstamo para surtir más su bazar con artículos novedosos y de esta manera atraer a más clientela.

Linda tiene 30 años, con una hija, es madre soltera. Ella tuvo que asumir toda la responsabilidad en su hogar, por esta razón tuvo que trabajar en lo que ella podía. A pesar de estar sola pudo adquirir su casa con el apoyo de su familia. Su sueño es que su hija termine sus estudios y trabaje. Con respecto a su negocio, ella desea incrementarlo y generar mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Comprar regalos para fiestas, útiles  escolares

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1965. It is difficult for her to support both her old mother and her husband, who has injured feet, as well as her 3 children. Thuy's sons are students at secondary school. Her daughter is a student at high school. Thuy's family has only 1000 square meters for growing rice. Thuy's hut is 40 square meters, not enough for 6 people.

Thuy has grocery store in front of her hut. However, Thuy's main income from her grocery store is only $6 per person/month. She is very eager to receive a loan of $75 in order to increase the variety of goods in her grocery store. She believes that if her grocery store is expanded, she can get a higher income so that she is able to pay for school fees, and both her mother's and her husband's medicine. Thuy is going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To increase the variety for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fatéssi

texts.fr:
Married, and mother to a large family of eight children, Mrs. Fatéssi K. was born in Afagnan in 1960. She has a business that sells grain storage sacks. It is thanks to the income generated from this business that Mrs. K. is able to feed her children. Her husband, who remains unfit for work due to a car accident, cannot support her with the household expenses. She buys the sacks at Lomé and sells them on to farmers and grain supply merchants. The demand is high, particularly during the harvesting season. Mrs. K. is therefore requesting a $650 loan so that she can stock up on sacks before the big sowing and harvesting season. The granting of this loan will help Mrs. K. to improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère d’une grande famille de huit enfants, Madame K. Fatéssi est née à Afagnan en 1960. La vente des sacs de stockage de céréales est son commerce. C’est d’ailleurs grâce au revenu tiré de cette activité qu’elle arrive à nourrir les enfants à sa charge. Son mari ayant perdu sa force de travail après un accident de circulation ne l’accompagne pas dans les charges du ménage. Madame K. Fatéssi achète les sacs à Lomé et vient les revendre aux paysans et magasiniers de stockage de céréales. Surtout en période de récoltes, la demande devient importante. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 afin de s’approvisionner en sacs avant la grande période de semence et de récoltes. L’octroi de ce crédit aidera Madame K. à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling grain storage sacks

loans.name: Zergelan

texts.en: Zergelan A. is 49-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children in Otuziki village in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Imihsli town. Zergelan has 6 years of experience in animal breeding; she has two calves and one buffalo. She buys baby calves, feeds them and raises them for meat.  Meat is in very high demand and people use it for their meals almost every day. Zergelan now wants to expand her business and would like to start selling milk and yogurt. She is therefore requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase one milky cow for 800 USD, a calf for 250 USD and cattle fodder for the autumn season.  The estimated cost for a cow in Azerbaijan is 600-800 USD depending on how many liters of milk it can produce; and a calf is 200-400 USD, depending on how many kilograms it weighs.

loans.use: To purchase one cow for 800 USD, one calf for 250 USD and fodder for the remaining 150 USD

loans.name: Florencia Luanica

texts.pt:
Florencia is not married but she lives with the father of her 4 children. She joined the credit program in 2006. Florencia sells Tapioca, peanuts and shellfish. Before she joined the program Florencia used to buy these products in small quantities, but now she is able to acquire merchandise fore resell in bulk and at a better price. Her business is growing and she is able to help with home expenses, buy books and clothes for her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Florencia nao e casada mas vive maritalmente com um homem de quem tem 4 filhos. Ela entrou para ao programa de credito em 2006. Ela venda mariscos,tapioca e amendoim. Antes de entrar para o programa adquiria estes produtos em pequenas quantidades. Mas desde que comecou a tomar dinheiro emprestado ela passou a adquirir os produtos para a revenda em sacos. O negocio dela esta a prosperar aos poucos.Ela ja consegue comparticipar nas despesas da casa, assim como comprar livros e roupa para os filhos.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu K. is 40 years old and married with three children.  Her husband works as a security guard and his salary could not meet family expenses.  Yeabu therefore runs the business to supplement her husband’s income.  She sells spices, rice, palm oil and other essential items, and the previous loans enabled her to expand her business.  Yeabu plans to take another loan in December after she completes paying her current installments to expand her business.

loans.use: Grow her business with additional inventory

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: My name is Tahira B.. My husband runs a ready-to-wear garment business. We reside in Lahore, Pakistan, known as the city of gardens. I have two children, a son, 8, and a daughter, 9. My husband needs a loan of $250 to purchase ready-made garments for the upcoming high season. We want to expand our business so that we can offer our children a better education.

loans.use: Increase inventory of ready-to-wear garments

loans.name: Hajibaba

texts.en: Hajibaba is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fizuli region located in the southeast part of Azerbaijan. He and his family were relocated to Lokbatan settlement in the Baku suburbs as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. He has been tradeing fruits and vegetables in the local market for more than 8 years. He wants to increase the volume of sales, invest more in his business and increase his income. He has had two previous loans from Normicro Baku branch. Now he applies again for $1200, to invest in his business.

loans.use: To invest in business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa B. lives in Villanueva in Chinandega and can be described as a strong woman who, since a young age, has been breeding livestock. It is difficult work which requires willpower and a solid understanding of animals.

Her current priority is purchasing livestock. She needs calves in order to benefit the most and then market them for their meat or milk which she kindly offers to her customers in her local area. In order to achieve her aim she has turned to Ceprodel who have offered her financial support by means of loans, which she has used to buy livestock.

Her current history is 4 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Maria Luisa B. es habitante del municipio de Villanueva en Chinandega y se caracteriza por ser una dama muy esforzada que desde muy jovencita se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado. Es un trabajo muy fuerte que requiere de voluntad y mucho conocimiento de estos animales.

Su necesidad actualmente es la compra del ganado, requiere de vaquillas para sacarle el máximo provecho y luego comercializarlas ya sea en la venta de carne o leche que con mucha amabilidad ofrece a sus clientes en su sector de habitación. Para realizar esta actividad ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado apoyo financiero mediante créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de ganado en su actividad.

Actualmente su record es de 4 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Onik

texts.en: Onik lives and works in Beirut. He owns a butcher shop. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1200 to buy provisions to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni is a hard-working, enterprising young woman and very friendly. Since she was a young girl, she felt a big desire to have her own cosmetic center where she tries to highlight the presence and beauty of the persons who request her cosmetician's services. She started taking care of the people nearest to her, but after her relatives and friends saw how she was a perfectionist, extremely dedicated and patient, urged her to open her own beauty salon. At present after observing the limited space of her beauty salon and the big quantity of clients, she wants to extend and to implement her services for major serviceability. For this she needs a loan of $300, money that she will invest in buying beauty supplies to start implementing her services. You can make this happen!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Yeni es una joven hacendosa, emprendedora y muy amical, desde niña sintió un gran deseo de poseer su propio centro cosmético en donde trata de resaltar la presencia y belleza de las personas que solicitan sus servicios de cosmetóloga. Inició atendiendo a las personas más cercanas a ella, pero al ver que era sumamente detallista dedicada y paciente sus familiares y amigos la animaron a abrir su salón de belleza. Actualmente observando el reducido espacio de su salón y la gran cantidad de clientes que posee tiene pensado ampliar e implementar sus servicios para mayor comodidad, para ello requiere obtener un préstamo por el monto de 800.00 soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de artículos de belleza para terminar de implementar sus servicios. En tus manos está posibilitar su petición.

loans.use: Have a working capital to improve her beauty salon.

loans.name: Maria Esthela

texts.es:
Esthela started her business because the company where she worked was liquidated and also because she had an illness that prevented her from spending much time out of the house. She needed to have a source of income to support her husband who worked as a driver. Fourteen years ago she opened a grocery store, which has been bringing in good income.

She now needs a loan of US$600, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise and to have more stock in her grocery store. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Esthela qué inició el negocio porque la liquidacion de la empresa donde trabajaba, para invertirlo y poder iniciar un negocio, aunado a una enfermedad que sufrio, que no permita que pudiera trabajar mucho tiempo fuera. Ella necesitaba tener una fuente de ingresos para aopyar a su esposo quien trabja como chofer. Comenzó hace catorce años con una tienda de avarrotes, la cual le ha generado buenos ingresos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 600 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar mercancia y tener mas surtida la tienda de abarrotes. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun K., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Veng, 44, who live on an Island of MeK. River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh, have been married since she was nineteen years old and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Two of their children have full time employment in Phnom Penh. One child is in school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver since 2000, a skill she learned from her neighbour. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sophal is a farmer and raises cows in the village. 

Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase silk material for weaving and some to buy straw for feeding cows in flooding season.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and  to buy straw to feed the cows

loans.name: Wiñaypaq Quñukusun Group

texts.en:
The community of Calzada belongs to the district of Rosario, province of Acombamba, department of Huancavelica. Calzada is approximately 3800 meters (12,500 ft) above sea level, a community economically based on raising livestock (cattle, sheep), agriculture (barley, wheat, oats, potatoes) and in some cases traD. activities in the fairs in the district capitals (Acobamba and Paucará). The population is sparse and it usually takes five minutes to get from house to house.

Village bank member Julia A. S. has a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($355 USD) and according to her testimony she says: "I have a business to buy and sell livestock and I bring them to the Acobamba and Paucará fairs and in order to sell I need to leave at two in the morning and reach the fairs. In a few years I hope to have enough animals in order to raise and sell them when I need to. Furthermore I have a grandchild that is with me and studies at Puca Cruz. In the future I hope that he studies to become a professional after he finishes high school. In FINCA Perú I am saving for the future of my grandchild because he is the only one by my siD.. Also I want to increase my livestock. Now that I am with FINCA Perú, I have learned to save and work with more confidence, more responsibility and also to attend the training sessions."

Guillerma P. P. is working with a loan of 600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($213 USD) and says the following: " I have a business to buy and sell livestock, principally sheep and at times cattle. When I see that an animal is fat I am able to sell it in the fair. My dream is to have much more livestock, to be able to raise and sell more of them in the future. I am going to save for my children´s education. Now that I have joined FINCA Perú I am going to learn how to save, because I have neighbors and relatives that have joined FINCA Perú and they tell me it is very nice to belong to a village bank. I will listen to the organization´s training, share with the other clients, work with more responsibility and acquire some items that we need. I will receive training that FINCA has promised and I am going to learn many valuable things that I want for my family and myself."

loans.use: Commercial livestock raising (cattle, sheep)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a large variety of goods to restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Mrs. Duch Channy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of ten people, is located in Ta Kret Village in Kampong Cham Province.  Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.  Mrs. Duch C. is the village bank president and she was born in 1961.  She is a farmer who cultivates twice a year.  During the rainy season, she cultivates rice while growing vegetables in the dry season.  Her husband, Mr. Kem Touch, is a cow middleman who buys cows and re-sells them later at a better price.  Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife, Mrs. Duch C., decided to ask for a loan to buy more calves for breeding in order to re-sell.  Mrs. Duch C. has five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the remaining two are attending school. 

This village bank loan is an end-of-term loan and all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more calves for breeding in order to re-sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita inicio el negocio por que como su esposo tuvo que dejar de laborar debido a una lesión en la cintura. Ella le gustaba las ventas y la invitaron a vender cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien además de que es algo que disfruta hacer. Comenzó aproximadamente hace 10 años con la venta de los productos, primero vendía solo algunas cremas y fragancias pero ahora tiene mucha clientela y vende productos de todas las líneas, en ocasiones hace rifas, loterías y eso le ayuda a tener mas ganancias y sus clientes están contentos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $175 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir una mercancía de fragancias que tiene encargadas tanto de hombre como mujer.
texts.en:
Margarita started her business when her husband was forced to stop work because of an injury to his waist. She liked sales and started selling cosmetics; it has gone very well, and it is something she enjoys doing. Her business started about 10 years ago with the sale of products. She first sold only a few creams and fragrances but now has many customers and sells products in all lines. She sometimes makes raffles and lotteries, and that increases her profit and customer satisfaction. She needs a loan of $175, which she will repay in 6 months, to make a good fragrance that attracts men as much as women.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Kodzo
