texts.fr: Kodzo M. est conducteur de taxi. Agé de 42 ans, Kodzo est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il aimerait par ce crédit réparer sa voiture afin de pouvoir relancer son activité ; étant donné que le moteur de sa voiture est usée, ce qui lui cause éventuellement d’énormes charges. Avec cette chance, Kodzo espère mieux travailler pour gagner plus afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Kodzo M. is a taxi-driver. Aged 42, Kodzo is married and the father of 3 children. He would like to use this loan to repair his taxi so that he can get back to business. Since the motor of his taxi is well worn, it may cause him to have huge charges. With this opportunity, Kodzo hopes to be able to work better so as to earn more and support his family appropriately.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repair his car (used as a taxi)

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 54 años, es madre soltera, vive son su hija y el esposo de esta. Se dedica a la venta de manualidades por campaña, realiza cadenillas, rosones de cintas para los adornos de las empresas cuando están de aniversario, coronas, muñecos navideños, etc. para venderlos cuando es su temporada. El negocio es rentable porque gracias a los 20 años de experiencia, Leticia se ha hecho conocida en el medio y recibe grandes pedidos, lo cual hace que siempre se mantenga ocupada. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es que con los varios pedidos que recibe, a veces no se abastece para poder cumplirlos todos, además que a su edad, su vista no funciona tan bien como antes, pero gracias a su empeño y al apoyo de su hija, Leticia piensa seguir hacia delante a cumplir todas sus metas. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de material para realizar manualidades navideñas, ahora que la navidad esta tan próxima.
texts.en:
Leticia is a 54-year-old single mother who lives with her daughter and son-in-law. She makes seasonal handicrafts—such as decorative paper chains, gift wrap bows as ornaments for company celebrations, wreaths, Christmas dolls, etc.—which she sells according to the season. Her business is lucrative because thanks to her 20 years of experience, Leticia has made a name for herself in this trade. She receives big orders, which means that she is always kept busy. The most difficult aspect of her job is filling all the orders. Furthermore, at her age, her sight is not what it used to be, but thanks to her dedication and to her daughter's support, Leticia plans on moving ahead and reaching all her goals. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has been very punctual with her payments. With the loan being requested, she will purchase a greater quantity of supplies to make Christmas handicrafts now that the holidays are approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make handicrafts

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N., 55 ans, mariée, 08 enfants et 03 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de cola, de petit cola et de gâteaux. Khady participe à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
55-year-old Khady N. is married and has three children in her care in addition to her own eight. She has been a member of the Khodoba village bank for five and a half years. Khady wants to bolster her trade in kola nuts, petit kola nuts and cakes. She shares in the daily expenditures for her family, and is asking for a loan that will be repaid in a lump sum payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of kola nuts, petit kola nuts and cakes

loans.name: Rosa Lily

texts.es:
ROSA LILY RODRIGUEZ D. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Ricardo Palma Nº 225 del Distrito D. Callería en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 65 años D. edad, 04 hijos mayores, todos ellos, su esposo es constructor.

El primer prestamo que recibio fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró ropas D. segunda, viajaba a diferentes lugares D. la ribera del Río Ucayali, vendiendo sus mercaderías.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró un fardo D. ropas usadas, pescado seco 02 sacos. Está lista para viajar nuevmente por la ribera del Río Ucayali, pues sus clientes le esperan.

Agradecieda D. Manuela Ramos por apoyarla, confiar en ella a pesar D. su edad avanzada, pero con muchas energías D. trabajar.
texts.en:
ROSA LILY RODRIGUEZ D. M., a member of the Banco Comunal "Mujeres Solidarias" located in the Jr Ricardo Palma Number 225 in the Calleria District in the city of Pucallpa, is 65 years old, has 4 older children, and her spouse is a construction worker. The first loan she received was in the amount of s/.300.00 New Soles, with which she bought second-hand clothing, and utilized to travel to different locations along the coast of the river Ucayali selling her wares. With this loan of S/1,500.00 New Soles, she bought a bundle of used clothing, and 2 sacks of dried fish . She is ready to travel once again down the shore of the Ucayali river, for her clients await her. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her and trusting in her great willingness to work in spite of her advanced age.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar un fardo de ropas usadas y pescado seco (2 sacos).

loans.name: Johari

texts.en: Johari M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and married woman with five children. Two twins are in kindergarten and two children are in primary school. Joha runs a business of selling charcoal at Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the charcoal directly from the producers wholesale and sells it retail to customers at Vituka. In each trip, she carries seventy charcoal bags, and she makes two trips per month. Charcoal is a main source of power in most developing countries in Africa due to the instability and high price of electricity. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to purchase more charcoal bags to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more stock (charcoal)

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. is 60 years old. She is a widow and has given birth to nine children. Currently, four of them attend school. She lives together with some of her children in the family house in a town called Nkwaateng, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Hawa lost her husband after a short ailment.

She works zealously as a single parent to support her family and provide for the children’s schooling. She is a fishmonger and also sells used clothes. She sells her wares out of a shed in the local market square. She procures her goods from larger fishmongers who sell at wholesale prices in the towns of Yeji and Mankessim. Hawa has been in business for ten years. According to Hawa, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually to help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Joshua Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Don Jose E. Chavez Batz es originario de la comunidad de Juchanep a 8 Kilometros de la ciudad de Totonicapan en su comunidad es conocido como chepito, desde su niñez fue aprendiendo el arte de la tejeduria en las epocas de los ochenta y noventa la tejeduria por el altiplano del occidente es muy reconocido por la labor que se realiza en su preparacion don Jose  hoy en dia  el lucha para que su arte se mantenga y la cual va generando nuevos diseños para poder sobre vivir en el mercado de las artesanias el visita las oficinas de Asdir para solicitar un credito la cual lo invertira en la compra de materiales para un nuevo colaborador y con ello le permite mejora  el nivel de vida y de su familia
texts.en:
Jose E. Chavez Batz is originally from the community of Juchanep, eight kilometers from the city of Totonicapan. In his community, he is known as Chepito. Since his childhood, he learned the art of weaving through the 80s and 90s. The western plateau is well known for the work put into this weaving. Today, Jose is fighting to keep his art and to generate new designs to be able to survive in the artisan market. He visited the Asdir offices to request a loan, which he will use to purchase materials for a new partner and thus improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand capital

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Mrs. Melodina B. is 49 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer and they own a little parcel of land. Although it is her husband who cultivates this land, gardening has also become her own primary activity. It began as a back-yard gardening project and eventually led to selling a few of her garden vegetables during market day.

She’s thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for providing them with financial assistance in the past. She is now applying for PHP 20,000 to buy farm pesticides and fertilizers for her garden. She also wants to buy a cow.

She has many plans for the future. One of her dreams is that someday, she will be the one supplying vegetables in the market.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizers and a cow.

loans.name: Kalump Group

texts.en:
This is Sheik Ibrahim K., Mamusu K. and Bassie T.. Sheik Ibrahim K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of the group. He has been a businessman and farmer since childhood. Sheik Ibrahim sells a number of items, including sugar, cigarettes, biscuits, mints, toothbrushes, pastes, and so on. He is 55-years of age. His wife is a businesswoman. Sheik Ibrahim K. has 16 children, all of whom are still in primary and secondary schools. He was born in Pat fu village, five miles from Makeni. Sheik Ibrahim will use this loan to further expand on his business.

This group is named Kalump, a Temne word for truthfulness. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Makump village, about five miles from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. These previous loans have had meaningful impact on the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They've also been able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 leones each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

loans.use: To buy goods for retail

loans.name: Antoinette Yawa

texts.fr: Dame T. Antoinette Yawa est née à Badou qui est une ville fruitière de la région des plateaux au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits de consommation courante à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2007 et a connu beaucoup de succès. Elle désire augmenter son stock afin de mieux vendre et sollicite de KIVA un premier crédit pour acheter cinq (5) bidons d’huille, 5 cartons de lait et d’autres boîtes de conserve.
texts.en:
Antoinette Yawa T. was born in Badou, a fruit-producing town in the Plateaux Region in Togo. She's married and the mother of two children. Her money-making business consists in selling food staples in Lomé. She started this business in 2007, with great success. She wishes to bolster her stock to sell more, and she's seeking her first loan from Kiva, in order to purchase 5 cans of oil, 5 boxes of milk, and other canned food products.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 cans of oil, 5 boxes of milk, and other canned food products

loans.name: José De Dios

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José De Dios V. le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor y un portón, esto es para la seguridad de su casa ya que El y su esposa la señora Betzabe Márquez, trabajan casi todo el día y la vivienda se queda sola. 
El señor José De Dios V. trabaja en una compañía de paquetería en el departamento de repartidor y su esposa trabaja en el aria de administración de una compañía, esto son sus ingresos para darles lo mejor a su familia.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Betzabe Márquez ya que el señor José De Dios no se encontraba en su casa en ese momento.
texts.en:
Mr. José De Dios V.’s house needs a protective wall and a gate for safety because he and his wife, Ms. Betzabe Márquez, work almost all day long, so their house is empty.

Mr. José De Dios V. works in the delivery department of a courier company, while his wife works in administration for a company. They have these jobs to be able to give their family the best.

The woman in the photo is Ms. Betzabe Márquez because Mr. José De Dios was not home at the time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a protective wall and install a gate

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. is 35 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Mary is a fishmonger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. Mary buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for over 15 years and wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk. Mary desires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola sells textbooks. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more textbooks to sell. Ola is 41 years old and married with a child. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks to sell

loans.name: Shgofa Group

texts.en:
Shgofa and Nafesa want to take out a loan for a carpet weaving business . Lailaw wants to take out a loan for a shop selling curtains. Sheren wants to take out a loan for her husband, who is a taxi driver. Razui wants to take out a loan for an embroidery business.

Shgofa is the leader of this group. There are five members and each of them wants a loan to expand their business. They have requested a group loan of 50,000 afghani. They admire this process so much!

loans.use: For a carpet weaving business

loans.name: Rouwayda

texts.en: Rouwayda is a 39-year-old married women living with her husband and three young children. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 1999 and has 20 years of experience in this field. Today, Rouwayda is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy additional textiles so she can satisfy the heavy demands of her clientele and help increase her income.

loans.use: Buy additional textiles

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina B. sells kenkey. She buys maize, processes it into dough, and wraps it in corn husk, boils it, and then sells at Elmina near Ntenman. Sabina has received a senior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a fitter. Sabina has been selling kenkey since 2000. She uses the profits from her business to pay her children's school fees and the family's utility bills. 

She will use her loan to buy palm oil, maize and palm nuts for kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, maize and palm nuts for kenkey.

loans.name: Joséphine's Group

texts.fr: A. Joséphine est mariée à HOUNSAMONON Antoine, un tailleur. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants qui sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis trois ans à DAVATIN dans la Commune de Sèmè-Kpodji. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Joséphine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Joséphine a fait juste le cours primaire ; et maintenant Joséphine vend la pâte de maïs de façon ambulante. Joséphine vend aussi des produits cosmétiques et des mèches de coiffure sur commande et à crédit. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Joséphine achète ses produits. Joséphine a déjà cinq ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Joséphine a eu neuf crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Joséphine demande un dixième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Joséphine is married to HOUNSAMONON Antoine, a tailor.  This couple has four children of their own to support.  For three years, the family has been residing in DAVATIN, in the community of Sèmè-Kpodji. Thanks to the income from her business, Joséphine comes to her husband's aid in covering family expenses.  Joséphine has only finished elementary school; and now, she goes door-to-door selling pâte de maïs (a kind of boiled polenta).  She also sells cosmetics and hair extensions for hairdressing, per special order and on credit.  Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where she purchases her goods.  She already has five years of experience in this business.  She had nine ALIDé loans before and has repaid them.  She was able to use them to raise her level of business.  To continue to develop her business, Joséphine is asking for a third loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María G. D. C. vive en Cojutepeque municipio D. Cuscatlán junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la mecánica automotriz y sus dos hijos. Ana tiene su negocio el cual tiene diez años al servicio D. sus clientes, Ana tiene un pupuseria que es muy conocida en la zona, las ventas D. Ana son diarias, ella solicita D. un crédito para comprar insumos con cuales aumentara la producción D. pupusas.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para su negocio

loans.name: Fa

texts.fr:
Madame Fa G. voudrait investir dans le secteur d'aviculture avec sa crédit de 100.000 CFA.  Elle est une résidente de Camberene, une banlieue de Dakar pas loin de la mer.  Madame G. envisage une augmentation de revenu de 30.000 CFA par mois avec son crédit.  Elle est mariée avec des enfants.

Madame G. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms. Fa G. would like to invest in the field of poultry farming with a loan of 100,000 CFA. She is a resident of Camberene, a suburb of Dakar not far from the sea. Ms. G. foresees an increase in revenue of 30,000 CFA per month with this loan. She is married and has children. Ms. G. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) and the Programme de développement de l'infant et de la famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community, and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can benefit from loans having more flexible terms as compared to ordinary loans. Since the establishment of the agreement in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: James

texts.en: Mr. M. James is a promising man of thirty years-old.  He has a retail shop selling mattresses. The business is located at the Kabwohe trading centre and he has worked in the area for two years. He is planning to use the loan to purchase more mattresses in order to have a larger stock to better meet the demands of his customers. He also has a plantation which sometimes helps him generate income to care for his family. His future hope is to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To purchase mattresses.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Juana Mercedes A. P., tiene la edad de 59 años, 
Habita en el barrio la borgoña,  ella es madre soltera, tiene tres hijas ya todas independientes, a su cargo tiene una nieta de catorce años que le apoya con las actividades del hogar después del colegio, doña Juana desde hace quince años labora como empleada domestica en una casa privada en los altos de santo domingo, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción, agradece a la institución por la buena 
Aprobación de su primer crédito, el cual lo va a invertir en materiales como: arena, cemento, para repellar las paredes, a si como embaldosar el piso que es de tierra. Si le ajusta comprara también el zinc para poder gozar de un techo digno junto a su familia que a mucho esfuerzo esta logrando. Da las gracias a la institución por permitir a muchas familias de bajos recursos económicos poder lograr sus metas mediante el plazo del préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes A. P. is 59 years old and lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood of Managua. She is a single mother of three girls, all now grown and living independently. She also is raising a 14-year-old granddaughter who helps with the housework after school.

For 15 years Juana has worked as a domestic in a private home in the hills of Santo Domingo. The biggest difficulty has been that her income does not allow her to purchase, at one time, the construction materials she needs to improve her house.

With this, her first loan, she will buy sand and cement to plaster the walls and put tiles on the floor, which is now dirt. If there is enough money, she will also buy metal roofing. She would like to enjoy a proper home with her family, and has worked hard to achieve it.

She thanks the lending institution for allowing many low-income families to achieve their goals through loans.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, cement, and metal roofing to complete her house

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, no cuenta con estudios y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà cereales de la región como: chuño, papa, cebada, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su casa en Tacna y así poder vivir feliz con su familia.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Petrona, 43, is a member of the “Manuelas de Hoy II” communal bank. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a single mother of two children. She has never gone to school and she is a grains merchant. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years now and her first, 300 new sol, loan from her communal bank was used to buy cereals. She now needs 1500 new soles to buy regional cereals like: chuño (freeze-dried potato), potato, barley, etc. Her wish for the future is to have a house in Tacna in which to live happily with her family. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy freeze-dried potato, potato, barley, etc.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is forty-five-years-old. She is divorced and has seven children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Emilia works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey with fried fish. She sells by the road side. Emilia buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella E. is 36 years old and is married with two children. Her children go to school and they are still dependent on her. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home.

Stella owns a fashion house where she designs clothes for her customers. She also sells clothes and tailoring materials like needles, thread and zips. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and clothes to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 35-year-old single mother of two children, ages twelve and three years old. Her twelve-year-old is attending school. She is a farmer in the Murang'a area of the Central Province of Kenya. She's been a farmer for twelve years and sells milk, eggs, bananas, 'sukuma wiki' (kale), and grains. The main challenge in her business is insufficient acreage to plant more fodder (animal feed). She must lease a farm and employ laborers for the cows. She says that sources of capital to undertake more projects are limited.

She successfully completed two previous loans through Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan for Kes 40,000 to purchase a chaff cutter, which is a device for cutting feed for cattle. In the future, she would like to have a bigger poultry project with over 2,000 layers and at least one good cow producing forty litres a day. She says that she hopes to continue to be a Juhudi client, and that she will be able to save money for her family now because the chaff cutter will reduce waste and the cost of feed.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is a for-profit social enterprise focused on the economic development of Kenya. It has a unique approach to financing agribusiness value chains, from production of raw products to processing and delivery of goods: by providing asset financing and technical assistance funding to smallholder farmers and rural enterprises. This approach to poverty alleviation supports sustainable wealth creation in rural communities, establishes local engines of income generation, and generates employment, economic growth and dynamism as well as demand for inputs.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter to cut fodder

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chan N. is is 29 years old and from Run village in Takeo province. He is a motorbike taxi driver, and his wife, Mrs. Oun Phem, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows crops. The couple has four children between six and sixteen years of age, and they are all students in the local school.

Chan is the village’s president of a loan group consisting of fifteen members. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. In his case, Chan is requesting 800,000 KHR from AMK to buy lumber to repair his home.

loans.use: To buy lumber to repair his house.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector Callanca del distrito de Monsefú, una zona agricola ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero en una fabrica de ladrillos ubicada cerca a su vivienda, pero como esta actividad no le provee los ingresos necesarios para sustentar a su familia también se dedica a la agricultura: posee media hectárea de terreno de cultivo donde suele sembrar hortalizas y diversos cereales.

Miguel desea instalar en su terreno el cultivo de maíz, pero aún le falta completar el dinero necesario para realizar esta acción, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de semilla certificada y de fertilizantes para instalar y mantener su cultivo.

El es un padre trabajador y bastante honrado. Su mayor anhelo es darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Miguel, 45, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Callanca sector of Monsefú district; this is an agricultural area located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He works as a laborer in a brick factory near his house but, because this employment does not produce sufficient income to support his family, he also farms. He has half an acre of farmland where the tends to grow vegetables and grains. Miguel wants to start to plant corn but needs funds to do so. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles to buy certified seed and fertilizers for his crops. He is a hard-working and quite honest father. His greatest wish is to provide his family with a better quality of life. He has collaborated previously with our Institution and has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible client with respect to meeting his repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy certified corn seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La Sra. Estela E. Hernández es trabajadora activa de una financiera también vende ropa nueva ambulante en el municipio los fines de semana, el crédito lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, perlines y clavos para reparar la cocina de su casa ya que viene el invierno y necesita reparar el techo. Es madre soltera tiene dos niñas. Ya tiene siete años de trabajar con nosotros y todos sus créditos los ha invertido en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela E. Hernández works at a financial institution but she also works on the weekends as a street vendor selling new clothes in her municipality. She is requesting the loan to buy construction materials such as roofing materials, steel framing and nails to repair the kitchen in her house since the winter season is coming and the roof needs repairs. She is a single mother and has two girls. She has been working with our organization for 7 years and she has invested all the loans in home repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy roofing materials, steel framing and nails

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 28 years, married with one child and one dependent.  Beatha is a self-employed businesswoman who owns a small shop selling a variety of goods such as cooking oil, baths, saucepans, plastic shoes, cosmetic products etc.  Beatha has been in this business for about three years and the hours of her business are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Beatha wants to expand her business through adding new goods like clothes and shoes.  Those additional goods will hopefully increase her revenue.  To this end, Beatha is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  If Beatha is successful in her business, she hopes that she will be able to attract more and different customers and increase her sales in the process.  With this business success, Beatha will continue to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: New goods such as clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza 3 Group

texts.en:
Binet is the coordinator of her group Jesus Nuestra Esperanza (Jesus is our hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a city on the North Coast of the DR, with an economy based around tourism, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their four children.

Binet is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business creating curtains, by purchasing the materials she needs to create them such as fabric, decorations and thread. She will use the profits to invest in her home by installing a concrete floor, a major improvement in an area where rains often turn mud floors into unsanitary cesspools. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy material for making curtains and bed covers.

loans.name: Vallecito Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VALLECITO”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. LIDIA,  ella tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente  y vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia ayuda a su conyugue en la carpintería, ella da los acabados a los diferentes muebles y juntos son un equipo. Nuestra socia ahora desea el préstamo para comprar una cepilladora, cierra circular y una serda.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, dedicándose en su mayoría a prestar servicios como, las llamadas a celulares, carpintería, bisutería, alquiler de taxis, panadería, tienda de abarrotes, bazar librería, movilidad de colegio. Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los  socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “Vallecito” communal bank. They live in the Huanchac district, in the Cusco province, in the department of Cuzco. Our member is Lidia. She is 37 years old. She lives with her partner in the San Sebastián district. She alternates her domestic activities with retail. She helps her partner with carpentry. She puts the finishing touches on the different items of furniture and together they are a team. Lidia needs the loan to buy a planer, a circular saw, and a wire brush. Our members alternate their various activities with retail, mostly in services such as renting cell phones for individual calls, carpentry, costume jewelry, taxi rides, bread store, grocery store, book store, and school transportation. Our members are requesting the loan to reinvest in their different businesses. The members are grateful for and appreciate the support provided through this program and they promise to repay their loans in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a planer, a circular saw, and a wire brush.

loans.name: Sairan's Group

texts.en:
Sairan R. is the leader of the group. She is 48 and married. Her husband works as a welder. Sairan has four children: three sons and a daughter. All of them go to school except the youngest son, who goes to kindergarten. When children are not at school, they help their mom with housework.  Sairan has been fattening and reselling cattle for five years. She makes 5,000 soms ($109.40) a month. The initial investment in this business activity was 4,000 soms ($87.53). At the moment, Sairan owns 30 small farm animals and 5 cattle. She wants to get a loan to purchase more cattle. In the future, Sairan wishes to have enough money to pay for her children to go to college (university). 

Burulcha S. is 43 and married. Burulcha is the treasurer of the group. Her husband works as a private builder. They have a daughter and a son. The son helps to take care of the cattle. They own 20 small farm animals and 2 cattle. In this way, Burulcha makes 5,000 soms ($109.40) a month. She needs a loan to purchase two cattle.

Aishabubu I. is 40 and she is married. Her husband is a farmer. They have five children and all of them help Aishabubu with housework.  With money received from loan, Aishabubu will buy 60 liters of fuel and 20 kilograms of seeds for farming.

Sabira Z. is 46 and she is divorced. She has a daughter and a son. The son works as a welder and the daughter is a student. Sabira wants to get a loan to pay for tractor-driver services and purchase 100 liters of fuel, which is needed for farming. 

Sairabubu S. is 56 and married. Her husband is a shepherd. They have eight children. All of the children live separately with their own families, except the youngest son. The son and his wife help Sairabubu with housework. With money received from loan, Sairabubu will buy 150 liters of fuel, which is needed for sowing.  In the future, Sairabubu wishes to build a house for her youngest son.

Kulumkan S. is 51 and married. Her husband works as a welder. They have three sons and all of them work in construction. Kulumkan has been selling national drinks for 14 years, in this way she makes 5,000 soms ($109.40) a month. The initial investment in this business activity was 500 soms ($10.94). Now Kulumkan wants to get a loan to purchase primary products.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rubina Kousar's Group

texts.en: Rubina Kousar lives with her two children in a two room brick house situated in Vehari, Pakistan. A very caring lady, Rubina stays at home and manages the household chores. She also supports her husband by taking care of his animals. He is an animal seller, and has been operating a business for the last fifteen years. Rubina is applying for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan, and a partner of Kiva) for the first time.  She will invest the capital in her husband’s business, so he can purchase goats and meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase goats for selling

loans.name: Akoko Antoinette

texts.en: Akoko Antoinette W. is a 23-year-old entrepreneur who works selling onions. Although she is quite young she has been working for about five years. She is married to a man who works transporting merchandise. They have one child. Mrs. W. has requested her first loan from WAGES microfinance in the amount of 200,000 CFA to purchase more onions to sell.

loans.use: To purchase onions to sell

loans.name: Ane

texts.en:
Ane S. is 34 and married with four children.  She owns a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Ane has four years of experience in this business.  Ane needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Ane joined SPBD.  This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Ane's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii and Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Najeebullah 315 Group

texts.en: Najeebullah is the group leader of Najeebullah 315 group. He is resident of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with five children and is responsible for all expenses of the house and family. He owns a small shop in which he sells vegetables and fresh fruits. With the income from his work, he supports his family members. He needs the loan to purchase more vegetables and different kinds of fruits to attract more clients. He hopes to progress more in the future and be a good business dealer.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Adjara

texts.fr: cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de vêtements pour enfant. elle les achète au grand marché de lomé et les revend à ses clients avec une légère marge bénéficiaire. elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante. elle voudrait s'approvisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de quelques habits pour enfants constitués de trousseaux de bébé, T-shirt, jupe,culotte, chaussette, pantalon. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman runs a money-making business selling children's clothing. She buys them at the big market of Lomé and resells them to her clients at a small profit margin. She runs a travelling business. She would like to stock up on supplies and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy some children's outfits including baby clothes, T-shirts, skirts, underwear, socks and pants. She is married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A. is currently in the business of selling soda, mango juice and ice cream at a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of soda, water and mango juice to sell.  Betty is 22 years-old and married with a husband that is a police officer. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock two fridges for keeping soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase crates of soda, water and mango juice.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de profesora del nivel inicial, ella trabaja en el distrito de Pachar provincia de Urubamba que queda ubicado 30 minutos de Urubamba y tambien tiene un pequeño restaurant donde prepara almuerzos, la socia quiere mejorar su restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sillas y mesas para el restaurant.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Isabel, 47, is a single mother of a son. She combines her daily activities with being an elementary school teacher. She works in Pachar district, Urubamba province, located 30 minutes from Urubamba. She also has a small restaurat where she prepares lunches. She wants to improve her restaurant and is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs for it. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to thank those who participate in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional drinks

loans.name: Khlang

texts.en: Khlang R. is a 54 year old widowed mother, and lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is the mother of three children; two are married and one is single. She doesn’t have a life partner as her husband because her husband died years ago. Khlang R. weaves mats in her house, and then takes them to the market every day to sell. Khlang R. depends on the income from her children, who work at different jobs. Her daughter always needs to hire a taxi to deliver her to work because she has no a vehicle. Khlang R. is looking for a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle to aid with her daughter's traveling.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle for her daughter's traveling.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth B. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Tinago, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a rice retailing  business. Her husband, Raul B., who is 51 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 6 and 26 years old. Ruth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past fourteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ruth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5600, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifteenth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to use for additional capital for her rice retailing so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Ruth is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To use as capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel S. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old. Fidel is married and has 4 adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Fidel owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a transportation service. Fidel has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fidel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Fidel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Fidel is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Fidel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy tires and other accessories for transport business

loans.name: Michael Group

texts.es:
El grupo Michael lo conforman cuatros personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Agne Janette A. José de 42 años se dedica a la producción y comercio de artesanía tallada en madera aproximadamente 15 años. Ella inicio con el negocio cuando conoció a su esposo quien le trabajaba a su madre como tallador.
Ella sueña en invertir en una producción internacional y vender fuera del paiz.
Las otra integrantes de grupo son Carmen  C. de 33 años tiene una venta de video juegos, Rebeca Vanegas tiene un taller de carpintería y Paula M. Pérez vende bolsos de manila desde hace cinco años
texts.en:
The Michael group has four hard working members.  One of them is Agne Janette A. José, 42, who has made and sold carved wood handicrafts for the last 15 years.  She started the business when she met her husband who worked for his mother as a wood carver.  She dreams with investing in international production and selling abroad.

The other members of the group are: Carmen C., 33, who sells video games, Rebeca Vanegas who has a carpentry shop and Paula M. Pérez who has sold Manila bags for the last five years.

loans.use: For carved wood handicrafts.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 59 años, convive con José, de 60 años de edad. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Luis, de 18 y Milton, de 20 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Está trabajadora mujer, se dedica a la siembra de café, plátanos, y demás productos de pan llevar, ya tiene 3 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Todos los días desde al amanecer hasta el anochecer, se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, los que después de cada cosecha se comercializa en la ciudad de Villarica y el café los vende en la asociación de su localidad. Rosa es una mujer muy dedicada, y como pocas personas de su edad, ella quiere salir adelante, por ello quiere aprender a leer y firmar, las ganas de salir adelante es lo que más ambiciona. Ahora ella quiere sembrar más cantidad de café, para poder comercializarlo en los diferentes lugares del país. Esté es el quinto crédito con MFP, y como tesorera de su banco comunal está orgullosa de su banco comunal, y se compromete con el apoyo incondicional y el trabajo arduo. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la contrata de peones para cosechar su producción de caigua y rocoto, asimismo comprará abono orgánico para esparcir en sus 2 hectáreas de sembríos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old.  She lives with her partner, 60 year-old José.  They have 9 children but only live with 2 of them: 18 year-old Luis and 20 year-old Milton.  They live together in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (central Peruvian jungle).  This hard-working woman grows coffee, bananas and cereals.  She has been farming for 3 years.  Every day from dawn to dusk she looks after her land.  After every harvest she sells her produce in the city of Villarica.  She sells her coffee in the association in her town.

Rosa is a very committed woman and, like few people of her age, she wants to get ahead.  For this reason, she would like to learn to read and sign.  Her desire to get ahead is what she has as her biggest ambition.  Rosa would like to grow a larger quantity of coffee so that she can sell it in different parts of the country.

This is Rosa's fifth loan from MFP and, as treasurer of her community bank, she is proud of her community bank and pledges unconditional support and hard work.  She will use her loan to invest in hiring laborers to harvest her 'caigua' (a native bean) and rocoto pepper crops.  She will also buy organic manure to spread on her 2 hectares of crops.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her crops.  To buy organic manure

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang B. is a single mother caring for two children, both of whom attend the local school and are dependent on her income. She was married years ago, but divorced her husband. She is a sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn money to ensure that her children attain the highest level of education. To earn a living, she sells fresh beef and dessert to people who are passers-by in the village. Sang B. will use the loan as extra capital to sustain her business growth. This will allow her to gain more income and more valued customers. Sang B. hopes that she can use the rest of her fund to add to her personal savings to purchase a used motorbike for her family.

loans.use: To use as extra capital to sustain her business growth.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman who lives in Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two businesses: one a passenger transport (by motorized tricycle) and the other a general store. Her husband Felixardo, who is 32 years old, drives the tricycle to earn his living. They have four children who are 1 to 7 years old. 

Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly income of 8,400 PHP, bettering the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as down payment for another motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of business and the education of her children. 

Marilyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle transport

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en: Leoncie is 33 years old, and she has three children. The youngest is five years old while the eldest is 9 years old. Leoncie sells children's second-hand clothes, and she is requesting this loan in order to buy more clothing to sell. With the profits she plans to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying second-hand children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Jazmín se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, en el estado de Puebla, México, está conformado por 5 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Petra A. M. va a comprar con su crédito barro, leña, greta, para la elaboración de cazuelas y jarros y los vende crudos, la señora Jorgina B. T. va a comprar barro, leña, pintura para elaboración de cazuelas, la señora Margarita M. V. va a comprar leña, barro greta para elaborar sus cazuelas y en día de muertos elabora los jarros, la señora María Myriam Guzmán C.  va a comprar azúcar por bulto, aceite por caja, dulces, jugos por caja para surtir su negocio de venta de tortas, picaditas, dobladitas, la señora Irene C. Arriza va a comprar ollas, cazuelas para surtir su negocio,  va a comprar greta, leña, pintura, barro para elaborar sus cazuelas y ollas chicas y grandes. La señora María Myriam es integrante del grupo ella tiene 22 años de edad estudio hasta el bachillerato tiene su certificado, ella es casada, no tiene hijos, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida en la Telesecundaria a y solicito su préstamo para comprar aceite, arroz, azúcar, dulces, refrescos y las verduras jitomates, tomates, lechuga, queso, crema y también va a arreglar su baño hacerlo de block porque el que tiene es de carrizo, sus clientes son los estudiantes, los maestro, padres de familia y les ofrece a sus clientes tacos, tostadas, quesadillas, tortas, dulces y refrescos, su negocio lo inicio hace 3 años, por necesidad aprendió viendo como los preparaban , su mama le enseño a preparar la comida, a ella le dijeron que si quería vender el comité de padres de familia como no había nadie quien vendiera a ella le dijeron y le gusto, su suegro le presto para iniciar con la venta , llega a su negocio caminando transporta su mercancía en carretilla, su negocio es importante y especial porque de ahí come, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es cuando vende cuando los muchachos compran sus alimentos y no se alejan, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es el clima en temporal cuando llueve casi no llevan dinero los muchachos, bajan las ventas, la competencia que enfrenta el negocio es que hay una señora que vende los mismos productos en la escuela, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para ir a comprar a la central cada ocho días los insumos para elaborar su comida, para pagar el préstamo, y para pagar su cuota por ir a vender a la telesecundaria, su esposo le va ayuda en la venta de los alimentos en todo le ayuda él sabe hacer de todo. San Marcos es bonito se respira aire puro, se celebra las fiestas del patrón San Marcos el 25 de Abril hay misas, procesión, baile, juegos mecánicos, brinco de chínelos, siembran de temporal maíz y sorgo, casi todos trabajan la alfarería. Este negocio le ha ayudado mucho a su familia en la alimentación, los planes y esperanzas son seguir en el negocio de las ventas de alimentos para que tenga ganancias para comprar un carro para ir a comprar la mercancía y para trasladarse de su casa a la escuela con los alimentos, la señora María Miriam está Feliz con este préstamo porque va a poder seguir adelante con su negocio. Las integrantes del grupo quiere decirles a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por el apoyo y por la confianza que nos dan, gracias porque con estos créditos salimos adelante con nuestros negocios y nuestras familias”.
texts.en:
This communal group called Jazmín is located in the community of Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, in the state of Puebla, Mexico. It is made up of 5 women who are neighbors and know each other well. 

Ms. Petra A. M. is going to use her loan to buy clay, wood and glaze for the manufacture of pots and jars and she also sells unglazed pots. 

Ms. Jorgina B. T. is going to buy clay, wood and paints for making pots. 

Ms. Margarita M. V. is going to buy wood, clay, and glaze to make pots and jars for the Day of the Dead. 

Ms. María Myriam Guzmán C. is going to buy bags of sugar, boxed oil, sweets and boxed juices to stock her business selling cakes, picaditas and dobladitas (various traditional fast food items).

Ms. Irene C. Arriza is going to buy pots and pans to stock her business. She is going to buy glaze, wood, paint, and clay to manufacture large and small pots and pans. 

María Myriam is a member of the group. She is 22 years old and she has her high school diploma. She is married and does not have any children. She has a business selling food in the telesecundaria (a distance school program for secondary and high school students). She is requesting a loan to buy oil, rice, sugar, sweets, soft drinks, vegetables, tomatoes, lettuce, cheese, and cream. She is also going to fix her bathroom and construct it using brick rather than bamboo. Her customers are students, teachers, parents and she offers them tacos, tostadas, quesadillas, tortas, sweets and soft drinks. She started her business 3 years ago out of necessity and learned by watching others prepare. Her mother taught her to prepare food, and the parent committee at the school told her that since there wasn't anyone to sell food at school if she wanted to do so she could and she liked the idea. Her father-in-law lent her the money to start sales. She walks to work, carrying her goods in a wheelbarrow. Her business is important and special to her because she eats there. What she likes most about her job is when she sells, when the boys buy her foods and do not walk away. The greatest challenge she faces is the weather, when it rains, or when the boys do not bring money because sales decrease. Her competition is a lady who sells the same products in the school. She uses her business profits to go shopping in the center every eight days for food supplies, to stock her food supply, repay the loan, and to pay her dues from selling to the telesecundaria. Her husband helps with overall food sales and he knows how to do everything. 

San Marcos is a nice place to breathe fresh air. They celebrate the patron saint of San Marcos on April 25. There are masses, procession, dances, carnival rides, Brinco de Chinelos (traditional indigenous dance from the state of Morelos), the planting of corn and sorghum, and almost all do pottery work. 

This business has helped in feeding their family. The plans and hopes are to continue with the business selling food to make earnings to buy a car to use to go and buy the merchandise and to travel from their house to the school with their food. 

Ms. María Miriam is happy with this loan because she is able to continue growing her business. The members of the this group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the support and the trust you give us, thanks to these loans we can get ahead in our business and our families".

loans.use: Purchase packages of sugar, boxed oil, rice, sweets, juices, soft drinks, vegetables, green and red tomatoes, chiles, cheese, cream

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Myanzi Mixed Group-Mityana

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Roset N. is happily married with three kids. It's now two years down the stretch for her food business in the Myanzi trading center market in Mityana. She has her own stall. Roset also has a charcoal sales enterprise that she operates. Roset says the persuasion of close friends gave her the motivation to take root in this business. 

Weekly, Roset says this business generates 14,000 shillings. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more food to resell. Roset is affiliated with the Myanzi Mixed Group-Mityana.

loans.use: The purchase of more food to resell

loans.name: Liana

texts.es:
Liana tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposos e hijos en el distrito de Guadalupe ubicado en la provincia de Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí  ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de 2 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo a mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Liana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Liana is 23 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the District of Guadalupe in Pacasmayo Province. There is significant commercial activity in this area. The community is located in La Libertad region, which is more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Liana has a store established in her home. There she offers her neighbors different consumer products such as basic necessities and groceries. Her business has been in existence for two years and currently has a loyal and established customer base. Thanks to her business, she is able to help her husband support their family and move themselves forward all the time.

Liana wants to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise to help her satisfy the demands of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1700 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 37 years old lives with her husband and a daughter in Darkhan city, Mongolia. They live in small house on their plot of land. Her daughter is 5 years old and attends a local kindergarten. Her husband works at “Erel Tsement” LLC as a plumber. 

In 2009 Bayarmaa decided to rent a place and open a small grocery shop. Since then, she has been running her business quite successfully. So, she decided to build her own small shop and, at same time, to increase her working capital and profit. Sometimes she stays at her store overnight to protect her store from theft. She is planning to expand her business by selling vodka and beer at her store. The building work is 75 % complete. The reason she is requesting a loan is to complete the building project.

loans.use: to complete the building project at her store.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María C. es originaria de la comunidad "la mina el Limón" donde tiene 46 años de vivir acá habiendose destacado como profesora de primaria. Es casada y tiene un hijo el cual estudia en el colegio de la localidad. 

Es menester mencionar que ella ha sido una excelente maestra y se ha ganado el cariño de sus alumnos y de sus veceinos en su localidad. Está solicitando un crédito para reparar su vivienda ya que ha estado muy maltratada y es de mucha urgencia realizar las reparaciones. Con el crédito comprará los materiales de construcción y así logrará salir avante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria C. is from the community "the Limon Mine,"  where she has lived for 46 years. She is a primary school teacher, and she is married with one son, who studies in the local high school. 

It is worth mentioning that she has been an excellent teacher has has gained the affection of her students and her neighbors. She is applying for this loan to repair her home, since it is in bad shape and needs some urgent repairs. With the loan she will buy construction materials and thus will be able to surge ahead and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Simona Dominga

texts.es: Simona tiene 47 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Se dedica al destace de cerdo y venta también vende los derivados del cerdo. Tiene más 11 años en este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado que su negocio se mantenga, empezaron desde joven con un pequeño ahorro y actualmente cuenta con más clientes y siempre es ayudada por su esposo y su hijo. En el futuro desea que pueda terminar una carrera universitaria.Solicita este préstamo para la compra de cerdos y productos para la elaboración de los derivados de la carne de cerdo. Ya que al proveerles diversidad de productos la clientela tiene mayor opción para comprar.
texts.en:
Simona is 47 years old and has two children in her care.  Her business is slaughtering pigs and selling pork products.  She has been in this business for more than 11 years.  With a lot of effort and sacrifice, she has managed to keep her business running.  She started out when she was a young woman with a small amount of savings and she now has more customers.  She is always helped by her husband and her son.  In the future, she would like to complete a university degree.

Simona is requesting this loan to buy pigs and supplies for making pork products because if she offers her customers a wide range of products, they have more options to buy.

loans.use: to buy pigs and supplies for making pork products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been in the tailoring business for 16 years in Kikuyu market and with a monthly profit of KES.23,444. She is a single mother of two children.

This is her third loan which she intends to use for buying more clothing materials for making dresses for her customers.The anticipated profits will be used to open another outlet for selling clothes.

In future  she plans to invest and open another clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has four children. He lives with eight family members, one of whom works. 

Akram has had a food market since 2008. He gained experience from his father when he was working with him in the same field and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting $2,400 to buy a generator and an extra refrigerator for his market. He is aiming to develop his work and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and an extra refrigerator for his market.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 27-year-old single man. He runs a laundry to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. He has managed to sustain his business because of his good reputation. He has also benefited from Faulu Kenya, because he has gained new skills for running his business. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy a laundry machine and an iron box.

loans.use: to buy a laundry machine and an iron box.

loans.name: Azucenas Blancas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Azucenas Blancas lo conforman Ruth, Issel y Rosaura tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Niquinomo. Este grupo han tenido dos préstamos en Adim en los cuales han mostrado ser responsables y laboriosas. 
La coordinadora  es la señora Ruth quien se dedica al comercio de desde hace cinco años. Ella tiene dos hijos que son su mayor motivación para salir adelante. Con el crédito comprará artesanías para aumentar su mercadería. 
La señora Issel desde hace 2 años comercializa artesanía y bisutería, y Rosaura se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Ruth, Issel and Rosaura belong to the Azucenas Blancas group. These are three hard-working and entrepreneurial women originally from Niquinomo. This group has aready had two loans with ADIM and proved themselves to be responsible and hard-working women.
Ruth is their coordinator, she has been in business for the last 5 years. She has 2 children who are her primary motivation for success. She will use this loan to buy handicrafts and increase her range of stock. Issel has been selling handicrafts and costume jewellery for the last 2 years, and Rosaura sells clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts

loans.name: Duo Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
DUO SANTA TERESITA:
Este dúo esta conformado por doña María Marta, quien tiene  venta de consumo diario y hace poco logró comprar un molino de nixtamal en cual le ha ido muy  bien ya que atiende a varias personas durante el día, ella quiere aprovechar para invertir más en la venta de consumo diario, ya que las personas que visitan su molino aprovechan para comprar las cosas de su hogar, junto a ella vive la señora 	Justa, quien vende tortillas desde hace varios años,  viendo el incremento del precio del maíz ella necesita  capital para comprar por cantidades mayores,  para que al final pueda ella tener  un ahorro también, según la necesidad de sus clientes ella también vende maíz, teniendo así un  ingreso adicional a la venta de tortillas, el deseo de ambas es seguir trabajando e ir incrementando sus negocios, ellas se sienten contentas de tener esta oportunidad de obtener este capital para poder lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
'Santa Teresita' group

This group has two members.  María Marta sells essential household products and, a short while ago, she managed to buy a mill for grinding 'nixtamal' (cooked corn used in making tortillas).  Her business is doing very well as she serves a number of people during the day.  She would like to take advantage of this opportunity and invest further in her grocery store business as the people who come to use her mill also buy household products while they are there.  Alongside María Marta lives Justa who has been selling tortillas for several years.  Owing to the increase in the price of corn, she needs capital so that she can buy in larger quantities and save.  According to her customers' needs, she also sells corn which makes her an additional income to that which she makes selling her tortillas.  Both ladies would like to continue working and expanding their businesses.  They are happy to have this opportunity to obtain capital with which they can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy essential household products and to buy corn wholesale

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Lunh

texts.en: Lunh is a palm sugar seller. Her husband makes palm sugar. Their income is $4 per day. She has six children. Three of the children are studying and the other three are working in a factory. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $25 on transportation, $10 on school fees and $25 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to transport the palm sugar to sell. She plans to buy more palm sugar to sell so that she can make more income to support her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport palm sugar

loans.name: Cenelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cenelia Del Carmen es una emprendedora mujer de 37 años,  su actividad es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 16 años  que se dedica a este negocio con fondos propios, ella tiene 4 hijos que son menores de edad y están bajo su cargo. Ella inicio este negocio con mucho sacrificio y ganas de salir adelante pues su entusiasmo por mejorar cada día ha hecho de ella una persona trabajadora. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, bolsas, entre otros. Cenelia sueña con incrementar cada día más su actividad.
texts.en:
Cenelia Del Carmen, 37, is an enterprising woman.  Her activity is the manufacture and sale of tortillas.  She’s been in this business for over 6 years with funds of her own.  She has four minor children in her care.  She started the business with much sacrifice and a strong determination to get ahead because her enthusiasm to improve day to day has made her into a hard working person.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy corn, lime powder, firewood and bags, among others.  Cenelia dreams with increasing her activity more every day.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood and bags.

loans.name: Clive Road Women's Group 3

texts.en:
Everybody wants to have a settled means of subsistence. Those who find pleasure in a life where they have to live by their wits are many but given a choice, they would go with something that helps them to bring value and mileage to their lives. 

Twelve years ago is when 38-year-old mother of four,  Prossy, made the decision to take root in her fish sales business in Jinja. Jinja is the source of the Nile River and many indigenous people have taken to fishing and fish selling as their source of livelihood. 

Prossy joined the fish sales business with no prior business experience but under the financial auspices of her husband. She has sustained her business through thick and thin with grit, tenacity and unwavering diligence. This explains her longevity in this competitive business.

On the side, she also runs a modest food sales business.  Weekly she says this business generates sales profits totaling Uganda shillings 100,000. Prossy says she intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María de 30 años se dedica a hacer cortes y cepillados de cabellos a domicilio, poco a poco ha ido ganando clientela, adicional desde la ventana de su casa tiene una pequeña tienda la cual atiende con la ayuda de su esposo cuando no está en su trabajo que realiza como guardia de seguridad. Tienen 2 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela fiscal. Al momento su única dificultad es que la zona periurbana en la que vive es muy insegura y deben estar alerta para no ser victima de la misma.
En el futuro está pensando hacer un préstamo para comprar cemento, piedra, arena y mejorar su casa. Su sueño es tener un spa y gabinete y seguir dándoles lo mejor a su familia que ama mucho.
texts.en:
María, aged 30, works doing haircuts and blowouts at her home.  Bit by bit, she has gained a client base.  In addition, she has a small store in her home, which she tends to with the help of her husband when he isn't at his work as a security guard.

They have two children who attend public school.  So far, her only difficulty is that the periurban area when she lives is very unsafe, and they have to stay alert so as not to become victims of this.  

In the future, she thinking of taking a loan to buy cement, stone, sand and improving her home.  Her dream is to have a spa and office, and continue providing the best for her family whom she loves greatly.

loans.use: to buy office furniture, cement, stone, and sand.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, vive con sus padres y hermanos, es soltero, se dedica a la panadería, aprendió a preparar el pan, por su trabajo, y siendo empleado decidió instalar su propia panadería, actualmente su necesidad es la falta de dinero para invertir en materiales, como harina, azúcar, huevos.
Estos materiales lo comprara a través de un préstamo, que le permita ampliarse en su inventario, para producir más, su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, aumentar la clientela y capacitarse más para mejorar el sabor de la panadería.
texts.en: Jorge is single and lives with his parents and siblings.  He works as a baker.  He learned how to make bread at work and then decided to set up his own bakery.  He currently lacks the money he needs to invest in supplies such as flour, sugar and eggs.  He will buy these products with a loan and this will allow him to expand his inventory and produce more.  His goal is to grow his business, increase his number of customers, and learn more so that he can improve the taste of his bread.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and eggs to make bread

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma was born in the Sacred Valley of the Incas in the town of Calca. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children.

She still lives and works in the town where she was born. She sells shoes from a catalog of a well-known company, work she has been doing for the last eight years. It is going very well. As well, she sells beauty products.
