Vilma needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as shoes. Her dream is to buy a car so she can use it as a taxi within the urban area where she lives.

She is a member of the Milenium III Community Bank which meets every month in Calca in the department of Cusco, Peru. The town is known for its tourist areas, its commerce, and its traditional festival Inti Raymi. As well it is the home of one of the seven wonders of the world, Machupicchu.
texts.en:
Vilma nació en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca y tiene 47 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. 

Vilma vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por medio un catalogo de una empresa reconocida, ella desde hace 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, ella también se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como zapatos. Su sueño de Vilma es comprarse un carro para que pueda ser utilizado para brindar de servicio de transporte urbano. 

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to expand her husband’s candy business. He sells candies and chocolates to different general stores. 

With the loan, he will buy candies and chocolates in bulk to improve his sales and client base. 

Sajida has two sons and a daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. 

Sajida is also involved in a sewing business. She learned this art from her mother before marriage and now she earns reasonably good profits from her skills. 

She is very confident that an investment will help her husband improve his business which will result in her family’s having a better financial life. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sajida.”

loans.use: To buy candies and chocolates to sell.

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en:
Ulata owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. She is 34 years of age and married with five children. Ulata has one year of experience in this business. 

Ulata needs a loan of 750 tala to purchase baking powder, a sack of flour, cooking utensils and an oven. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 180 tala or US $80 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Ulata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Ulata's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking powder, a sack of flour, cooking utensils and an oven

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 51 years old and sells sacks of grain. She is known as a very industrious and generous woman in her community, so her business grows accordingly. As she stated "A man who is productive and hard working will become prosperous ". With her loving personality, she gains a lot of clients as her loyal customers. Somehow, with her perseverance she improved upon her family's poor standard of living. In fact, she already has fulfilled her responsibility to see her two children finish their studies. 

She refuses to go back to their former lifestyle, this leads her to ask for a loan of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional sacks of grain to sell and to pay her hired help. She hopes, Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. would not weary to helped them in their businesses in order to lift their poor lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of grains to sell and to pay her hired help

loans.name: Antasia

texts.en:
Antasia is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 2.  Two of them go to school. 

Antasia has been running a food store business for two years. She has no employees. Antasia heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more food items like eggs, food spices, cabbages, and tomatoes. Antasia has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Antasia would like to hope for an increase in the size of her business and to have a good store.  

Her major challenges include having no one to help her in the market when she is sick, which leads to low income.  

Antasia says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan for helping women in terms of giving loans to people like her with low capital for business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like eggs, spices, cabbages, and tomatoes

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en: Nyamsuren is 24 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (Mongolian tent) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife runs a clothes selling business. He started his taxi service business in 2008 with his own taxi. His taxi service income is pretty constant therefore he wants to expand his wife's shop. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "We have a baby coming, so I have to do everything I can to increase my income. I don't want my baby to live like me, uneducated, broke". He is requesting 1,100,000 MNT to buy clothes from Erlian for his wife's business.

loans.use: To buy clothes from Erlian

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is married with two children. He is engaged in rice farming and owns a motorcycle transport business. Roberto and his wife enjoy their farming activities. They both work hard to become successful farmers someday. His wife has been involved in a hog raising business to help her husband in earning profits for their living. 

Roberto is happily living with his wife and one grandchild in the village of Aguinaldo Cordon. He considers himself an expert farmer since he has been managing his rice fields for almost 31 years. He believes that he could cover all their household expenditures and improve his lifestyle. One of the ways thought up by Roberto to obtain his goal is borrowing additional capital from lenders. He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to allow him to purchase agricultural supplies and pay for the labor cost of his hired laborers in transplanting and sowing rice crops on his farm land. This would be a great help to him and for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay for the labor cost of his hired laborers in transplanting and sowing crops on his farm land

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a responsible father who plans to improve the family's sources of income and give them a better life. He is 44 years old and has five school-aged children. Daniel mentions that life has become difficult due to the high cost of commodities, school fees and transportation. Despite these conditions, he has the strong determination to work out his plan and achieve his goals.

Daniel plans to expand his corn plantation to increase his yields and his income to satisfy his family's necessities and support his children's education. He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor costs required for planting corn. He believes that this loan will help him to improve the business. He hopes that his plans and aspirations will become successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs for planting corn

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta works hard to support her family. Calixta is married and has a scrap (recycled materials) business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. 

Calixta requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy damaged materials like plastic, metal, etc. to sell to a junk shop. In the future, Calixta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy damaged materials like plastic, metal, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 34-year-old married woman with two children. One of the children is in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.

Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, trousers, shirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos a los cuales quiere mucho y por los cuales ha lucha cada día para brindarles una vida digna y sobre todo llena de amor y esperanza. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Guadalupe, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el limón, arroz, entre otros. Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de taller de estructuras metálicas, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 hora diarias y puede atender hasta 5 clientes en el día ya que es un poco laborioso construir las estructuras; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de progresar.

Carmen está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales como fierro, liquido para soldar, pinturas, entre otros; de esta manera tendrá los materiales y herramientas necesaria para realizar su trabajo y poder  mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera ella seguirá luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una local campestre”.

loans.use: Para la compra de materiales (fierro, liquido para soldar, pinturas, entre otros)

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
At a young age, Kevin was introduced to the landscaping trade by his father and uncle. He always enjoyed farming, pruning and being surrounded by nature. After working for corporate America for some time, he decided that it was time to start doing what he really loved and he started his own business in 1994. 

Kevin is in charge of servicing many businesses, churches, and schools. He provides spring and fall clean up, among a variety of other services. His passion and dedication to his work have show in the amount of clients that he had throughout the state of NJ. He says he doesn't mind traveling as long as he does what he loves to do. 

He says that his business is dedicated to serving the community. The company offers competitive prices and quality service. His customer base, now over 200 people, has been obtained through word of mouth, as Kevin's business has no online presence yet.

This money will go towards buying more equipment, such as trucks and lawnmowers, since he wants to expand his business.. Kevin's plan for the business is to “go green” and use organic fertilization, mosquito spray, and seeding. His goal is to continue to serve the communities in New Jersey.

loans.use: to buy more equipment and expand his business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Divina is 30 years old and has one child still in school.

Divina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fresh fish to sell.

Divina has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
The following description was written by Moses Onyango, a volunteer with Village Enterprise Fund and partner representative for Kiva in Uganda:

Rose got a grant of 100 US dollars from VEF. She started straight away with her business of buying and selling produce.

She buys and sells the following items: millet, sorghum, rice, beans, dry cassava, peas, etc.

Most of the people in Uganda live by agriculture. So the only way for the community to raise money for supporting themselves is by selling off their food crops to the available market.

Uganda lies on equatorial region so this makes it to receive rain throughout the year. Thus people are able to plant and harvest their crops thrice a year. This gives RoseÃ­s business of produce to run all throughout the year.

She is able to raise some money out of her small capital to support her family.

Given the 500 US dollars, she will excel in her business very well.

She is capable of handling the loan and also to refund it back.

loans.use: Buying and reselling of produce

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo started his own small business 8 years ago, a grocery store, because he was left unemployed and his daughters were completing their studies. When he did not find employment he decided to start this business. Thanks to this project he has been able to meet, not only the tuition expenses of his daughters, but also some of the household expenses, such as utilities among other things. Currently his wife works as a seamstress to help him and one of his daughters helps him in his store. His two other daughters work as well.

His responsibility to his family has motivated him to come out ahead and not give up against adversities. Gustavo now requires a loan of $1200, that he will use to purchase more merchandise and increase his sales volume and earn more income. You have the chance to help Gustavo and his family. The decision is yours, don't wait. He will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Gustavo hace 8 años comenzó con un pequeño negocio propio, una tienda de abarrotes, debido a que se quedó sin empleo y sus hijas se encontraban realizando sus estudios, por lo que al no encontrar otro trabajo se decidió a iniciar con esta actividad. Gracias a este proyecto ha podido hacer frente no sólo a los gastos de la educación de sus hijas, si no también a los gastos del hogar, como recibos de servicios entre otras cosas. Actualmente su esposa cose ropa ajena para ayudarlo y una de sus hijas le ayuda en la tienda, pues sus otras dos hijas se encuentran trabajando.

La responsabilidad con su familia lo han llevado a poder salir adelante y no vencerse ante las adversidades. Ahora Gustavo requiere de un préstamo de $ 1,200 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para surtir más mercancía e incrementar el volumen de sus ventas y por ende percibir mayores ingresos. Tú tienes la oportunidad de ayudar a Gustavo y su familia, la decisión esta en tus manos, no lo dudes más, el te lo va a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Auntie Mary bakes bread in her community through her business, A.'s Bakery. She is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $950.00 from Kiva for working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a Grocery Store

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Mrs. Duch P. is 47 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband and three of their six children. Of these three children, one is a student and two help with their father's work. The remaining three are married and live elsewhere with their spouses. Duch P. earns $1 a day herself as a farmer. Her husband earns additional income for the family through his work as a carpenter. Duch P. will use this $500 loan to increase her family’s joint income by investing in some tools for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.use: Mrs. Phally would like to purchase carpentry tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en: Alimamy is 45 years old and sells cigarettes, sweet biscuits and canned foods at the market in Makeni. He is married with four children. He would like to develop his business into a big store in the future. He said his previous loan has allowed him to move his business one step ahead.  Alimamy is requesting to borrow US$ 350 for this purpose.

loans.use: Expand his business to eventually operate a grocery store

loans.name: Hawa Barrie

texts.en: Hawa is 37 years old and married with 2 children. She started her business selling food items before the war, but at a very small scale. With her previous loans, she expanded the business and managed to purchase four sheep. Assisted by her husband who is a subsistence farmer, Hawa is able to purchase items for her business from the villages and Kabala town.  Hawa would like to buy more sheep and farmland and is requesting a $525 loan for that purpose. While her husband takes care of the farming and the sheep, she will continue selling food items, mainly to pay the loan installments and for school fees.

loans.use: Purchase additional livestock to further develop her family farming business.

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en:
The G. family lives in the Khachmaz region in the village of Gusarchay. He is married, has 2 children.
This man was born in 1957. Gurban has 6 years of experience in the farming business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings and fertilizer. He plans to plant apple, cherry and other seedlings so he can improve his business and get more income.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir is from the Beylagan region of Azerbaijan, but now he lives in Lokbatan settlement in the suburbs of Baku. He trades cereals such as grain, barley, buckwheat, etc. He buys goods from different regions, transports them to Baku, and sells to wholesalers in the local market. He has been in this business for more than 8 years. He has had two previous loans from Normicro Baku branch. He repaid all loans on time. Now he applies again for $1200 to invest in his business.

loans.use: To invest in business

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mr. Guadalupe M. C. has raised cattle and farmed for 10 years in the Villanueva area of Chinandega.

With three small children and the responsibility of providing food for his home, has has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals.

Today Guadalupe finds himself in need of purchasing calves to raise in order to be able to take greatest advantage of raising and selling them when necessary. For this reason he is obtaining loans from Ceprodel in order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Guadalupe M. C. desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la agricultura en el municipio de Villanueva en Chinandega.

Con tres pequeños hijos y la responsabilidad de llevar el sustento a su hogar, ha logrado mejorar la situación financiera de su familia gracias al buen cuido que ha realizado a sus animales.

Una necesidad que atraviesa hoy en día el señor Guadalupe es la urgencia de la compra de terneros para sacarles el máximo provecho y así comercializarlos cuando fuera necesario. Por este motivo logra obtener créditos en Ceprodel para obtener estos animales y criarlos de manera que al tiempo sean usados para sus fines establecidos.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Haelen

texts.en:
HaelenN, aged 35, runs a general store called "Imma's Shop" (named after her 14 year old son Immanuel). There, she sells sugar, beans, rice, sodas, ice cubes, and other general food items. She opened her shop in 2003 and works there from 6:30am to 10pm daily. She makes a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

Four months ago, Haelen borrowed a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more stock for her shop and to also pay for her son's school fees. Having repaid this successfully, Haelen hopes for a new loan to buy more stock and to also pay her rent.

She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 35 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store

loans.name: Julissa Vanessa

texts.es:
Julissa has belonged to the Generosity Communal Bank for about 2 years. In her Communal Bank she learned to save and also the loans that she has obtained have helped her very much.

Julissa is married, 27 years old and has 2 children ages 5 and 3 years. Julissa and her husband sell pots, bedspreads, covers, dishes, three-piece suits and everything their clients ask for. They carry out their sales on foot to the workers of the different institutions of the city of Ayacucho. Their products are acquired in the city of Lima.

Julissa needs a loan of 2000 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of pressure cookers, sets of covers, sets of dishes and frying pans.

Her savings will be used for the purchase of her house. Julissa’s dreams are to have a stable business, to have sufficient income to pay for the education of her children and to be a great businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Julissa pertenece al Banco Comunal Generosidad hace 1, 2 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, además que los préstamos que obtiene le ayuda mucho.

Julissa es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos de 5, 3 años, Julissa junto a su esposo venden ollas, cubrecamas, cubiertos, vajilla, ternos y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes, sus ventas lo realizan ambulatoriamente a los trabajadores de las diferentes instituciones de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Julissa necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas a presión, juego de cubiertos, juego de platos y sartenes.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la compra de su casa. Los sueños de Julissa son tener un negocio estable, tener suficiente economía para solventar los estudios de sus hijos y ser una gran empresaria.

loans.use: To buy pressure cookers, sets of covers, sets of dishes and frying pans for resale.

loans.name: Astuti

texts.id:
Astuti was born in Java and she went to Bali to work. She met I Putu Abdika and finally was married to him. They have a son named I Putu Pradyana Putra who is now 1 year old. Astuti's husband works in a repair shop, while Astuti runs the kiosk business. She got a loan of Rp.5,000,000 from Dinari and she used it as the business capital. She spent the money to make a simple kiosk and to purchase the supplies. She sells merchandises such as snacks, bread, coffee, and drinks. Everyday she spends about Rp. 150,000 to purchase the supplies. Astuti opens the kiosk from 7 am until 3 pm. Her daily gross income is Rp.200,000 so she can get net income Rp.50,000 per day. With the loan from Dinari, Astuti hopes she can gain more profit and she can cover all of her family's expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Astuti berasal dari jawa dan merantau ke Bali. Akhirnya bertemu dengan I Putu Abdika yang sekarang menjadi suaminya.Dari perkawinan mereka memiliki 1 orang anak laki-laki yang diberi nama I Putu Pradyana Putra umur 1 tahun. Suami Astuti bekerja sebagai bengkel. Sedangkan Astuti menekuni usaha warung. Modal yang dipergunakan untuk usaha warungnya diperoleh dari pinjaman Dinari sebesar Rp.5.000.000,-. Modal ini dipergunakan untuk membuat warung yang sederhana dan sisanya untuk membeli dagangan. Adapun dagangan yang dijual seperti; makanan ringan, roti,kopi,berbagai macam minuman. Setiap hari modal yang dikeluarkan untuk membeli dagangan sebesar Rp.150,000,-. Astuti membuka warungnya mulai jam 7.00 pagi dan tutup warungnya jam 15.00 wita.Setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang didapat dari berjualan Rp.200,000,-. Jadi tiap hari penghasilan bersih Rp.50,000,-.Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Astuti mengharapkan keuntungan yang meningkat dan bisa memenuhi semua kebutuhan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: To add business capital for getting more merchandises

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
For one year Nikolai has operated a little business in Khoost, Ukraine selling electric supplies. Nikolai is single and commits all his time to his business. He decided to work in this sphere of trade because this type of merchandise does not spoil as food does, which makes it easier to store.

Nikolai has benefited from the support of Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine as he has built his business. He has been able to dramatically increase his amount of inventory on hand in the year that he has been in this trade. Nikolai believes this loan of $1075 US will allow him to offer a much more attractive product selection to customers and be better able to meet customer demand. One day Nikolai is hoping to open a new vending store of his own.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is a cheerful woman. Her natural talent for knitting has made her an excellent artisan, and this craft provides most of her income. Ana has an excellent reason to push forward and not give up: her little daughter Anabel. Currently, both live with Ana’s mother’s, who encourages her and helps with Anabel’s care and education. This young mother would like to purchase more wool yarn to make sweaters and skirts. Hard-working Ana is certain that with your help she will be able to continue weaving her and her daughter’s dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Ana es una mujer alegre y hábil para el trabajo textil, su predisposición para esta labor la convirtió en una excelente tejedora haciendo de este oficio su principal ingreso económico, Ana tiene una razón por quien velar y seguir adelante, su pequeña niña Anabel, quien es razón suficiente para persistir.Actualmente vive en casa de su madre, quien la apoya y orienta en la educación de su niña, esta joven madre tiene en mente adquirir materia prima (lana) para seguir tejiendo sus hermosas enaguas y chompas, esta diligente dama está segura que con tu colaboración podrá seguir tejiendo sus sueños y la de su amada niña.

loans.use: Purchase of materials (wool yarn) to knit clothing

loans.name: Rev. D.m.'s Group

texts.en:
These are Rev. D.S. S., Munda C. Sylvalie, Sulaiman J., Albert B. K., Jeremah L. S., and Christopher M. L.. They are all teachers at the Benevolent Islamic Secondary School Makeni. They are requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000.00.

Rev. D.M. S., Albert B. K., and Christopher M. L. are requesting this loan to help them purchase building materials. Munda C. Sylvalie is requesting a loan to invest in a business, and Sulaiman J. wants to use his loan to purchase pieces of furniture. At the end of each month, these teachers will get their salaries deducted to repay their loans to SMT.

Rev. D.M. S. is 40 years old, and he is married with 3 children. He has thought for the past 6 years now.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Bedaar

texts.en:
Bedaar Z. is one of those youths who wasn't able to go school and become educated. He is 22 and a resident of Ningarhar province. There are 6 members in his family; his father is about 60 and has some serious illnesses. Bedaar has three brothers. His older brother has a mobile repair shop in Jalalabad city, and two others are studying in public schools, but they all live in one home.

Presently, Bedaar is single. He started working when he was only 7 years old, because, at that time, his father was faced with some serious illnesses and his older brother couldn't provide for all the expenses of their family alone, thus Bedaar started working with a shopkeeper. 50 Afghanis (US$ 1) was his daily income. Bedaar and his brother worked hard, and they were able to support their family as well as possible, and after a few years they have saved 30,000 Afghanis (US$ 600).

Recently Bedaar opened a carpentry shop, and he thinks that this business has a good demand in the market, so he makes various furniture such as tables, beds, shelves, chairs, etc. Bedaar hopes to expand this business more and buy some new machines. But to achieve his goals easily and properly to reach his aims, he needs some money to buy new equipment. Therefore he has requested a 50,000 Afghani loan from AFSG, for a term of 18 months.

Bedaar dreams one day to open a big carpentry factory and recruit workers, also he thanks honestly the lenders who make possible this opportunity for the people.

loans.use: To buy some new machines for his shop

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Tiene un taller que es de origen Familiar, quedó viuda y cuenta solo con  el apoyo de sus dos hijos para sacar adelante el negocio, la comercialización esta a cargo de sus nueras que se movilizan a los diferentes mercados de Managua. En un futuro quiere tener su tramo en el mercado de Masaya para así ser vendedora directa de este producto, dice que lo va a lograr ya que esta en trámite con la alcaldía,  para su proyecto familiar  necesita un crédito, para mantener un inventario grande y variado. Su casa es propia la que en la actualidad le esta realizando mejoras ya que sus dos hijos, nueras y nietos viven con ella y hacen pequeños aportes.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia has a workshop which began as a family business. She is widowed and counts on the support from her two children to run her business. Her daughters-in-law are in charge of marketing and travel to the various markets in Managua. In the future, Maria Antonia wants to have her own stall in the Masaya market so that she can sell her products directly. She is in the process of having this arranged with the mayor. This family project needs a loan to maintain a large and varied inventory. She owns her house and is currently making improvements on it since her two sons, daughters-in-law and grandchildren live with her and make small contributions.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Plissiwe

texts.fr: Plissiwe K. est un jeune homme de 30 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est revendeur des tenues prêts-à-porter au marché de Womé situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé. Il désire par ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en s’approvisionnant en d’autres biens qu’exigent les clients. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Plissiwe K. is a young man of 30 years, married, and a father of 2. He sells ready-to-wear clothing at the market in Wome, which is about 130 kilometers from Lomé. He hopes to use this loan to increase the size of his business by stocking up on other goods that his clients require. He is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 31 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su familia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica al negocio de la artesanía, teje variedad de prendas con ayuda de sus hermanos, quienes trabajan con ella produciendo las prendas. A Elizabeth le gusta el tejido y ve en él una herramienta muy útil para lograr todas sus aspiraciones, además el negocio va muy bien y cada vez arroja mejores ingresos, pero como en todo trabajo también se tienen algunos problemas, en el caso de Elizabeth la dificultad radica en cumplir con todos los pedidos que tiene que entregar, para lo cual muchas veces tiene que trabajar durante todo el día. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de lana para tejer muchas más prendas y así lograr más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 31 years old, single and lives with her family. Eight years ago, she began working in arts and crafts, weaving a variety of garments with the help of her brothers, who work with her to produce the clothing. Elizabeth likes weaving and sees it as a useful tool to achieve her aspirations. The business is going very well and every time she yields more income, but like in all work, she also has some problems. In Elizabeth’s case, the difficulty lies in having to live up to all the orders that she has to deliver, which often times requires he to work all day long. She is asking for her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she receives, she will buy more yarn to weave more clothing in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Christina Stoddard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more yarn to increase her clothing sales

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El Sr.Hernan O., tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la  ciudad de Quiindy es propietario de una librería, la  mas  concurrida de la  zona es  soltero y  también es estudiante de Universidad. 

             Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar con su padre vendiendo mercaderías  por la ciudad y así ayudaba   para  mantener la casa,  anhela seguir  progresando para  poder   mandar  construir  una casa  propia y  mas adelante  formar  una familia  y tener  hijos. 

                Con el crédito comprara  cuadernos  y  bijouterie.
texts.en:
Mr. Hernan O. is 35 years old and lives in the city of Quiindy. He owns the most popular bookstore in the area. Hernan is single, and also studies at the local university. From a very young ago, he began working with his father selling merchandise around the city in order to earn income to support the family. Hernan hopes to continue to make progress so that he can build a home to share with the family and children he hopes to have in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks and jewelry

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel A. H. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, ellos tienen viviendo 7 años en su hogar. El señor Daniel A. trabaja como lavador en una compañía de trasportes, puesto que ocupa desde hace 2 años y le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, además una de las hijas del señor Daniel también trabaja y ayuda con los gastos de su hogar. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Daniel, sino aparece su esposa y 2 de sus hijos).
El señor Daniel A. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar uniformes y útiles escolares para sus hijos que se encuentran estudiando debido a que los ingresos que el percibe no son suficientes y es muy necesario comprarlos.
texts.en:
Daniel A. H. is married and has lived with his wife and four children for seven years. Daniel A. works as a washer for a transport company. He has had this job for two years and uses his income to take care of his family. One of his daughters also works and helps him with the household expenses. (Daniel is not in the photograph; his wife and two of their children are pictured.) Daniel A. is requesting a loan to buy uniforms and school supplies for his children, as these are necessities and he is unable to cover the cost with his income.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase uniforms and school supplies

loans.name: Essodina

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a pour activité la réparation de portables de même que les accessoires téléphoniques qui y vont avec, il fait ce commerce depuis 2006 et a son propre atelier qu’il a appelé MANOU Mobile, actuellement le commerce de partables et accessoires marche bien à lomé et c’est pour répondre à la demande que ce monsieur demande à wages un crédit de 400000F pour acheter des accessoires de portables. Il est marié et a 02 enfants
texts.en:
This gentleman does work that involves repairing mobile phones, as well as phone accessories that go with them. He has been in this business since 2006 and has his own workshop he calls “MANOU Mobile”. His business is currently doing well in Lomé. And to meet the demand, he is asking WAGES for a loan of 40,000 francs CFA to buy mobile phone accessories. He is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phone accessories

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thức năm nay  49  tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 trong đó có 1 con đang đi học. Chị Thức là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôilàm ruộng. Ngoài ra tranh thủ thời gian rảnh rỗi chị Thức còn đi làm thợ xây để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống gia đình chị Thức đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm gà vịt và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Thức is 49 years old. Her family has four children, one of which is going to school. Ms. Thức has been a participant of TYM Fund since 1998. The family's main sources of income are rearing livestock and growing rice. Furthermore, in her free time, Ms. Thức works as a construction worker to bring home additional income for her family. With an income of 5,000,000 VND per month, her family's life continues to improve and get better each day. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND as capital to buy more chicken/ducks and animal feed for their livestock rearing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more livestock and animal feed for raising livestock

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: La Señora Blanca Azucena E. Gómez tiene 26 años su estado civil es casada. Doña Blanca tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de Doña Blanca es venta de mercadería en general. La ubicación de su negocio es ambulante, Doña Blanca inicio este negocio hace más de 6 años y comenzó con la venta de perfumes y cremas. Doña Blanca se siente orgullosa ya que todos los días trabaja muy fuertemente para su hijo. Los propósitos de Doña Blanca son de son de engrandecer su negocio con el fin de mantener este trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita Doña Blanca es para la compra de ropa, bolsos, perfumes y cremas. Los sueños de Doña Blanca son de establecer un local en donde ofrezca sus productos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Blanca Azucena E. G. is 26 years old and is married. Blanca has one child and is a student. Blanca's work is selling general merchandise. The location of her business is on foot. Blanca began this business more than six years ago and began with the sales of perfumes and creams. Blanca feels proud since she works hard every day for her son. Blanca's goals are to grow her business with the goal of continuing this work. The loan that Blanca is requesting is for the purchase of clothing, bags, perfumes and creams. Blanca's dreams are to establish a store from where she can offer her products. The quantity that she is requesting is C$ 9,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 28 años, vive con sus padres en la casa propia de ellos. Se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y también en ocasiones al bordado de fustanes que aprendió a elaborar desde su niñez. Trabaja todos los días, sin excepción, en el cuidado de sus tierras de cultivo y en la crianza de sus animales (ganado vacuno y ovino) en su establo. Gladys es una gran ayuda para sus padres y se constituye en el sostén de su casa, su deseo es seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su establo y aumentar la cantidad de animales que tienen. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy satisfecha de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite mejorar su calidad de vida y también de los demás integrantes mutuamente. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de sacos de abono para esta campaña de siembra. También comprará insumos y materiales (telas e hilos) para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Gladys is 28 years old and lives with her parents in the house that they own. She does agricultural work and also makes embroidered slips (underskirts), which she learned to make as a child. She works everyday without fail, taking care of her farmland and raising livestock (cattle and sheep) in her stables. Gladys is a great help to her parents and supports most of the household. She wishes to keep improving the infrastructure of her stables and increasing the number of animals that she has. This is her second loan with MFP; she is very happy to belong to a community bank because it allows her to improve the quality of her life while also helping other members improve their quality of life. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer for this sowing season. She will also buy supplies and materials (cloth and thread) for her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and materials for embroidering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his sister's medical expenses

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Huascahura.
Lucia es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Lucia viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, productos que comercializa en las tiendas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, mandiles, faldas.
Lucia sueña con que sus hijos estudien y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Huascachura Community Bank. Lucia is 38, married, and has six children. Lucia travels to the regional fairs and sells various clothes there. She buys grains and cheese in the fairs, and she sells those products in the stores in the city of Ayacucho. Lucia needs a loan of 900 PEN to buy sweaters, aprons, and skirts. Lucia dreams of her children getting an education and having their own houses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters, aprons, and skirts

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị
loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Scarlet Ivania

texts.es: Doña Scarlet es una mujer muy trabajadora con mucho deseo de superación en la vida ya que ha sido difícil poder lograr sus objetivos en tener una casa digna para su familia ya que su sueldo es bajo, trabaja de ejecutiva de ventas en una empresa privada anteriormente era la cocinera y la ascendieron hace un año por su dedicación y empeño lo cual esta muy contenta  por que esta logrando  sus planes. Tiene 27 años de edad, casada, reside en el bario Hialeah en la capital de Managua y con dos hijos, que estudian la primaria, su esposo es guarda de seguridad. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las paredes de concreto y poder estar segura ya que el zinc de su casa esta ya en mal estado. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo y la facilidad de pago lo cual es de mucho beneficio en su vida personal, un sueño poder tener su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Scarlet is a hard-working woman who is determined to overcome obstacles in her life. She found it difficult to achieve her goal of providing a decent home for her family because she didn’t earn enough money.

She is a sales manager for a private company. Previously, she worked as a cook but was promoted a year ago because of her dedication and determination. Doña Scarlet is 27 years old, married, and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has two children who are in elementary school. Her husband is a security guard.

Her loan will be used to buy materials to build secure concrete walls, since the existing zinc walls of her house are already in poor condition. She thanks AFODENIC for providing her with a loan and trusting in her ability to repay. It is of great personal benefit to her that she can fulfill her dream of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Bokk Yéné Group

texts.fr: L’écovillage de pointe Sarrène se trouve sur la petite côte, à 15 km après Mbour, sur la route de Joal. Il se caractérise par sa situation géographique qui le situe au bord de la mer. Il est connu pour être un port de pêche qui est l’activité principale qui se mène dans la zone. C’est pourquoi nous sollicitons un financement pour pouvoir occuper nos jeunes femmes à lutter contre l'oisiveté. Notre objectif est de créer des activités génératrices de revenu pour permettre à nos jeunes filles de travailler dans le village en transformant et en commercialisant des produits halieutiques qui sont débarqués tous les jours au port de pêche de la localité.
texts.en:
The Pointe Sarrène eco-village is situated on the coast, 15 km past Mbour, on the road to Joal. It is characterized by its geographic situation, on the sea coast. It is known as a fishing port and that is the principal activity in that area. This is why we are asking for a loan so as to be able to occupy our young women and thus fight against joblessness.

Our objective is to create money-earning activities to allow our young women to work in the village, processing and commercializing seafood which is offloaded daily at the port right where we are.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: processing of seafoods

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr:
Madame  Aïssata M. est âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Alamissani de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle fréquenta la medersa jusqu’en classe de 9ème année (système éducatif Malien) où elle arrêta pour se marier. En marge de ses études, elle s’intéressa, dès son bas âge, au commerce qu’elle a appris auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires et des calebasses. Avec son mariage,  Aïssata elle, opte pour la vente des habits et des chaussures et jouit aujourd’hui d’une grande réputation dans son quartier.
Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour diversifier ses articles de vente, elle  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 18 mois après avoir bien remboursés 3 prêts solidaires. Elle est à son 1ier prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter, 5 pièces de pagnes brodés. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises au  Burkina Faso et ses articles sont revendus à crédit et au comptant à domicile et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants et prendre en charge certaines charges familiales telles que l’achat du savon et l’habillement des enfants.
Son ambition est d’augmenter le volume de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïssata M. is 47 years old, married and the mother of 8 children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large, traditional family in the neighborhood of Alamissani, in the city of Ségou (4th Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali).

She attended the madrasah until the 9th grade (in the Malien school system), when she stopped in order to marry. Outside of her studies, at a young age she became interested in the business she learned with her mother, selling food condiments and gourds. With her marriage, Aïssata decided to sell clothes and shoes; today she enjoys a wonderful reputation in her neighborhood.

With the goal of increasing the funds from her business selling various items, she is working with Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with them for 18 months and has properly reimbursed 3 group loans. This is her first individual loan and she intends to use it to purchase 5 sets of embroidered "pagnes" (printed wax cloths). She supplies herself with merchandise from Burkina Faso. She will sell her merchadise for cash and credit from her home and walking around to a clientele composed mostly of women.

She intends to earn a monthly income of 50,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay for her children's tuition and to take charge of certain family expenses, such as buying soap and clothes for her children. Her ambition is to increase the volume of her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase embroidered "pagnes" (colored wax cloths)

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 31-year-old married woman with one child. She has been running her home-based accessories business since 2003 to help her husband with the household expenses.

Today, Zeina is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional supplies to increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies

loans.name: Deylin Del Socorro

texts.es: Deylin de 28 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 niños, labora como docente en el MINED de Santo Tomas desde hace 8 años, esta solicitando su 3er credito para seguir mejorando su vivienda, pues anteriormente ya habia sido beneficiada con el fondo KIVA, y ahora desea seguir contando con el mismo apoyo, pues desea cambiar el techo a su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y que con el credito anterior no logro cambiar, ademas si el credito lo permite pretende levantar una pared que esta en espera y acondicionar un cuarto y asi dar mayor comodidad a su familia.  El deseo de Deylin es seguir contando con el apoyo de AFODENIC y continuar mejorando su casa, pues es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos.

loans.use: Cambio de techo y levantar una pared

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et a 03 enfants à sa charge ; en 2008, il a ouvert une boutique de vente de matériaux de construction dans le quartier de Sanguéra à Lomé ; il vend des grillages, des instruments géométriques, des épingles, des peintures, etc. Sa boutique est très connue de beaucoup de maîtres chantiers mais aussi des particuliers. Il a même recruté un jeune homme pour l’aider dans la vente de ses matériaux ; il compte même dans l’avenir ouvrir une boutique annexe dans un autre quartier en construction pour pouvoir réaliser de grands profits. Actuellement il a besoin de constituer de nouveaux stocks ; c’est pour cela qu’il souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour continuer ses activités. Il compte sur sa maîtrise du marché pour rembourser ce prêt dans les délais exigés.

loans.use: Achat de matériaux de construction

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del  Bancomunal San Antonio de Padua, es casada, tiene tres hijos de 20, 10 y 5 años, los dos menores están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Yolanda  empezó trabajando en las ventas por catalogo de productos de belleza, pero lo dejo por la venta de comida en las obras constructoras, ella va a diferentes obras, cada día lleva 40 menús, y por las tardes lleva lonches, eso le da tiempo de dedicarse a sus hijas, en ayudarles en las tareas del colegio, no quiere descuidarlas por que son mujercitas.
Desde que esta en Finca Perú, los préstamos son de mucha ayuda, esta muy agradecida por la confianza que Finca a puesto en ella, ella no quiere defraudar a la institución y se esfuerza vendiendo sus menús. 
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de abarrotes, arroz azúcar, menestras, carnes, para la preparación de los menús de cada día.
El sueño de Yolanda es abrir un restaurante en un mercado, esta ahorrando.

loans.use: abarrotes, arroz azúcar, menestras, carnes,

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake is married with five children. She is 45 years old. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria, where she sells sarongs. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs

loans.name: Ekelia

texts.en:
Ekelia, 40, is divorced with six children. Four are in school and the others are currently working. She is supportive, determined and above all very hard-working as a single mother. She is a petty trader who sells bags of maize, beans, vegetables, spices, smoked fish, etc. and has a grocery shop attached to the petty trading. She takes delivery of stock from the Kade central market. Her kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home.

Selling of foodstuffs has enabled her to rent a store in the marketplace where she distributes to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more foods such as maize, beans and vegetables, spices and smoked fish, etc. to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy a bulk supply of maize, groundnuts, and beans, etc.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine O. is 21 years old and married with a young daughter, Linda. She sells fish, Nile perch and omena (fingerlings), in the Kawangware area of Nairobi. She has been in business for four years and describes herself as a very focused and hardworking young woman.

Dorine successfully paid off a previous loan from Faulu for 20,000 KES. She says since she joined Faulu, she has been able to expand her trade and is now renting larger business premises. Dorine is requesting this loan for 40,000 KES from Faulu to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to become a supplier for the entire region and so be able to buy more household goods.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, a client of Asociación Arariwa, is a member of a communal bank consisting of 13 members in Cusco called Maquimanta Purisun (which in Quechua means "walking together hand in hand"). Betty, originally from Lima, is a 33-year-old single mother who now lives in Cusco with her two children, both of whom are in grade school.

Betty runs an auto accessories distribution business, purchasng accessories for cars (such as hubcaps and other adornments) in Lima, the capital of Peru, which she then sells in Cusco. She is now requesting a loan to buy additional inventory to supply her customers and thereby grow the business. She hopes to increase her income so that she can afford to buy a house. Betty thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Buy inventory for auto accessories business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is thirty-six years old. She is married and has four children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Juliana works hard to be able to provide for herself. She is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies to retailers. Juliana has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is 34 years old and is married to a businessman. She is the mother of one child.

Iyabo owns a boutique where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She stated this business three years ago and she says the business is moving along fine.

Iyabo is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more clothes, shoes, and bags to sell. She hopes to expand into a world-class boutique in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Silvia Gabriela

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa en Chinandega, la señora Silvia O. se dedica a atender su pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos comestibles tales como galletas, meneítos, golosinas y otros comestibles. También ella vende piezas de ropa para niños que exhibe en una vitrina.
Ella es madre de dos hijos a los que debe de brindarle las condiciones necesarias para que estudien. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, enlatados, leche, lácteos para ofrecerlos en la pulpería y así continuar mejorando sus condiciones del negocio y beneficiar a su amada familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Chichigalpa, in Chinandega, Silvia O. works in her general store, where she sells all sorts of edible products such as cookies, cheese puffs, candy and other foods. She also sells clothing, which she exhibits in a showcase. She is the mother of two children, and she needs to provide them with everything necessary so that they can continue in school. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest it in buying products such as rice, beans, cooking oil, canned foods, and milk and other dairy products for her store. This will allow her to continue improving her living conditions and providing benefits to her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products for her general store

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro P. V. de 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y junto a sus dos hijas de 14 y 4 años de edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Pedro reside en Sacacoyo, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual él posee su propio negocio, el cual es una venta de productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Desde hace alguno años atrás, Pedro decidió emprender su propio negocio, esto debido a la necesidad de contar con una fuente de ingresos, ya que él no contaba con un trabajo, y debido a la difícil situación a la que se enfrentaba, decidió no quedarse con los brazos cruzado e inició comprando algunos productos de primera necesidad para comercializar en su hogar, de esta manera poco a poco fue surtiendo su negocio. A  pesar de que cuenta con clientela fija, Pedro no ha podido suministrar la tienda con todo lo que sus clientes le piden. Es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo, con el fin de poder aumentar su inventario comprando productos como leche, embutidos, pan y otros más, los cuales incrementarían sus ventas, permitiéndole a Pedro, brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro P. V. is 44 years old. He lives with his wife, who works around the house, and with his 2 daughters, 14 and 4 years of age, who both study. Pedro resides in Sacacoyo, located in La Libertad department, a place where he has his own business selling grocery products and necessary household items. Several years ago Pedro decided to start his own business, owing to the neeed to have a stream of revenue, since he didn't have a job. In the face of this difficult situation he decided not to cross his arms and do nothing and began buying some grocery items to sell at his home. In this way, little by little, he began stocking his business. Although Pedro has steady customers he hasn't been able to supply the shop with all that his customers ask of him. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan, with the aim of being able to increase his inventory, purchasing products such as milk, cold meats, bread and other things, which will increase his sales and allow Pedro to give a better life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery products

loans.name: Isidro Santos

texts.es:
El señor Isidro Santos Z. es Pastor Evangelico de la Iglesia de Dios Pentescostes ubicada en la Colonia Henry Merrian, el recibe un salario de L. 10,000.00 mensuales, Isidro vive en la Populosa 
colonia Flor del Campo y es muy conocido por los vecinos, por su buen desempeño como lider cristiano de su Colonia, se caracteriza por ser muy honesto y responsable, esta casado con Doña Margelia Martinez, viven con una nieta a quien le ayudan con los estudios y la alimentacion,  Necesita el
prestamo para repellar y pulir un cuarto donde vive su hija y suegra, asi mismo quiere colocar ceramica.
Isidro con este credito va a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
el recurrio a solicitar un credito ya que no tiene dinero ahorrado para hacer las modificaciones en su casa de habitacion y con el salario que recibe cubre con la cuota mensual para el pago del credito.
texts.en:
El señor Isidro Santos Z. is Evangelical Pastor of the Pentecostal Church of God located in the Henry Merrian neighborhood. He receives a salary of 10,000.00 Lempiras ($530) monthly. He lives in the populous Flor del Campo (Flower of the Field) neighborhood and is well-known by his neighbors as an effective Christian leader. He is very honest and responsible. He is married to Doña Margelia Martinez. They live with a niece whom they help with studies and meals. He needs a loan to plaster and finish the room where his daughter and mother-in-law live. In addition, he wishes to have ceramic tile installed. With this loan, Isidro will improve the living conditions of his family. He has turned to applying for a loan because he has no money saved to make improvements in his home. He will be able to make timely loan repayments from his monthly salary.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cement, sand, ceramic tile, materials for plastering and remodeling his house

loans.name: Gomna

texts.en:
Gomna B. is 35 years old and is married. He lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé, Togo.

He runs a liquor store called “Maquis Bon ça va” where he sells a variety of alcoholic drinks including a local beverage called sodabi (a traditional liqueur, distilled from palm wine). He started this business in 2008 and is now asking for his first loan from WAGES. He will use this loan to restock his beverages. This loan will help Mr. B.’s business to grow and will keep his customers' thirsts quenched.

loans.use: to buy stock of liquors for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells sarongs to make a living; she hawks from street to street and from community to community. She is very happy with her business. She is planning to open her own shop so that she can stop hawking. She has been in the business for the past 13 years; with it, she helps her husband who works as a civil servant.
 
Mary, 42 years old, is married with three children and they live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria Esperanza tiene la actividad  económica de brindar el servicio de transporte. Ella inicia este negocio por su esposo ya que anteriormente era él quien se hacía cargo, pero debido a su edad no ha pudo seguir adelante pero Maria con sus 2 hijas lograron hacerse cargo del negocio, ya que tienen la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, ya que para ella es muy importante salir adelante ya que a su edad es muy difícil obtener un trabajo estable a pesar de las dificultades que enfrenta como es el descuido de parte de los usuarios con su vehículo. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo destinado para la inversión como es mejora del vehículo, soldaduras y reparaciones del camastro. Ella sueña con lograr comprar otra unidad.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza makes a living providing transportation services. Maria’s husband started this business and was previously in charge of it, but because of his age he was no longer able to get ahead. Maria took over the business with help from her 2 daughters because they needed to pay the household expenses. Getting ahead is very important to her, but at her age it is very difficult to get a stable job due to the difficulties that she faces such as her customers not taking proper care of her vehicle. She is asking for this loan for working capital, which she will invest in making improvements on the vehicle, including welding and repairing the bed of the vehicle. Her dream is to be able to purchase another vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for making improvements on her vehicle

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house on their own land. Her two daughters are 8 and 16 years old and attend a local secondary school. Her husband is taxi driver. 

Currently, Ariunaa operates a clothing-sales business at Narantuul market, the largest and most crowded market in the city. She operates a retail business and purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. She started her business in 2003 with working capital of 600,000 tugrug (about $146) and has expanded her business with a loyal customer base. Recently, in 2007-2009, Ariunaa and her husband purchased their own plot of land and built a house. Ariunaa is a very hardworking person. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad, a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan, owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 15 years. She is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in school and are getting an education. To give them a good education, Irshad operates a decorative embroidery business. She makes the embroidered dresses on order. She completes each dress in two days and gets a profit of Rs. 500 on each dress. She wishes to send her children to good colleges after completing their 10th standard. 

Her husband's name is M. M.. He operates a sanitary business. He has a sanitary shop in the market and he sells taps, water pipes etc. He has 20 years of experience in this business. His earning helps him to meet the financial expenses of the family.

Irshad has successfully completed two loans from Asasah. With the loan profit, she bought a color television and a fridge. Now she is applying for the third time for a loan from Asasah to invest in her husband’s sanitary business so he can purchase sanitary supplies (taps and water pipes) in bulk and increase the profit from his business.

loans.use: To purchase the sanitary supplies in bulk to sell

loans.name: Um-E-Arbab's Group

texts.en: Um-e-arbab is 30 years old and lives in an area of Lahore, Pakistan known as Babar Chowk. She leads a loan group made up of four people, and is married with four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in school and are doing especially well in reading. A caring lady, Um-e-arbab stays at home to raise her family. Her husband is Muhammad A. and he makes a living selling fruit. He has been in this business for the last seven years, and works hard traveling from area to area to sell his produce. Um-e-arbab has applied for this loan to help her husband expand his business by buying more in-season produce to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy in-season fruit to sell

loans.name: Faouziath

texts.fr: Née en 1986 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Faouziath vit depuis une douzaine d'année au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou. Faouziath n'est pas encore marié et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Faouziath vit donc seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Faouziath n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Faouziath mène comme activité, la vente d'habits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Faouziath s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo. Faouziath mène cette cette activité depuis sept ans et a déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé. Faouziath a bien effectué les remboursements. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Faouziath sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième prêt, en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1986 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Faouziath A. has been living for about twelve years in the Hlacomey district of Cotonou. She is still single and childless. So Faouziath is living alone and copes for her various expenses by herself. She did not attend school. In order to provide for her needs, Faouziath is selling clothes in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo. Faouziath has been running this business for over 7 years, and already obtained four loans from Alidé, which she repaid well. Due to the increasing demand from her customers, Faouziath is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé, in order to better satisfy her customers and to increase her income.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ready-made garments

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta M. is 42 and single with no children.  To earn a living, she plants and harvests taro for sale.  Mareta has many years of experience in this business.  Mareta needs a loan of WST$1000 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Mareta joined SPBD this year, and this will be her first loan from SPBD. SPBD's loans are Mareta's only access to capital because she has never been  able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva at 
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375 to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Federiko

texts.en:
Federiko, aged 30 years, is a married father of four children aged between 10 and 3 years. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a bicycle spare parts business and started as a mechanic one year ego. He wants to include motorcycle spare parts in his business in the near future.

He wants a loan to buy bicycle spare parts for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing bicycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Maberah Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Maberah” group, petty businesspeople in the township of Magburaka, in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 400,000 for each to enable them expand their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Idrissa F.. Forty-one-year-old Idrissa was born in Maberah village, is married to a businessman, and they have five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school. 

Idrissa sells fish, rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and groundnuts/peanuts. She will use her share of the loan to buy rice, palm oil, and groundnuts in large quantity to add to her business. 

(Attached to this photo are some snapshots of borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy fish, rice, palm oil and groundnuts

loans.name: Andia

texts.es:
La sSeñora Andia B. es soltera, vive con su madre de 90 años, ella es hija unica y le es dificil dejarla sola; por  esa razon trabaja en una actividad que le permita estar cerca de su madre.
Andia se dedica a la Venta de Joyas desde hace mas de 25 años, dicha actividad le permite solventar los  gastos del cuidado de su madre.
  Gracias al apoyo económico que le dio nuestra institución, ella pudó obtener de ésta actividad el maximo provecho sin descuidar a su madre.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra  de  Joyas, (tales como, aros, cadenas, pulceras de oro)  ya que tiene varios pedidos y así  brindar mayor  atencion   a sus clientes.
texts.en:
La Señora Andia B. is single and lives with her ninety-year-old mother. She is an only child, and it's difficult to leave her alone; therefore, she does work that permits her to stay close to her mother. Andia has sold jewelry for more than 25 years. This acitvity permits her to pay the expense of caring for her mother. Thanks to economic help from our institution, she was able to obtain maximum advantage from her work without neglecting her mother. The requested loan is for the purchase of jewelry (items such as hoops, chains, bracelets of gold). She already has various requests from customers and wishes to fulfill them promptly.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy earrings, chains and bracelets

loans.name: Eusebio Maximo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “José Carlos Mariátegui”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eusebio Máximo; el tiene 48  años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo, el socio trabaja albañil en forma independiente y también se dedica a cultivar productos en su pequeño terreno, el cultiva papa, maíz, verduras, el socio quiere mejorar el terreno de cultivo. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo. 	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eusebio Máximo, 48, is married and has one child. He works independently as a bricklayer but also farms his small plot of land. He grows potatoes, corn and vegetables. He wants to improve his farmland and is asking for funds to buy seed, manure and fertilizers to do so. He is a member of the “José Carlos Mariátegui” communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. He avails himself of this platform to express his gratitude to all those who share his dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha B. is from the village of Sto. Domingo. She is 47 years old. Editha is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Editha sells used clothing in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Editha is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Editha from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia N. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Vergenia is married and has seven grown children. To make a living, Vergenia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Vergenia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Vergenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Vergenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vergenia is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the third loan taken by Vergenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida T. is a 66-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food vending business. She lives in Sitio Suol, Barangay Nanunga, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10000. Aida is now borrowing PHP 18000 so that she could continue to fund the operations of her food products. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Aida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of food products.

loans.name: Oeur

texts.en:
Oeur M. is a 47-year-old village woman who has been a fish seller since she became single. She was married years ago, but divorced her husband.  She has five children: three are single, two are married.

Oeur M. currently gets fresh fish from one of her children and other fishermen, then sells it around her community in Siem Reap Province. 

She runs her business in the market and earns approximately  $3 a day. Oeur M. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan de 27 años, es pescador y vende pescados en el puerto donde todos los pescadores venden. Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Cuando él era joven el papa le enseño como pescar y obtener su propia comida el aprovecho lo que el papa le enseño y lo convirtió en su negocio. Compro redes y un motor para una canoa y comenzó a pescar en un mayor volumen para vender pescados en un puesto cerca de su casa. En la actualidad sale en la madrugada a pescar y regresa en la mañana para vender la libra de pescado a $ 2.50, la liba de camarón a $ 4.00.
