Con el préstamo quiere comprar redes, alises para su canoa y así tener más facilidad al pescar. En el futuro quiere tener una embarcación completa y tener una familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 27, is a fisherman and sells fish in the port where all the fishermen sell.  He lives in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador’s tourist destinations knows for its vast array of seafood.

When he was young his father taught him how to fish for his own food.  He took advantage of what his father taught him and turned it into a business.  He bought nets and a motor for his canoe and started fishing larger quantities to sell fish in a stand near his home.  Currently, he goes out at dawn to fish and returns in the morning to sell fish at $2.50 a pound and shrimp at $4.00 a pound.

He will use the loan to buy nets and propellers for his canoe to fish more easily.  In the future he’d like to have a complete boat and to have a family.

loans.use: For nets and propellers.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 26 años, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, negocio que posee desde hace 4 años, ella comenzó a vender con su madre, pero luego se independizo y hoy posee su propio negocio, el horario de venta es de 8:00am a 4:00pm, por el momento ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, este préstamo le ayudara a comprar los materiales necesarios para preparar las tortillas y poder disponer de mayor cantidad el inventario.
Ella espera crecer atendiendo a más clientes, aspira tener el negocio establecido en el mercado municipal ya que ahí podrá tener mejores oportunidades de aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old.  She lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with her husband and her 3 year-old child.  She sells tortillas, a business which she has had for 4 years.  She started selling with her mother but then became independent and now she has her own business.  She sells her tortillas from 8.00am to 4.00pm.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn and firewood.  This loan will help her to buy the materials she needs to make her tortillas and have a larger inventory.

Ana hopes to grow in her business, serving more customers.  She aspires to have an established business in the town market because she will have better opportunities to increase her sales there.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with a grown son, Igor. She is a farmer from Kamenka. Natalya grows early spring vegetables. She owns four big heated greenhouses and two separate farming land lots. Natalya has been working in agriculture for 26 years. She has already invested about 85,000 UAH in this business. Her expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 20,000 to 23,000 UAH.
Natalya is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to be invested in construction of a new greenhouse. Natalya is hoping to build several more greenhouses in the future thus expanding her business. In addition to her farming business, Natalya has recently opened a grocery store that she runs with her husband.

loans.use: To invest in construction of a new greenhouse

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Grimanesa; ella tiene 50 años de edad, viuda y tiene 8 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de picantería lugar donde venden comida típica y cerveza  la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo esta la única actividad que realiza, la socia es una persona muy alegre y con ganas de seguir adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como carne,arroz,azúcar entre otros mas para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Grimanesa is a member of the "SAN VALENTIN" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Grimanesa is 50 years old, widowed, and has 8 children.  Her business is a restaurant where she sells traditional food and beer.  She has been in this business for years and it is the only business activity that she carries out.  She is a very cheerful person who wishes to get ahead in life. 

Grimanesa is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as meat, rice, sugar, etc. for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business such as meat, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S. lives in the Kitawuluzi Lubaga road neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, none of whom are in school.  

Maria has a business of selling phone usage and stationery. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Maria sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Maria has requested a loan of 50,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to more SIM packs, airtime, books, pens and reams of papers. She also generates additional income through selling raw food.

The main business challenges for Maria include competition and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only. 

Maria lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more SIM packs, airtime, books, pens and reams of papers

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana, 57 years old, is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is married and has three children. To make a living, Cayetana owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. 

Cayetana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cayetana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cayetana is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used bags

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto, tiene 47 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Maranura de la provincia de la Convenciones y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba.

Humberto se dedica a la construcción de su casa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Humberto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de la casa. 

Humberto pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Humberto is 47 years old and has 2 children.  He was born in the city of Maranura in the province of La Convenciones.  He is currently living in the city of Urubamba.

Humberto has a construction business that he runs from his house.  He has already had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  Humberto is requesting a loan to do maintenance to his house.

Humberto belongs to the communal bank "Mainique" in the Asociación Arariwa, and he is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means.  He pledges to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Ma. Luzviminda

texts.en:
Ma. Luzviminda is a married woman from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She is 43 years old and has 4 children. The oldest child is 16 years old. Three of her children go to school. Ma. Luzviminda does her best to sustain their education.

Ma. Luzviminda is engaged in farming. She grows and sells rice. She wishes to put up a sari-sari store to earn an extra income.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Victorino Tomas

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca el  Panal, tiene 42años de vivir en esta dirección trabaja en el centro de salud telica donde tiene 24 años de trabajar para esta empresa  y comenzó ha trabajar como técnico  en salud hoy trabajando como jefe de brigada de  E T V R. y está solicitando para mejoramiento de vivienda con el fin de crear mejores condiciones a su vivienda y mejorar su nivel de vida a su familia, este señor esta solicitando atraves del convenio con el centro de salud telica,es el primer crédito que recibe para tal efecto antes descrito,
texts.en: He is originally from the community of El Panal. He has been living at this address for 42 years. He works at the Telica health centre and he has had 24 years with the company. He works as a health technician and he is the chief of his section. He requests a loan to make improvements to his home. His goal is to improve the state of the house and to improve the quality of life of his family. He requests this loan through the health centre in Telica. It is the first loan that he receives through the aforementioned organization.

loans.use: to improve his house and to purchase beams, cement, and ceramic tiles

loans.name: Concepcion Yamileth

texts.es:
Concepción, reside en Delicias de Concepción departamento de Morazán, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, el ultimo de 4 meses, ella se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de hamacas, cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, se dedica a tiempo completo.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de hilo de seda de diferentes colores, con esta compra tendrá lo necesario para elaborar y ofrecer a los clientes más producto.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos con lo necesario pero sobre todo que estudien y se preparen para que se defiendan en el futuro, también es su objetivo tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Concepción lives in Delicias de Concepción in the department of Morazán. She is 25 years old, lives with her husband, and has three children, 10 years old, 4 years old, and the youngest of 4 months. She works making and selling hammocks. With eight years of experience, she works full time.

She needs a loan for the purchase of silk thread of various colors. With this purchase she will have the necessary materials to create and offer more products to her clients.

Her goal is to help her children with their needs, above all that they can study and prepare themselves to thrive in the future. She also has a goal of having her own home.

loans.use: purchase silk thread of various colors.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman G. is a widower with children who are all grown up and married. His wife passed on last year, but he appreciates the fact that he has over 20 grandchildren who normally pay him visits during the school holidays.

G. is a poultry farmer who buys small chicks and later resells them after raising them well. He has been in this business for more than 6 years and gets a monthly income of Kshs 30,000.

G. is a new client in KADET and he has applied for his first loan, which he will use to buy 100 more chicks and feed. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to help his sons and daughters to pay school fees for his grandchildren.

He hopes to have a very stable business and to see his grandchildren grow and be well educated.

loans.use: to add 100 more chicks to raise.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 34 years old and married with three children.  He runs a curio shop to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to keep business records.  This has helped him to manage his business well.

He hopes to expand his business and employ more people.  He has requested 40,000 KES to buy carvings, paints and African design fabric.

loans.use: to buy carvings, paints and African design fabric

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luis de 40 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Enrique de 15 y Salome de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En el puesto de comida de Rosa lo que menos le faltan son clientes, ya que está ubicado cerca de los aserraderos de Pucallpa. Sus principales comensales son aquellas personas que trabajan en el aserradero, que luego de una larga mañana de trabajo, no dudan en comer los deliciosos platos que ella prepara. Los precios que ofrece a sus clientes, son muy accesibles y este es el principal gancho de su puesto de comida. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es cocinar y saber que sus clientes reconozcan su trabajo; sin embargo ella sola no se da abasto y a veces a tendido dificultad para atender a todos sus clientes. Su mayor anhelo es que su negocio se desarrolle, pero para ello debe trabajar muy duro para conseguirlo, por tal razón espera que ustedes la ayuden con un pequeño préstamo. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más sillas y mesas para mejorar la atención en su puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old.  She is a kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 40 year-old Luis, and her two beloved children - 15 year-old Enrique and 2 year-old Salome - who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

What Rosa's food stall least lacks is customers since it is located near the Pucallpa sawmills.  Her main diners are the people who work in the sawmills.  After a long morning's work, they don't hesitate to come and eat the delicious meals that Rosa prepares.  The prices that she offers are very affordable and this is the main 'bait' that she uses on her food stall to attract customers.

Rosa has been in this business for five years and what she most enjoys about her work is cooking and knowing that her customers are appreciative of her work.  However, Rosa finds it hard to manage alone and sometimes she has found it difficult to serve all her customers.  Her greatest wish is to develop her business.  In order to achieve this, she must work very hard.  For this reason, she hopes that you will help her with a small loan.

This is Rosa's second loan from MFP and, as was the case with her first loan, she is ready to make all her repayments on time.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank who is respected for the responsibility that she displays.  Rosa will use the 800 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more tables and chairs in order to improve her service.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada en diferentes partes de la ciudad.
  Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía como es ropa para hombre, niños, accesoria para bebe y quiere también vender aparatos electrónicos. 
Doña Esperanza espera contar con su cooperación en este crédito ya que para ella es muy importante, porque es la fuente de ingreso para su familia. 
Desea mejorar su negocio y que sus clientes puedan encontrar sus necesidades de vestir con ella.
texts.en: Señora Esperanza has been selling used clothing in various parts of the city for more than three years .  She is requesting a loan as she needs to add more variety to her merchandise such as clothing for men and children and baby accessories.  She also wants to sell electronic devices.  Doña Esperanza hopes to have your support with this loan since it is very important for her because this is her family's source of income.  She wants to improve her business and she also wants her customers to be able to find the clothing they need with her.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Aurelia Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia Antonia es casada, tiene 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de fajas típicas, inicio este trabajo no siendo de ella propiamente y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia trabajando ya propiamente.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo, el dinero lo utilizara para comprar materiales para elaborar mas tejido, compra de hilo de diferentes clases  y colores, espera mejorar su negocio con la inversión que hace.
texts.en:
Aurelia Antonia is 45 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has three children, two of whom are in school.  Aurelia's business is weaving traditional belts. When she started this work, she did not work for herself.  She now has three years experience working for herself.

Aurelia has decided to request a loan that will help her to expand her working capital.  She will use the money to buy materials for doing more weaving work.  She will buy different classes and colors of thread.  She hopes to improve her business with this investment.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: "Dentro de 5 años me veo dirigiendo un centro de cómputo grande y desarrollando sistemas de información de acuerdo a las nuevas tecnologías de información. Me inspira el conocimiento de estar al tanto de las nuevas tecnologías y conocer hacia donde se dirige el mundo. La diferencia entre muchos estudiantes y yo es la experiencia y el interés que tengo, el deseo de aprender nuevas cosas. El finalizar esta segunda carrera ha sido un desafio por el tiempo que requiere tanto de asistencia como de estudio en casa, las obligaciones en el trabajo ha sido un limitante que lo he superado a base de eficiencia y planificación. Me voy a graduar de Ingeniero en Sistemas".
texts.en: “Within five years I see myself managing a large computing center and developing information systems built on the latest information technologies.  I’m inspired by the knowledge of being up with the latest technologies and knowing in which direction the world is going.  The difference between me and many other students is the experience and interest that I have in learning new things.  Completing this course of study has been a challenge because of the time required in attending class as well as studying at home.  Work obligations have also been a limiting factor that I have overcome through planning and efficiency.  I’m going to graduate as a systems engineer.”

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: La señora Amanda es originaria de una población muy rica en cultura ya que muy cerca de su localidad se encuentran unas ruinas arqueológicas que son la atracción de su población. Doña Amanda tiene 29 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de dulces y frituras fuera de su casa desde hace 2 años y también vende cena fuera de su casa por las noches como tortas, quesadillas, enchiladas, tacos dorados y cada quince días hace pozole. Esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de dulces de diferentes sabores, chicharrones e insumos para elaborar la cena que vende. Doña Amanda es una mujer muy luchadora ya que es madre soltera de dos pequeños niños que estudian la primaria y ella esta trabajando muy duro para salir adelante con sus hijos. La meta que tiene Amanda es que sus hijos tengan una carrera ya que es la única herencia que ella les puede dejar.
texts.en:
Amanda is originally from a town that is very rich in culture because it is very close to the archeological ruins that are the town’s attraction.

Amanda, age 29, has been selling sweets and fried food outside of her house for two years.  She also sells dinner outside of her house in the evenings.  She sells dinners like sandwiches, quesadillas, enchiladas, and crispy tacos.  Every two weeks she makes “pozole” (a traditional soup).

She is requesting a loan to buy different flavors of sweets, “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds), and supplies to make the dinners that she sells.

Amanda is a very tenacious woman.  She is the single mother of two young children who are in elementary school.  She is working very hard in order to get her children ahead.  Amanda’s goal is for her children to have a career.  It it the only inheritance she is able to leave them.

loans.use: to sell Mexican street food and sweets.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 49 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
DesD. hace cuatro años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta D. abarrotes, también se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados vacunos  y a la agricultura.
Su nuevo préstamo es por la suma D.  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes como leche, arroz, azúcar, harina, huevo, combustible, etc. Toda la mercadería la compra en Ilave.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos, su esposo trabaja como transportista.
Su sueño es tener un carro para uso personal y para comprar mercaderías.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas Unidas D. Titicaca” (The United Little Stars of Titicaca) which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 49 years old, married, and has five children. Aurora has a high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past four years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and was invested in her grocery business. Aurora also buys and sells cattle and engages in farming.

Her new loan in the amount of 3000 PEN will be invested in the purchase of groceries such as milk, rice, sugar, flour, eggs, fuel, and other products. She buys all of her merchandise in Ilave. Her children help her with the business while her husband works as a truck driver.

Aurora’s dream is to have a car for personal use and to buy more merchandise. What she likes most about the Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, sugar, flour, eggs, fuel, and other products.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 39, is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Vilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Vilma requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Kelly Janneth

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Para Un Futuro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Kelly, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 7 y 5 años de edad, el mayor vive con los abuelos en El Triunfo en la provincia del Guayas ciudad de la que es oriunda nuestra amiga y los dos menores viven con ella y estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer y también se dedica a la agricultura. Ella aprendió belleza en una academia en la ciudad de Azogues ciudad en la cual vivió por 3 años.
 
Ella es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora que comparte su tiempo entre su hogar y sus actividades diarias, ella realiza todo tipo de trabajos de belleza como: tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas y otros trabajos, nos cuenta que dia a dia llegan muchos clientes hasta su casa para realizarse trabajos de arreglo personal. Además también realiza el crédito para darle a su esposo el cual siembra arroz y verduras en el campo.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando tintes y permanentes y para el negocio de su esposo el cual va a comprar abonos y fertilizantes para tener una buena producción. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la institución.
  
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser profesional para conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte the communal bank of Trabajando Para Un Futuro meets every 15 days. This place is well known for the delicious sweets made by the locals which are known throughout the country and for the warmth of its friendly, hardworking people.

Here we met Señora Kelly. She is 27 years old and is married. She has 3 children from the marriage aged 14, 7 and 5 years. The eldest lives with the grandparents in El Triunfo in the province of Guayas, a city our friend is a native of. The two minors live with her and study at school. Her husband is a driver and also works in agriculture. She studied at a beauty academy in the city of Azogues where she lived for 3 years.
 
She is a very active and hardworking woman who divides her time between her home and her daily activities. She gives all kinds of beauty treatments such as: hairdying, nailpainting, haircuts, and other such treatments. She tells us a lot of clients come to her house every day to have beauty treatments. In addition, she also makes money to give to her husband who sows rice and vegetables in the fields.

She is going to invest this loan in her business buying dyes and perms and in her husband's business to buy manure and fertilizers in order to have a good crop. She is a founding member of the communal bank, the treasurer for the group and she enjoys the support provided by the institution.

Her dreams are to complete her studies and become a professional in order to obtain a good job.

loans.use: to buy dyes, perms, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema has been able to repay her first Kiva loan fully and she is taking out a bigger loan of 40,000 KES. With the loan, she intends to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and beans for her food stall business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Seirosa

texts.en:
Seirosa is 24 years of age and a single woman with no children. Seirosa owns & operates a business baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.  Seirosa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Seirosa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Seirosa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children.  Sally has a shop that sells used spare parts, like wheels or tires. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional used wheels and tires.  Sally has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Sally hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional used spare parts, like wheels or tires

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en: Ulambayar is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to adjust and decorate his house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate his house

loans.name: Waddah

texts.en: Waddah is a 23-year-old young man.  He has an Internet cafe, which is his only source of income.  Waddah wants to expand his cafe to increase his income by purchasing more computers but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for them, so he needs to borrow a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Waddah gets the loan he will be able to purchase more computers and increase the size of his cafe.  This will increase the number of customers to his cafe and increase his income.  Waddah is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more computers for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Julia Nunu

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman who has three children between five and 10 years old. For the past seven years, she has been running a grocery store. Julia describes herself as honest and ambitious. Her business is located at Athiru-Gaiti in Maua town and her biggest challenge is the cost of buying goods.

Julia is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to add stock to her store. Her business goal is to run a hardware store within five years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and has five children. She is 57 years old and lives in Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lolita has owned and operated a farm for 3 years, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She earns PHP 1,500 monthly from this business. Lolita has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Lolita has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Lolita wants to make improvements to her house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. María se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  hace ya bastante tiempo, vive en casa de su hermano, La cliente es soltera sin hijos, le va muy bien con su negocio ya que por el tiempo que vende ya sabe de donde proveerse de mercadería a un bajo precio, la Sra. María solicito el crédito para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor como arroz y fideo y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo  por las fiestas de fin de año ya que estas épocas  tendrá más demanda de sus productos, la Sra. María es una persona joven responsable con ganas de superación, esta es su única fuente de trabajo para mantenerse a ella y a su hermano, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María has been selling groceries for some time now.  She lives in her brother’s house, is single, and has no children.  Her business is going very well for her.  Because of the amount of time she has been selling she knows where to stock up on merchandise at a low price.

María requested the loan to buy groceries like rice and noodles wholesale.  This way she will increase her working capital for the end of the year festivities.  There will be a greater demand for her products during this season.  

María is a responsible young person who has the desire to improve herself.  This is her only source of work to support her brother and herself.  She is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Edjromede Group

texts.fr: EDJROMEDE est un groupement constitué de quinze personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Adjoavi. Les membres du groupement résident dans le même village. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Adjoavi est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Appolinaire. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, mais trois restent à leur charge. Adjoavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il  y a une vingtaine d'année,  Adjoavi fait la production de fromages au soja, qu'elle vend à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adjoavi vend des poissons, des condiments et du maïs à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer sans grande difficulté les charges de ses enfants. Adjoavi achète ses produits dans sa région. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Adjoavi et aux autres membres du groupement EDJROMEDE, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The Edjromede group is made up of 15 people who all live in the same village. The group is requesting their first loan from ALIDé so that they can increase their working capital.

Adjoavi, the woman in the picture with her hand raised, is the group´s representative. She is 39 years old and married to a farmer called Appolinaire. The couple have 7 children, some of whom go to school. 3 of the children are still dependent on their parents.

Adjoavi has no formal education. For the past 20 years, she has been making soya cheese which she sells from her home. She also sells fish, condiments and corn from her home. She gets her supplies in her local area. The income from her business activities allows her to take care of her children without much difficulty.

This loan will enable Adjoavi and the other members of the Edjromede group to boost their business activities, increase their customer base and raise their revenue levels.

loans.use: to buy a bag of soya with which to make cheese.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: La señora Placida es costurera y elabora polleras, mantas y centros para las señoras de pollera. El crédito lo requiere para compra de materia prima como ser telas para rellenos, para enaguas, para mantas. Placida es madre soltera  y tiene seis  hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de  Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la sexta vez que trabaja junto a kiva y la octava vez que solicita un crédito de Impro.
texts.en:
Placida is a seamstress.  She makes traditional Andean skirts, fringed shawls, and underskirts for "Pollera" women (Pollera is a national costume).

She needs the loan to buy raw material like fabric for wadding, petticoats, and shawls.

Placida is a single mother, and she has six children.  She lives in her own house in the Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the sixth time that she has worked together with Kiva, and it is the eighth time that she has requested a loan from Impro.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make  traditional Andean skirts, fringed shawls, and underskirts for "Pollera" women (Pollera is a national costume).

loans.name: Virginia Griselda

texts.es:
Virginia Griselda tiene 53 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos de 29, 13 y 12 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Virginia se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjolde ciclo corto. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá arrendar más terreno y sembrar un poco más.

El sueño es poder comprarse una casa que tenga jardín. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Virginia Griselda, 53, is a single mother of three children; she lives with her children who are 29, 13 and 12 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “La Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas Frías which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It’s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.

Virginia is a short cycle corn and bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, urea, fertilizer and liquids.  With support from the loan he’ll be able to lease more land and plant a bit more.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house with a garden.  In her free time she likes to go out on outings.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer, urea and liquids.

loans.name: Dina Eudocia

texts.es: La cliente vive en la ciudad de Durán.  Empezó su negocio cuando invirtió sus ahorros de toda la vida en montar su tienda propia.  De esta forma, ha ido creciendo poco a poco hasta el día de hoy.  Trabaja todo el día desde el interior de su casa.  Es madre soltera y sus hijos ya son mayores de edad.  Ellos le ayudan en todo lo que necesita con frecuencia.  Ahora desea invertir el crédito en la compra de carne, botellones de agua y abarrotes para la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the city of Durán.  She started her business when she invested all of her savings into establishing this venture.  By taking this approach, she was able to grow a little bit at a time to the point where she is at today.  The borrower works every day at her business, which is located inside of her house.  She is a single mother and her children are already grown.  They help out quite frequently with everything that needs to be done.  

For now, the borrower wants to invest her loan in the purchase of meat, bottle water, and groceries that she can sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, bottle water, and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 27-year-old farmer from Trans Nzoia village in the North Rift region of Kenya. He owns a 0.3-acre piece of land that is home to his family. With the support of his wife, Stephen does mixed farming. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs, and tea produced at the farm enables him to provide a decent living for his family of 2 children.He also does some side hustle business(motorbike business).He also uses the income from farming to pay for his children's education. Stephen is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow to add to the two cows he already owns. Dairy farming is a good, sustainable source of income for farmers like Stephen. As time goes by, children grow, and family expenses also soar. The only way a farmer such as Stephen can cope with this change is by scaling the business to earn more income. The additional cow will produce more milk for sale and increase the family's income. With more income, Stephen will be able to meet the increasing demands of his family and grow his asset base. Some of the profits from this investment will be ploughed back into the business to facilitate its growth.  Stephen needs a bit of help, and it can be you who collaborates with him, with just one loan.
Be inspired during this festive season and make a loan!

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has nine children plus his wife. He started a small scale business of food kiosk.

Village Enterprise Fund donated 100 dollars to enable them boost their business in 2001.

Right now their hotel business is doing very well. After attending several training organised by VEF, he has decided to start another business along side the hotel. This is carpentry workshop. Patrick is a carpenter by training and has a great talent for making beautiful things out of wood. Local carpenters like Patrick make items that are in high demand such as chairs, table, doors, small stools, beds, and sometimes coffins. He uses muvule timber, which is the best timber in the whole of Africa!

He is capable of handling the loan money. Given a loan of 500 dollars, he plans to buy the following materials: more muvule trees for timber, a used power saw, already splited timbers etc.

loans.use: Buy a power saw, trees and lumber
